translation.en: If we don't get this wish, the division between the people who think short term and long term will be terrible, between the U.S. and China, between poor countries and rich, and most of all the lives of those two billion will be far worse.
translation.zh: 如果我们没法实现这个愿望 考虑短期目标和长期目标的人们之间会有巨大分歧 美国与中国，穷国和富国之间, 会有巨大分歧 而二十亿人最穷的人中大多数的生活会极大恶化

translation.en: So, what do we have to do?
translation.zh: 那么我们必须做什么？

translation.en: What am I appealing to you to step forward and drive?
translation.zh: 我恳求你们参与推动的到底是什么？

translation.en: We need to go for more research funding.
translation.zh: 我们应该增加研究资助

translation.en: When countries get together in places like Copenhagen, they shouldn't just discuss the CO2.
translation.zh: 在像哥本哈根这样的会议上 各国不应该只讨论二氧化碳减排日程表

translation.en: They should discuss this innovation agenda, and you'd be stunned at the ridiculously low levels of spending on these innovative approaches.
translation.zh: 也应该讨论创新的日程表 对这些创新方法的投入之低 绝对会让你震惊

translation.en: We do need the market incentives -- CO2 tax, cap and trade -- something that gets that price signal out there.
translation.zh: 我们确实需要一些市场激励，二氧化碳税费，限额和交易 用这些东西来发出价格信号

translation.en: We need to get the message out.
translation.zh: 我们需要把信息传出去

translation.en: We need to have this dialogue be a more rational, more understandable dialogue, including the steps that the government takes.
translation.zh: 我们应该让这一对话更加理性，更加易于理解 包括政府所采取的措施

translation.en: This is an important wish, but it is one I think we can achieve.
translation.zh: 这是一个重要的愿望，并且我觉得这是一个可以实现的愿望

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: (Applause) Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢 谢谢

translation.en: Chris Anderson: Thank you. Thank you.
translation.zh: 主持人：谢谢

translation.en: (Applause) Thank you. So to understand more about TerraPower, right -- I mean, first of all, can you give a sense of what scale of investment this is?
translation.zh: 谢谢 谢谢，我对Terrapower更了解了 首先，你能大概说下这个投资会是多大规模吗？

translation.en: Bil Gates: To actually do the software, buy the supercomputer, hire all the great scientists, which we've done, that's only tens of millions, and even once we test our materials out in a Russian reactor to make sure that our materials work properly, then you'll only be up in the hundreds of millions.
translation.zh: 比尔盖茨：如果只是买超级计算机, 做出软件 雇佣优秀的科学家，这些我们已经做到了 大概只用几千万 我们甚至去一个俄罗斯的反应堆测试了我们的材料 看看它是否能够正常工作 加起来也不过花费几个亿

translation.en: The tough thing is building the pilot reactor; finding the several billion, finding the regulator, the location that will actually build the first one of these.
translation.zh: 最难的是建造试验反应堆 筹措几十亿，找到管理者，选定地点 这样才能建起第一座这样的核电站

translation.en: Once you get the first one built, if it works as advertised, then it's just clear as day, because the economics, the energy density, are so different than nuclear as we know it.
translation.zh: 当你建起第一座后，如果它确实像说的那样有用， 那一切就都简单了，因为它的经济性、能源密度 与我们所熟悉的核能完全不同

translation.en: CA: And so, to understand it right, this involves building deep into the ground almost like a vertical kind of column of nuclear fuel, of this sort of spent uranium, and then the process starts at the top and kind of works down?
translation.zh: 主持人：那么，是不是说，这需要往地下建造 一个用这种废弃铀建成的垂直核燃料柱 一个用这种废弃铀建成的垂直核燃料柱 然后反应从上往下渐进？

translation.en: BG: That's right. Today, you're always refueling the reactor, so you have lots of people and lots of controls that can go wrong: that thing where you're opening it up and moving things in and out, that's not good.
translation.zh: 盖茨：没错。现在的核反应堆, 你得不停的重新加燃料 所以有很多人为因素和控制可能出错 你需要打开反应堆, 把核燃料搬进搬出，这些都可能出错，一点儿不保险 你需要打开反应堆, 把核燃料搬进搬出，这些都可能出错，一点儿不保险

translation.en: So, if you have very cheap fuel that you can put 60 years in -- just think of it as a log -- put it down and not have those same complexities.
translation.zh: 所以，如果有非常便宜的燃料，一根木柱的大小，就够使用60年 所以，如果有非常便宜的燃料，一根木柱的大小，就够使用60年 把它放下，没有那些复杂的后果

translation.en: And it just sits there and burns for the 60 years, and then it's done.
translation.zh: 放那儿烧个六十年，然后没了

translation.en: CA: It's a nuclear power plant that is its own waste disposal solution.
translation.zh: 主持人：那样的核电站本身就是自身废弃物的处理站

translation.en: BG: Yeah. Well, what happens with the waste, you can let it sit there -- there's a lot less waste under this approach -- then you can actually take that, and put it into another one and burn that.
translation.zh: 盖茨：没错。这个过程产生的垃圾 你可以放在那儿，用这种办法只产生很少的废料 你也可以把它放到另外一个核电站里烧掉 你也可以把它放到另外一个核电站里烧掉

translation.en: And we start off actually by taking the waste that exists today, that's sitting in these cooling pools or dry casking by reactors -- that's our fuel to begin with.
translation.zh: 我们可以从处理现有核电站产生的垃圾开始 那些现在在冷却池或者反应堆旁的干罐里的废物 这是我们开始时的燃料

translation.en: So, the thing that's been a problem from those reactors is actually what gets fed into ours, and you're reducing the volume of the waste quite dramatically as you're going through this process.
translation.zh: 这样，当前那些反应堆自身的麻烦，却成为我们的原料，同时还大大减少了废物 这样，当前那些反应堆自身的麻烦，却成为我们的原料，同时还大大减少了废物 这样，当前那些反应堆自身的麻烦，却成为我们的原料，同时还大大减少了废物 这样，当前那些反应堆自身的麻烦，却成为我们的原料，同时还大大减少了废物

translation.en: CA: I mean, you're talking to different people around the world about the possibilities here.
translation.zh: 主持人：你和其他地方的人的谈话中 谈到这些可能性的时候

translation.en: Where is there most interest in actually doing something with this?
translation.zh: 哪些人对实施这件事兴趣最大？

translation.en: BG: Well, we haven't picked a particular place, and there's all these interesting disclosure rules about anything that's called "nuclear," so we've got a lot of interest, that people from the company have been in Russia, India, China -- I've been back seeing the secretary of energy here, talking about how this fits into the energy agenda.
translation.zh: 盖茨：我们还没有选定一个特定的地方 由于到处都有关于核问题的保密规定 很多人表示了兴趣 俄罗斯，印度，中国的公司都表现了浓厚的兴趣 我也曾经在这里找过能源部长 谈论如何将这件事融入能源日程表

translation.en: So I'm optimistic. You know, the French and Japanese have done some work.
translation.zh: 总地来说我很乐观，同时，法国和日本已经做了一些工作

translation.en: This is a variant on something that has been done.
translation.zh: 这是已有成就的一个变体

translation.en: It's an important advance, but it's like a fast reactor, and a lot of countries have built them, so anybody who's done a fast reactor is a candidate to be where the first one gets built.
translation.zh: 这是一个重要的进步，但像一个快速反应堆 很多国家已经修建了这样的反应堆 只要你已经有了快速反应堆，就可能成为第一个核垃圾重利用站的建设者

translation.en: CA: So, in your mind, timescale and likelihood of actually taking something like this live?
translation.zh: 主持人：就你看来，实现这一计划的时间跨度和可能性如何？ 主持人：就你看来，实现这一计划的时间跨度和可能性如何？

translation.en: BG: Well, we need -- for one of these high-scale, electro-generation things that's very cheap, we have 20 years to invent and then 20 years to deploy.
translation.zh: 盖茨：建一个这种大规模的电站，并且成本要非常低 盖茨：建一个这种大规模的电站，并且成本要非常低 我们有20年时间来发明，再有20年时间来执行

translation.en: That's sort of the deadline that the environmental models have shown us that we have to meet.
translation.zh: 这大致也是我们的环境模型所计算出的最终期限 这大致也是我们的环境模型所计算出的最终期限

translation.en: And, you know, TerraPower, if things go well -- which is wishing for a lot -- could easily meet that.
translation.zh: 如果Terrapower一切顺利的话，当然那样会很不容易，可以很容易地满足这一要求 如果Terrapower一切顺利的话，当然那样会很不容易，可以很容易地满足这一要求

translation.en: And there are, fortunately now, dozens of companies -- we need it to be hundreds -- who, likewise, if their science goes well, if the funding for their pilot plants goes well, that they can compete for this.
translation.zh: 目前还有数十家公司在从事这一事业 我们需要几百家 如果它们科研进展顺利 如果他们的试验电站的筹资顺利 他们都可以竞争这项任务

translation.en: And it's best if multiple succeed, because then you could use a mix of these things.
translation.zh: 如果能够多方成功那是最好 因为这样就可以同时利用多种方式

translation.en: We certainly need one to succeed.
translation.zh: 但我们至少需要一种能够成功

translation.en: CA: In terms of big-scale possible game changes, is this the biggest that you're aware of out there?
translation.zh: 主持人：如果说到可能的大规模的创新 这个是不是你知道的最大的一个

translation.en: BG: An energy breakthrough is the most important thing.
translation.zh: 盖茨：能源的突破是最重要的事

translation.en: It would have been, even without the environmental constraint, but the environmental constraint just makes it so much greater.
translation.zh: 即使没有环境的限制，它还会是最重要的问题 环境的限制使它变得更为突出，更为紧迫

translation.en: In the nuclear space, there are other innovators.
translation.zh: 在核领域，还有其它的创新者

translation.en: You know, we don't know their work as well as we know this one, but the modular people, that's a different approach.
translation.zh: 但我对他们的工作,我们没有像对这个项目一样清楚 有些人在模块方面的创新,是另外一种方式

translation.en: There's a liquid-type reactor, which seems a little hard, but maybe they say that about us.
translation.zh: 还有一种液态反应堆，实现起来有点困难 但也许他们看我们的方式也觉得困难

translation.en: And so, there are different ones, but the beauty of this is a molecule of uranium has a million times as much energy as a molecule of, say, coal, and so -- if you can deal with the negatives, which are essentially the radiation -- the footprint and cost, the potential, in terms of effect on land and various things, is almost in a class of its own.
translation.zh: 所以，有很多不同的办法 但核能的美妙之处在于, 一个铀分子所含的能量是其它能源（比如煤）的一百万倍 但核能的美妙之处在于, 一个铀分子所含的能量是其它能源（比如煤）的一百万倍 如果能够处理好负面因素，主要是辐射 如果能够处理好负面因素，主要是辐射 其碳排放、成本以及潜能潜能，就其各种因素而言，将是无与伦比的 其碳排放、成本以及潜能潜能，就其各种因素而言，将是无与伦比的 其碳排放、成本以及潜能潜能，就其各种因素而言，将是无与伦比的

translation.en: CA: If this doesn't work, then what?
translation.zh: 主持人；如果我们没能成功怎么办？

translation.en: Do we have to start taking emergency measures to try and keep the temperature of the earth stable?
translation.zh: 我们得采取什么紧急措施 来保证地球温度的稳定？

translation.en: BG: If you get into that situation, it's like if you've been over-eating, and you're about to have a heart attack: Then where do you go? You may need heart surgery or something.
translation.zh: 盖茨：如果事情发展到那一步 就像吃的太多，可能会得心脏病一样 怎么办？你可能需要心脏手术之类的

translation.en: There is a line of research on what's called geoengineering, which are various techniques that would delay the heating to buy us 20 or 30 years to get our act together.
translation.zh: 有一种研究叫做地球工程学 通过各种技术来延缓全球变暖 可以为我们争取20-30年的时间来共同行动

translation.en: Now, that's just an insurance policy.
translation.zh: 不过,那就像是一个保险政策

translation.en: You hope you don't need to do that.
translation.zh: 你希望你不会用到

translation.en: Some people say you shouldn't even work on the insurance policy because it might make you lazy, that you'll keep eating because you know heart surgery will be there to save you.
translation.zh: 有些人说根本不应该研究保险措施 因为这会使人懈怠 你会持续进食，反正你知道心脏手术可以挽救你

translation.en: I'm not sure that's wise, given the importance of the problem, but there's now the geoengineering discussion about -- should that be in the back pocket in case things happen faster, or this innovation goes a lot slower than we expect?
translation.zh: 考虑到问题的重要性，我不知道这样是否明智 现在关于地球工程的讨论 应该作为一个后备选择, 以防形势恶化得更快 或者技术创新迟于我们的预期

translation.en: CA: Climate skeptics: If you had a sentence or two to say to them, how might you persuade them that they're wrong?
translation.zh: 主持人：对气候变化论的怀疑者, 如果让你对他们说一两句话 你会怎么说服他们？

translation.en: BG: Well, unfortunately, the skeptics come in different camps.
translation.zh: 盖茨：很不幸，怀疑论者来自不同阵营

translation.en: The ones who make scientific arguments are very few.
translation.zh: 他们中很少持有科学证据

translation.en: Are they saying that there's negative feedback effects that have to do with clouds that offset things?
translation.zh: 他们说那些负反馈的结果是由于云的关系 他们说那些负反馈的结果是由于云的关系

translation.en: There are very, very few things that they can even say there's a chance in a million of those things.
translation.zh: 他们极少能举出令人信服的证据 即使是百万分之一的概率

translation.en: The main problem we have here, it's kind of like AIDS.
translation.zh: 这里的主要问题就像艾滋病

translation.en: You make the mistake now, and you pay for it a lot later.
translation.zh: 现在犯错，将来得加倍的承受痛苦

translation.en: And so, when you have all sorts of urgent problems, the idea of taking pain now that has to do with a gain later, and a somewhat uncertain pain thing -- in fact, the IPCC report, that's not necessarily the worst case, and there are people in the rich world who look at IPCC and say, "OK, that isn't that big of a deal."
translation.zh: 因此，当你遇到各种紧要问题时 现在承受痛苦关系到将来的收益 而且还是个不确定的痛苦 实际上，IPCC(政府间气候变化专门委员会)报告，那还不是最坏的情况 而且，发达国家也有人看了报告后，说这没什么大不了的 而且，发达国家也有人看了报告后，说这没什么大不了的

translation.en: The fact is it's that uncertain part that should move us towards this.
translation.zh: 事实上, 不确定的方面应该促进我们向这方面努力

translation.en: But my dream here is that, if you can make it economic, and meet the CO2 constraints, then the skeptics say, "OK, I don't care that it doesn't put out CO2, I kind of wish it did put out CO2, but I guess I'll accept it because it's cheaper than what's come before."
translation.zh: 但是我的愿望是, 如果你把能源生产变得经济了，同时也符合二氧化碳排放限制 但是我的愿望是, 如果你把能源生产变得经济了，同时也符合二氧化碳排放限制 那么怀疑论者会说：好的，虽然我不关心二氧化碳排放的事情 那么怀疑论者会说：好的，虽然我不关心二氧化碳排放的事情 我甚至还有点希望它会排放二氧化碳 但我会采纳这一新方法,因为能源比以前更便宜了

translation.en: (Applause) CA: And so, that would be your response to the Bjorn Lomborg argument, that basically if you spend all this energy trying to solve the CO2 problem, it's going to take away all your other goals of trying to rid the world of poverty and malaria and so forth, it's a stupid waste of the Earth's resources to put money towards that when there are better things we can do.
translation.zh: 但我会采纳这一新方法,因为能源比以前更便宜了 主持人: 是否可以说，这就是你对比约恩隆伯格的回应 也就是说，如果你花所有精力来解决二氧化碳的问题，那就会取代其他目标 也就是说，如果你花所有精力来解决二氧化碳的问题，那就会取代其他目标 比如解决世界贫困, 或者疟疾等等的目标 把钱投到那些领域是对资本的浪费，我们有更重要的事情要做 把钱投到那些领域是对资本的浪费，我们有更重要的事情要做

translation.en: BG: Well, the actual spending on the R&D piece -- say the U.S. should spend 10 billion a year more than it is right now -- it's not that dramatic.
translation.zh: 盖茨：实际的研发投入其实没多少，虽说美国应该每年多投入100亿在这上面，这应该不会影响其他事情 盖茨：实际的研发投入其实没多少，虽说美国应该每年多投入100亿在这上面，这应该不会影响其他事情 盖茨：实际的研发投入其实没多少，虽说美国应该每年多投入100亿在这上面，这应该不会影响其他事情

translation.en: It shouldn't take away from other things.
translation.zh: 盖茨：实际的研发投入其实没多少，虽说美国应该每年多投入100亿在这上面，这应该不会影响其他事情

translation.en: The thing you get into big money on, and this, reasonable people can disagree, is when you have something that's non-economic and you're trying to fund that -- that, to me, mostly is a waste.
translation.zh: 对于需要投巨资的事业, 如果不经济没有回报，对我而言基本是浪费，这点有些人可能持不同意见 对于需要投巨资的事业, 如果不经济没有回报，对我而言基本是浪费，这点有些人可能持不同意见 对于需要投巨资的事业, 如果不经济没有回报，对我而言基本是浪费，这点有些人可能持不同意见

translation.en: Unless you're very close and you're just funding the learning curve and it's going to get very cheap, I believe we should try more things that have a potential to be far less expensive.
translation.zh: 除非你已经很接近成功, 而且你在投资学习曲线，并且它将会变得很便宜 除非你已经很接近成功, 而且你在投资学习曲线，并且它将会变得很便宜 否则，我认为我们应该多方尝试具有低成本潜力的方案 否则，我认为我们应该多方尝试具有低成本潜力的方案

translation.en: If the trade-off you get into is, "Let's make energy super expensive," then the rich can afford that.
translation.zh: 如果为了解决气候问题，最后让能源变的异常昂贵，贵到只有富人用得起 如果为了解决气候问题，最后让能源变的异常昂贵，贵到只有富人用得起

translation.en: I mean, all of us here could pay five times as much for our energy and not change our lifestyle.
translation.zh: 对在坐各位来说，如果能源价格提高五倍，还不至于影响我们的生活方式 对在坐各位来说，如果能源价格提高五倍，还不至于影响我们的生活方式

translation.en: The disaster is for that two billion.
translation.zh: 但对地球上那二十亿穷人来说就是个灾难了

translation.en: And even Lomborg has changed.
translation.zh: 而且隆伯格的观点已经变了，他的论点现在是，为什么研究没有得到更多的关注

translation.en: His shtick now is, "Why isn't the R&D getting more discussed?"
translation.zh: 而且隆伯格的观点已经变了，他的论点现在是，为什么研究没有得到更多的关注

translation.en: He's still, because of his earlier stuff, still associated with the skeptic camp, but he's realized that's a pretty lonely camp, and so, he's making the R&D point.
translation.zh: 基于历史的原因, 他还是属于怀疑论阵营，但是他已经意识到那是个相当孤独的阵营 基于历史的原因, 他还是属于怀疑论阵营，但是他已经意识到那是个相当孤独的阵营 基于历史的原因, 他还是属于怀疑论阵营，但是他已经意识到那是个相当孤独的阵营 所以,他开始摆出关于研发方面的观点

translation.en: And so there is a thread of something that I think is appropriate.
translation.zh: 我觉得那是一个非常值得探讨的话题，因为对科研的投入之少实在是不可理喻

translation.en: The R&D piece, it's crazy how little it's funded.
translation.zh: 我觉得那是一个非常值得探讨的话题，因为对科研的投入之少实在是不可理喻

translation.en: CA: Well Bill, I suspect I speak on the behalf of most people here to say I really hope your wish comes true. Thank you so much.
translation.zh: 主持人：比尔, 我想这里的大多数人都跟我一样，真心希望你的梦想成真，非常感谢！ 主持人：比尔, 我想这里的大多数人都跟我一样，真心希望你的梦想成真，非常感谢！

translation.en: BG: Thank you.
translation.zh: 盖茨：谢谢大家

translation.en: (Applause) About a year ago, I asked myself a question: "Knowing what I know, why am I not a vegetarian?"
translation.zh: 盖茨：谢谢大家 大概在一年前左右 我问了我自己一个问题 ”我明明知道这些资讯， 为什么我不是个素食者？“

translation.en: After all, I'm one of the green guys: I grew up with hippie parents in a log cabin.
translation.zh: 毕竟我支持环保，热爱绿概念 和嬉皮父母在小木屋里长大

translation.en: I started a site called TreeHugger -- I care about this stuff.
translation.zh: 我开了一个叫 Treehugger 的网站 － 抱树网 我很关心这些东西

translation.en: I knew that eating a mere hamburger a day can increase my risk of dying by a third.
translation.zh: 我知道光是每天吃一个汉堡 就能增加三分之一的死亡几率

translation.en: Cruelty: I knew that the 10 billion animals we raise each year for meat are raised in factory farm conditions that we, hypocritically, wouldn't even consider for our own cats, dogs and other pets.
translation.zh: 我知道每年我们养殖100亿动物 就为了他们身上的肉 而这些动物生活的那种工厂环境 是我们根本无法想象自己的 猫，或是宠物可以居住的

translation.en: Environmentally, meat, amazingly, causes more emissions than all of transportation combined: cars, trains, planes, buses, boats, all of it.
translation.zh: 就环境来说，肉品排放的二氧化碳 神奇的 比所有交通工具的排放量还大 汽车、火车

translation.en: And beef production uses 100 times the water that most vegetables do.
translation.zh: 制造肉所使用的水 是蔬菜的一百倍

translation.en: I also knew that I'm not alone.
translation.zh: 我也知道我并不孤单

translation.en: We as a society are eating twice as much meat as we did in the 50s.
translation.zh: 整个社会 现在我们所吃的肉 足足比50年代多了两倍

translation.en: So what was once the special little side treat now is the main, much more regular.
translation.zh: 曾经我们当作特别的小食 现在却成了我们的日常主食

translation.en: So really, any of these angles should have been enough to convince me to go vegetarian.
translation.zh: 说真的，以任何角度来说 都应该足以让我成为素食者

translation.en: Yet, there I was -- chk, chk, chk -- tucking into a big old steak.
translation.zh: 但我还是嗯，嗯，嗯 被一块巨大的牛排包围着

translation.en: So why was I stalling?
translation.zh: 我到底在迟疑什么？

translation.en: I realized that what I was being pitched was a binary solution.
translation.zh: 我发觉那是因为这是因为 我把它当作一个二分法的问题

translation.en: It was either you're a meat eater or you're a vegetarian, and I guess I just wasn't quite ready.
translation.zh: 你需要决定 你到底是吃肉还是吃素 我想我实在没做好心理准备

translation.en: Imagine your last hamburger.
translation.zh: 想象最后的一个汉堡

translation.en: (Laughter) So my common sense, my good intentions, were in conflict with my taste buds.
translation.zh: （笑声） 于是乎我的常识 我的用意良善 和我的味蕾产生了矛盾

translation.en: And I'd commit to doing it later, and not surprisingly, later never came.
translation.zh: 我总是想着之后再做 之后却永远不会来

translation.en: Sound familiar?
translation.zh: 听起来很熟悉吗？

translation.en: So I wondered, might there be a third solution?
translation.zh: 于是我想着， 或许应该有第三种选择？

translation.en: And I thought about it, and I came up with one.
translation.zh: 经过思考以后，我想出了一个

translation.en: I've been doing it for the last year, and it's great.
translation.zh: 去年我便这么实行，感觉很好

translation.en: It's called weekday veg.
translation.zh: 叫做周间素食

translation.en: The name says it all: Nothing with a face Monday through Friday.
translation.zh: 事如其名 礼拜一到五不吃任何有脸的东西

translation.en: On the weekend, your choice.
translation.zh: 周末，自由选择

translation.en: Simple.
translation.zh: 如此简单

translation.en: If you want to take it to the next level, remember, the major culprits in terms of environmental damage and health are red and processed meats.
translation.zh: 如果你想更进一步 记得红肉和经处理的肉类 是今日破坏环境和健康的 罪魁祸首

translation.en: So you want to swap those out with some good, sustainably harvested fish.
translation.zh: 如果你想要和它们说不 你也可以改为食用一些以不破坏环境平衡养殖的鱼类

translation.en: It's structured, so it ends up being simple to remember, and it's okay to break it here and there.
translation.zh: 有了这样的规律 就比较容易记得 偶尔犯戒也没关系

translation.en: After all, cutting five days a week is cutting 70 percent of your meat intake.
translation.zh: 毕竟五天不吃肉 是减少七成的肉

translation.en: The program has been great, weekday veg.
translation.zh: 我很喜欢周间素食这个点子

translation.en: My footprint's smaller, I'm lessening pollution, I feel better about the animals, I'm even saving money.
translation.zh: 我的碳足迹小了 我减低了污染 我对动物感觉好些了 甚至还存了一点钱

translation.en: Best of all, I'm healthier, I know that I'm going to live longer, and I've even lost a little weight.
translation.zh: 最棒的是，我更健康了 我知道我会更长命 甚至还瘦了一些

translation.en: So, please ask yourselves, for your health, for your pocketbook, for the environment, for the animals: What's stopping you from giving weekday veg a shot?
translation.zh: 于是，请大家今天自问 为了你的健康 你的财富 为了环境和动物 为什么不试试做个周间的素食者呢？

translation.en: After all, if all of us ate half as much meat, it would be like half of us were vegetarians.
translation.zh: 如果我们所有人都少吃 一半的肉 那就像我们之中有一半人 是素食者一样。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢大家

translation.en: (Applause) So, now, there are a lot of web 2.0 consultants who make a lot of money.
translation.zh: （掌声） 嗯，现在，很多web 2.0 (注重用户交互的新型互联网应用)的技术顾问赚了大钱。

translation.en: In fact, they make their livings on this kind of stuff.
translation.zh: 实际上，他们就是靠这东西为生的。

translation.en: I'm going to try and save you all the time and all the money and go through it in the next three minutes, so bear with me.
translation.zh: 我会试着帮你节省点时间和钞票 在接下来的三分钟里关于这究竟是怎么回事，且听我一一道来。

translation.en: Started a website back in 2005, with a few friends of mine, called Reddit.com.
translation.zh: 我跟一群朋友在2005年建立了一个网站， 叫做Reddit.com。

translation.en: That's what you'd call a social news website.
translation.zh: 这是一个社交型新闻网站。

translation.en: Basically all that means is that the democratic front page is the best stuff on the web. You find some interesting content, say a TEDTalk, submit it to Reddit, and the community of your peers will vote it up if they like it, vote it down if they don't.
translation.zh: 基本上就是说公共首页 上罗列的是目前网上风头最劲的东西。你找到一些好玩儿的， 比如说TEDTalk, 传到Reddit上，然后你的社区同好们 喜欢就顶，不喜欢就踩。

translation.en: And that creates the front page. It's always rising, falling, always changing.
translation.zh: 首页就是这么来的。升升降降，新闻总是在换。

translation.en: About a half million people visit every day. But this isn't about Reddit.
translation.zh: 每天大概有50万的点击量。但这不是Reddit本身的魅力。

translation.en: This is actually about discovering new things that pop up on the web.
translation.zh: 这其实是大家对发掘网络上新鲜事的热情。

translation.en: Because in the last four years we've seen all kinds of memes, all kinds of trends get born right on our front page.
translation.zh: 因为最近四年我们见到了各种各样的流行语 和潮流从我们的首页开始发扬光大。

translation.en: But this isn't even about Reddit itself.
translation.zh: 但今天我要讲的不是有关Reddit。

translation.en: It's actually about humpback whales.
translation.zh: 是有关座头鲸的。

translation.en: Well, okay, technically it's actually about Greenpeace, which is an environmental organization that wanted to stop the Japanese government on their whaling campaign.
translation.zh: 嗯，好吧，严格说来其实是有关Greenpeace(绿色和平)， 一个环境保护组织，旨在阻止 日本政府的捕鲸运动。

translation.en: These humpback whales were getting killed.
translation.zh: 那里的座头鲸正遭受杀戮。

translation.en: They wanted to put an end to it. And one of the ways they wanted to do it was to put a tracking chip inside one of these humpback whales.
translation.zh: 他们想阻止这一切。途径之一 就是在这些座头鲸之一身上植入追踪芯片。

translation.en: But to really kind of personify the movement, they wanted to name it.
translation.zh: 但为了使大家更有参与感，他们想为这只座头鲸命名。

translation.en: So, in true web fashion they put together a poll where they had a bunch of very erudite, very thoughtful, cultured names.
translation.zh: 所以，遵循网络规则，他们发起了一场公投 包含很多非常高雅、深刻、有内涵的名字。

translation.en: I believe this is a Farsi word for "immortal."
translation.zh: 我相信这是波斯语中的“不朽”。

translation.en: I think this means "divine power of the ocean" in a Polynesian language.
translation.zh: 我认为这个的意思是“海之神力” 一个波利尼西亚词。

translation.en: And then there was this: Mister Splashy Pants.
translation.zh: 然后就是这个了：喷水先生。

translation.en: (Laughter) And this, this was special. Mister Pants, or Splashy, to his friends, was very popular on the Internet.
translation.zh: （笑声） 而这个，这个很特别。阿喷先生，或喷喷，因为朋友们的支持， 在网络上流行开来。

translation.en: In fact, someone on Reddit thought, "Oh, what a great thing, we should all vote this up."
translation.zh: 实际上，Reddit上的一些人认为， “哦，太棒了，我们该把它顶上去。”

translation.en: And, you know, Redditors responded and all agreed.
translation.zh: 然后，如你所知，Redditor（Reddit用户）们群起而顶之。

translation.en: So, the voting started and we actually got behind it ourselves.
translation.zh: 于是，选举开始，我们网站人员也在背后默默支持。

translation.en: We changed our logo, for the day, from the alien to a Splashy, to sort of help the cause.
translation.zh: 我们改变了网站徽标，把外星人 改成了喷水鲸鱼。

translation.en: And it wasn't long before other sites like Fark and Boing Boing and the rest of the Internet started saying, "Yes! We love Splashy Pants."
translation.zh: 不久之后连Fark 和Boing Boing之类的网站都开始宣称 “是的！我们就爱喷水先生。”

translation.en: So, it went from about five percent, which was when this meme started, to 70 percent at the end of voting.
translation.zh: 所以，票数从刚开始的5%， 一路涨到投票结束时的70%。

translation.en: Which is pretty impressive right? We won! Mister Splashy Pants was chosen. Hmm, just kidding. Okay.
translation.zh: 很牛对吧？我们赢了！喷水先生 被选中了。嗯，开个玩笑。好吧。

translation.en: So, Greenpeace actually wasn't that crazy about it, because they wanted one of their more thoughtful names to win.
translation.zh: 其实，绿色和平并不喜欢这个名字。 他们想要个更有深意的名字。

translation.en: So they said, "No, no, just kidding. We'll give it another week of voting."
translation.zh: 所以他们说，“不，不，这太扯了。我们再投一个礼拜。”

translation.en: Well, that got us a little angry.
translation.zh: 好吧，我们有点不爽。

translation.en: So, we changed it to Fightin' Splashy.
translation.zh: 所以，我们把口号改成了“加油喷水先生”。

translation.en: (Laughter) And the Reddit community, really, and the rest of the internet, rather, really got behind this.
translation.zh: （笑声） 而且Reddit社区真的， 不如说整个互联网，真的都开始力挺它了。

translation.en: Facebook groups were getting created. Facebook applications were getting created.
translation.zh: Facebook上建立了新群组和新应用。

translation.en: The idea was, "Vote your conscience," vote for Mister Splashy Pants.
translation.zh: 宗旨就是，“投良心票，” 投喷水先生票。

translation.en: And people were putting up signs in the real world -- (Laughter) -- about this whale.
translation.zh: 而且在现实世界里人们也贴起了这样的标志—— （笑声）—— 关于这条鲸鱼。

translation.en: And this was the final vote. When all was cleared ...
translation.zh: 终于到了最后关头。形势明朗了...

translation.en: 78 percent of the votes, and to give you an idea of the landslide, the next highest name pulled in three. Okay?
translation.zh: 78%高票当选，描述一下这场压倒性的胜利就是， 第二名只得到3%。了解了吧？

translation.en: So, there was a clear lesson here.
translation.zh: 所以很明显。

translation.en: And that was that the Internet loves Mister Splashy Pants.
translation.zh: 网民喜欢喷水先生。

translation.en: Which is obvious. It's a great name.
translation.zh: 这名字很棒。

translation.en: Everyone wants to hear their news anchor say, "Mister Splashy Pants."
translation.zh: 大家都想在电视或广播上听到“喷水先生”。

translation.en: (Laughter) And I think that's what helped drive this.
translation.zh: （笑声） 我觉得这也是原动力之一。

translation.en: But what was cool was that the repercussions now for Greenpeace was, they created an entire marketing campaign around it.
translation.zh: 但更酷的是现在绿色和平的对应， 他们将之彻底市场化了。

translation.en: They sell Mister Splashy Pants shirts and pins.
translation.zh: 他们卖喷水先生T恤和胸章。

translation.en: They even created an e-card so you could send your friend a dancing Splashy.
translation.zh: 他们甚至开发了一种电子贺卡，让你可以把跳舞的喷水先生发给你的朋友。

translation.en: But what was even more important was the fact that they actually accomplished their mission. The Japanese government called off their whaling expedition. Mission accomplished.
translation.zh: 但更重要的是他们真的 完成了他们的任务。日本政府叫停了 他们的捕鲸考察。使命达成。

translation.en: Greenpeace was thrilled. The whales were happy. That's a quote.
translation.zh: 绿色和平很激动。鲸鱼们很开心。引用一下。

translation.en: (Laughter) And actually, Redditors in the Internet community were happy to participate, but they weren't whale lovers.
translation.zh: （笑声） 实际上，网络社区中的Redditor们 喜欢凑热闹，但他们并不真的热爱鲸鱼。

translation.en: A few of them certainly were. But we're talking about a lot of people who were just really interested and really caught up in this great meme, and in fact someone from Greenpeace came back on the site and thanked Reddit for its participation.
translation.zh: 可能有一些是。但大多数人 只是对这个热闹感兴趣并且趋之若鹜。 绿色和平的人到这个网站来 感谢Reddit们的参与。

translation.en: But this wasn't really out of altruism. This was just out of interest in doing something cool.
translation.zh: 但这种参与其实不是出于利他主义。只是大家都想做点很酷的事儿而已。

translation.en: And this is kind of how the Internet works.
translation.zh: 这就是互联网世界的规则。

translation.en: This is that great big secret. Because the Internet provides this level playing field.
translation.zh: 这就是互联网的大秘密。因为网络提供了一个人人平等的游乐场。

translation.en: Your link is just as good as your link, which is just as good as my link. As long as we have a browser, anyone can get to any website no matter how big a budget you have.
translation.zh: 你的链接和（转向另一观众）你的一样有价值， 我的也是一样。只要你有一个浏览器。 不管财力大小任何人都能访问任何网站。

translation.en: That is, as long as you can keep net neutrality in place.
translation.zh: 只要网络能保持它的中立性。

translation.en: The other important thing is that it costs nothing to get that content online now.
translation.zh: 另一个很重要的点是在网络上浏览内容现在不用花任何额外费用。

translation.en: There are so many great publishing tools that are available, it only takes a few minutes of your time now to actually produce something.
translation.zh: 我们有太多厉害的网络发布工具。 现在几分钟就可以有所创造。

translation.en: And the cost of iteration is so cheap that you might as well give it a go.
translation.zh: 重复操作是如此简单，你也许会想也试一把。

translation.en: And if you do, be genuine about it. Be honest. Be up front.
translation.zh: 如果你真的想做，请保持真诚。请实话实说。请敏锐前卫。

translation.en: And one of the great lessons that Greenpeace actually learned was that it's okay to lose control.
translation.zh: 而且绿色和平实际上学到了很重要的一课 那就是失控其实没什么大不了。

translation.en: It's okay to take yourself a little less seriously, given that, even though it's a very serious cause, you could ultimately achieve your final goal.
translation.zh: 不把自己太当回事也没什么大不了。 了解了这个，即使这本身是挺不得了的道理， 你最终就能实现你的目标。

translation.en: And that's the final message that I want to share with all of you -- that you can do well online.
translation.zh: 这也是我想与大家分享的最后一个秘诀—— 就是上网也能做大事。

translation.en: But no longer is the message going to be coming from just the top down.
translation.zh: 但秘诀并不再是大人物掌控一切。

translation.en: If you want to succeed you've got to be okay to just lose control.
translation.zh: 若想成功，面对失控的情形你要心态平和。

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢大家。

translation.en: (Applause) Several years ago here at TED, Peter Skillman introduced a design challenge called the marshmallow challenge.
translation.zh: （掌声） 几年前，在TED大会上， Peter Skillman 介绍了一个设计挑战 叫做“棉花糖挑战”

translation.en: And the idea's pretty simple: Teams of four have to build the tallest free-standing structure out of 20 sticks of spaghetti, one yard of tape, one yard of string and a marshmallow.
translation.zh: 是个非常简单的主意 要求一组四人的团队搭建一个独立的最高建筑 材料是20根意大利面条 一段胶带，一段绳子 一块棉花糖

translation.en: The marshmallow has to be on top.
translation.zh: 棉花糖必须放在最上面

translation.en: And, though it seems really simple, it's actually pretty hard because it forces people to collaborate very quickly.
translation.zh: 这虽然看似简单，其实并不容易 因为它要求人们 迅速地合作

translation.en: And so, I thought this was an interesting idea, and I incorporated it into a design workshop.
translation.zh: 我觉得这是个有趣的主意 我把它放到了设计专题讨论会上

translation.en: And it was a huge success.
translation.zh: 结果非常成功

translation.en: And since then, I've conducted about 70 design workshops across the world with students and designers and architects, even the CTOs of the Fortune 50, and there's something about this exercise that reveals very deep lessons about the nature of collaboration, and I'd like to share some of them with you.
translation.zh: 从那以后， 我在全球 70多个设计专题讨论活动中 让学生们和设计者，建筑师 甚至财富50强的首席技术官 这个练习在很多方面给了我们 深刻的启迪 教会我们合作的特性 在这里我跟你们分享一些

translation.en: So, normally, most people begin by orienting themselves to the task.
translation.zh: 通常， 人们总是从 讨论开始着手完成这个任务

translation.en: They talk about it, they figure out what it's going to look like, they jockey for power.
translation.zh: 他们讨论一阵， 勾勒出结果会是什么样子 他们互相争论一番对错

translation.en: Then they spend some time planning, organizing, they sketch and they lay out spaghetti.
translation.zh: 然后花费点时间计划，组织 他们画一下图纸然后拿出意大利面条

translation.en: They spend the majority of their time assembling the sticks into ever-growing structures.
translation.zh: 他们用了大量的时间 把意大利面条组装得越来越高

translation.en: And then finally, just as they're running out of time, someone takes out the marshmallow, and then they gingerly put it on top, and then they stand back, and -- ta-da! -- they admire their work.
translation.zh: 然后最后，时间快要用完了 他们拿出棉花糖 小心翼翼地将棉花糖放到最上面 然后他们后退一步，哈哈 他们欣赏着他们的成果

translation.en: But what really happens, most of the time, is that the "ta-da" turns into an "uh-oh," because the weight of the marshmallow causes the entire structure to buckle and to collapse.
translation.zh: 但是绝大多数时候，真正发生的是 “哈哈” 变成了“糟了” 因为棉花糖的重量把整个结构 给压散架了

translation.en: So there are a number of people who have a lot more "uh-oh" moments than others, and among the worst are recent graduates of business school.
translation.zh: 有那么一些人 他们的“糟了”时刻比其他人多 其中最糟的是新毕业的商学院学生

translation.en: (Laughter) They lie, they cheat, they get distracted and they produce really lame structures.
translation.zh: (笑声) 他们说谎，他们欺骗，很容易受干扰 他们的建筑构造非常蹩脚

translation.en: And of course there are teams that have a lot more "ta-da" structures, and among the best are recent graduates of kindergarten.
translation.zh: 当然也有一些团队 他们创造了更多的“哈哈”时刻 其中最好的，就是新毕业的幼儿园小朋友

translation.en: (Laughter) And it's pretty amazing.
translation.zh: (笑声) 这个真是很神奇

translation.en: As Peter tells us, not only do they produce the tallest structures, but they're the most interesting structures of them all.
translation.zh: 正如PETER告诉我们的 他们不但造出了最高的建筑 而且他们搭建的结构也是最有趣的

translation.en: So the question you want to ask is: How come? Why? What is it about them?
translation.zh: 所以你会问 这是怎么回事？他们到底有什么特点？

translation.en: And Peter likes to say that none of the kids spend any time trying to be CEO of Spaghetti, Inc. Right?
translation.zh: Peter喜欢这样说： “因为没有任何孩子企图做 意大利面条公司的总裁。” 是的

translation.en: They don't spend time jockeying for power.
translation.zh: 他们没在争夺权力上花任何时间

translation.en: But there's another reason as well.
translation.zh: 但是其中还有另一个原因

translation.en: And the reason is that business students are trained to find the single right plan, right?
translation.zh: 因为商学院的学生受过的专业训练是 去寻找一个正确的计划

translation.en: And then they execute on it.
translation.zh: 然后他们按照计划执行

translation.en: And then what happens is, when they put the marshmallow on the top, they run out of time and what happens?
translation.zh: 然而事实是， 当他们把棉花糖放到顶部时 他们用完了有限的时间，然后呢

translation.en: It's a crisis.
translation.zh: 危机就降临了

translation.en: Sound familiar? Right.
translation.zh: 听着很熟悉吧？是的。

translation.en: What kindergarteners do differently is that they start with the marshmallow, and they build prototypes, successive prototypes, always keeping the marshmallow on top, so they have multiple times to fix when they build prototypes along the way.
translation.zh: 幼儿园的孩子的做法不一样 他们从棉花糖开始 他们先建一个样板模型， 然后不断在模型上加建， 其间总是让棉花糖保持在最上面(不倒下来) 所以他们一直有很多机会去不断修正样板模型

translation.en: Designers recognize this type of collaboration as the essence of the iterative process.
translation.zh: 于是设计者认识到这种合作是 这个互动过程中的重要因素

translation.en: And with each version, kids get instant feedback about what works and what doesn't work.
translation.zh: 对每个版本，孩子都会迅速地得到反馈 他们知道什么行，什么不行

translation.en: So the capacity to play in prototype is really essential, but let's look at how different teams perform.
translation.zh: 所以把握雏形的能力是真正的关键 让我们来看看不同的队伍是怎样表现的

translation.en: So the average for most people is around 20 inches; business schools students, about half of that; lawyers, a little better, but not much better than that, kindergarteners, better than most adults.
translation.zh: 大多数人建的塔的平均高度是20英尺 商学院学生， 大概是一半 律师好一些， 但也好不到哪里去 幼儿园的孩子，比大多数的成年人要好

translation.en: Who does the very best?
translation.zh: 谁做得最好呢？

translation.en: Architects and engineers, thankfully.
translation.zh: 建筑师和工程师，谢天谢地。

translation.en: (Laughter) Thirty-nine inches is the tallest structure I've seen.
translation.zh: (笑声) 我见过的最高的塔是39英寸

translation.en: And why is it? Because they understand triangles and self-reinforcing geometrical patterns are the key to building stable structures.
translation.zh: 为什么呢？因为他们懂得三角形 和自我巩固的几何模式 是建筑 稳定结构的关键

translation.en: So CEOs, a little bit better than average, but here's where it gets interesting.
translation.zh: 总裁们比平均水平稍好一些 但是有趣的是

translation.en: If you put you put an executive admin. on the team, they get significantly better.
translation.zh: 如果你在他们的小组里加一个行政助理 他们的成绩马上变得好很多

translation.en: (Laughter) It's incredible. You know, you look around, you go, "Oh, that team's going to win."
translation.zh: (笑声) 这真是令人难以置信， 你四处看看， 你说：“那个小组会赢。”

translation.en: You can just tell beforehand. And why is that?
translation.zh: 你很早就知道， 为什么呢？

translation.en: Because they have special skills of facilitation.
translation.zh: 因为他们有特殊的 简化技巧

translation.en: They manage the process, they understand the process.
translation.zh: 他们管理流程， 他们懂得流程

translation.en: And any team who manages and pays close attention to work will significantly improve the team's performance.
translation.zh: 总之，任何一个小组积极管理并 专注于工作本身的话 小组的表现就有显著的提高

translation.en: Specialized skills and facilitation skills are the combination that leads to strong success.
translation.zh: 特殊技能以及善于使用简便的手法 两者的结合带来了成功

translation.en: If you have 10 teams that typically perform, you'll get maybe six or so that have standing structures.
translation.zh: 如果你有10个队参加这个活动 其中大概有6个队可以搭建可以直立的结构

translation.en: And I tried something interesting.
translation.zh: 我做了一个有趣的尝试

translation.en: I thought, let's up the ante, once.
translation.zh: 我想， 我们不妨来赌一次

translation.en: So I offered a 10,000 dollar prize of software to the winning team.
translation.zh: 所以我就提供了价值10万美元的软件给得胜的小组

translation.en: So what do you think happened to these design students?
translation.zh: 你猜猜那些学设计的学生们会有什么样的反应？

translation.en: What was the result?
translation.zh: 结果如何？

translation.en: Here's what happened: Not one team had a standing structure.
translation.zh: 这就是结果 没有一个小组完成了一个站立的建筑

translation.en: If anyone had built, say, a one inch structure, they would have taken home the prize.
translation.zh: 哪怕任何一个小组完成一个一英寸的建筑 他们就可以把奖杯捧回去

translation.en: So, isn't that interesting? That high stakes have a strong impact.
translation.zh: 所以，很有意思的是 高额奖金会有很大的影响。

translation.en: We did the exercise again with the same students.
translation.zh: 之后我们在同样的学生中又重复了这个活动

translation.en: What do you think happened then?
translation.zh: 你猜猜结果怎样？

translation.en: So now they understand the value of prototyping.
translation.zh: 这回他们知道了做样版模型的价值

translation.en: So the same team went from being the very worst to being among the very best.
translation.zh: 所以最差的那个小组 成为了最好的小组

translation.en: They produced the tallest structures in the least amount of time.
translation.zh: 他们用最少的时间完成了最高的建筑

translation.en: So there's deep lessons for us about the nature of incentives and success.
translation.zh: 这些对我们都有很深的教育意义 揭示了奖励和成功的本质

translation.en: So, you might ask: Why would anyone actually spend time writing a marshmallow challenge?
translation.zh: 所以，你也许会问：怎么会有人 花时间写这么一个棉花糖的挑战

translation.en: And the reason is, I help create digital tools and processes to help teams build cars and video games and visual effects.
translation.zh: 原因是我可以用 电子工具和流程 来帮助人们造汽车，电子游戏 和模拟视觉效果

translation.en: And what the marshmallow challenge does is it helps them identify the hidden assumptions.
translation.zh: 而棉花糖的挑战教会我们 识别隐藏着的一些假设

translation.en: Because, frankly, every project has its own marshmallow, doesn't it?
translation.zh: 因为， 坦白说 每个项目都有它们自己的棉花糖

translation.en: The challenge provides a shared experience, a common language, a common stance to build the right prototype.
translation.zh: 这个挑战提供了可以分享的经验 一种共同的语言 处理问题的通用方法

translation.en: And so, this is the value of the experience, of this so simple exercise.
translation.zh: 就是这个简单的练习 可以给我们提供的有价值的经验

translation.en: And those of you who are interested may want to go to MarshmallowChallenge.com.
translation.zh: 你们如果有兴趣 可以去marshmallowchallenge.com网站

translation.en: It's a blog that you can look at how to build the marshmallows.
translation.zh: 这是一个你可以阅读的博客 告诉你怎样搭建棉花糖建筑

translation.en: There's step-by-step instructions on this.
translation.zh: 那里有具体的步骤说明

translation.en: There are crazy examples from around the world of how people tweak and adjust the system.
translation.zh: 还有来自世界各地的稀奇古怪的例子 人们怎样调整系统

translation.en: There's world records that are on this as well.
translation.zh: 那里有世界记录

translation.en: And the fundamental lesson, I believe, is that design truly is a contact sport.
translation.zh: 而我相信， 最根本的教意是： 设计其实是 一种交流运动

translation.en: It demands that we bring all of our senses to the task, and that we apply the very best of our thinking, our feeling and our doing to the challenge that we have at hand.
translation.zh: 它要求我们把我们所有的神志都放到任务中 要求我们运用最佳的思维状态 我们的感知我们的行动 来迎接我们面对的挑战

translation.en: And sometimes, a little prototype of this experience is all that it takes to turn us from an "uh-oh" moment to a "ta-da" moment.
translation.zh: 而有的时候， 一个小小的样板模型的经验 会帮助我们 将“糟了” 的那一刻变成了“”哈哈”的一刻

translation.en: And that can make a big difference.
translation.zh: 那造成的结果是大不同的

translation.en: Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 谢谢你们

translation.en: (Applause) One day, Los Angeles Times columnist Steve Lopez was walking along the streets of downtown Los Angeles when he heard beautiful music.
translation.zh: (掌声) 有一天， 洛杉矶时报的专栏作家 Steve Lopez走在洛杉矶 大街上 听到一曲美妙的乐曲

translation.en: And the source was a man, an African-American man, charming, rugged, homeless, playing a violin that only had two strings.
translation.zh: 音乐是从一个男人 一个非裔男人 一个颇有魅力， 粗旷的流浪汉 用一把只剩下两根弦的小提琴在演奏

translation.en: And I'm telling a story that many of you know, because Steve's columns became the basis for a book, which was turned into a movie, with Robert Downey Jr. acting as Steve Lopez, and Jamie Foxx as Nathaniel Anthony Ayers, the Juilliard-trained double bassist whose promising career was cut short by a tragic affliction with paranoid schizophrenia.
translation.zh: 我现在要讲的这个故事你们很多人已经知道了 因为Steve的专栏后来成了一本 书的基础，然后又被拍成电影 其中Robert Downey Jr 扮演Steve Lopez Jamie Foxx扮演了Nathaniel Anthony Ayer 他原本是茱莉亚音乐学院培训的双重贝斯手 不料他的职业生涯 却因为患上偏执型精神分裂症而不幸中断

translation.en: Nathaniel dropped out of Juilliard, he suffered a complete breakdown, and 30 years later he was living homeless on the streets of Skid Row in downtown Los Angeles.
translation.zh: Nathaniel从茱莉亚音乐学院辍学，他完全崩溃了 30年后的他流落在 洛杉矶 Skid Row 大街上无家可归

translation.en: I encourage all of you to read Steve's book or to watch the movie to understand not only the beautiful bond that formed between these two men, but how music helped shape that bond, and ultimately was instrumental -- if you'll pardon the pun -- in helping Nathaniel get off the streets.
translation.zh: 我鼓励大家都去看看Steve的书， 或者看看电影 不光是去理解这两个男人之间 建立的美好的纽带 而且也看看音乐是如果帮助建立这种纽带的 而那是最终改变Nathaniel流浪 生活的最有用的工具

translation.en: I met Mr. Ayers in 2008, two years ago, at Walt Disney Concert Hall.
translation.zh: 我和Ayers 先生在2008年相见 那是两年前在迪斯尼音乐厅

translation.en: He had just heard a performance of Beethoven's First and Fourth symphonies, and came backstage and introduced himself.
translation.zh: 他才听了贝多芬第一，第四交响乐 到后天来自我介绍

translation.en: He was speaking in a very jovial and gregarious way about Yo-Yo Ma and Hillary Clinton and how the Dodgers were never going to make the World Series, all because of the treacherous first violin passage work in the last movement of Beethoven's Fourth Symphony.
translation.zh: 他说话很愉快，很合群 提到了马友友和希拉里.克林顿 道奇队不可能进入世界联赛 而这都是因为最后一刻贝多芬第四交响乐中 开始的那段变幻莫测的小提琴演奏起的作用

translation.en: And we got talking about music, and I got an email from Steve a few days later saying that Nathaniel was interested in a violin lesson with me.
translation.zh: 我们谈了一会儿音乐。 几天后我收到Steve的来信 告诉我Nathaniel有兴趣跟我说学小提琴

translation.en: Now, I should mention that Nathaniel refuses treatment because when he was treated it was with shock therapy and Thorazine and handcuffs, and that scar has stayed with him for his entire life.
translation.zh: 我应该提一下的是Nathaniel拒绝治疗 因为当初他接受的是电击疗法 用的是镇静剂和手铐 那些伤疤从此留在了他的生活中

translation.en: But as a result now, he is prone to these schizophrenic episodes, the worst of which can manifest themselves as him exploding and then disappearing for days, wandering the streets of Skid Row, exposed to its horrors, with the torment of his own mind unleashed upon him.
translation.zh: 结果呢， 他的 精神分裂症现在变得更容易发作 最糟糕的表现是 他发作后 会消失几天 在Skid Row大街上流浪 暴露着内心的恐惧，让心灵的煎熬 在身上释放

translation.en: And Nathaniel was in such a state of agitation when we started our first lesson at Walt Disney Concert Hall -- he had a kind of manic glint in his eyes, he was lost.
translation.zh: Nathaniel当初就是处在这样的一种状态下 我们在迪斯尼音乐厅开始了第一课的时候 他的目光中夹杂着狂躁 他是一个迷失了方向的人

translation.en: And he was talking about invisible demons and smoke, and how someone was poisoning him in his sleep.
translation.zh: 他提到了 无形的恶魔和烟雾 有人怎样在他睡觉时给他下毒

translation.en: And I was afraid, not for myself, but I was afraid that I was going to lose him, that he was going to sink into one of his states, and that I would ruin his relationship with the violin if I started talking about scales and arpeggios and other exciting forms of didactic violin pedagogy.
translation.zh: 我感到很害怕 不是为我自己的安全担心， 而是害怕 我会失去他 他又会沉浸到他的某一种他的状态中 而我会毁了他和小提琴建立起来的关系 如果我开始讲音阶 和琶音和其他形式的精彩 的说教式的小提琴教学法

translation.en: (Laughter) So, I just started playing.
translation.zh: (笑声) 于是， 我开始拉琴

translation.en: And I played the first movement of the Beethoven Violin Concerto.
translation.zh: 我演奏了贝多芬小提琴协奏曲的第一乐章

translation.en: And as I played, I understood that there was a profound change occurring in Nathaniel's eyes.
translation.zh: 当我演奏的时候 我知道Nathaniel的眼睛里有一种 奥妙的变化

translation.en: It was as if he was in the grip of some invisible pharmaceutical, a chemical reaction, for which my playing the music was its catalyst.
translation.zh: 好象他抓住了什么隐形的药 象是经历了化学反应，而我的演奏 就是催化剂

translation.en: And Nathaniel's manic rage was transformed into understanding, a quiet curiosity and grace.
translation.zh: 他的狂躁愤怒 也转化成理解 安静的好奇， 和优雅

translation.en: And in a miracle, he lifted his own violin and he started playing, by ear, certain snippets of violin concertos which he then asked me to complete -- Mendelssohn, Tchaikovsky, Sibelius.
translation.zh: 神奇的是，他拿起了他的小提琴 他也跟着开始演奏 小提琴协奏曲的某些片断 然后他又要我来完成，门德尔松 柴可夫斯基，西贝柳斯

translation.en: And we started talking about music, from Bach to Beethoven and Brahms, Bruckner, all the B's, from Bartók, all the way up to Esa-Pekka Salonen.
translation.zh: 于是我们开始谈论音乐：从巴赫 到贝多芬，布拉姆斯 布鲁克纳， 所有名字以B打头的人 从巴托克一直到艾沙·佩卡·萨洛宁

translation.en: And I understood that he not only had an encyclopedic knowledge of music, but he related to this music at a personal level.
translation.zh: 我了解到他不但 是一本音乐大百科全书 而且他能将这些音乐跟他个人的感受联系起来

translation.en: He spoke about it with the kind of passion and understanding that I share with my colleagues in the Los Angeles Philharmonic.
translation.zh: 他讲到那些东西时充满了激情和对音乐 深刻的理解，仿佛是我跟我在洛杉矶 交响乐团的同事们之间交流时一样

translation.en: And through playing music and talking about music, this man had transformed from the paranoid, disturbed man that had just come from walking the streets of downtown Los Angeles to the charming, erudite, brilliant, Juilliard-trained musician.
translation.zh: 通过演奏音乐， 谈论音乐 这个人从一个 偏执，不安的 刚才还在洛杉矶 大街上晃悠的流浪汉 变成了一个迷人，博学 优秀的受过朱丽亚音乐学院教育的音乐家

translation.en: Music is medicine. Music changes us.
translation.zh: 音乐是良药。音乐改变着我们

translation.en: And for Nathaniel, music is sanity.
translation.zh: 对nathaniel来说， 音乐是帮助他开启心智

translation.en: Because music allows him to take his thoughts and delusions and shape them through his imagination and his creativity, into reality.
translation.zh: 因为音乐可以帮他将他的思维 妄想，转换成形 通过他的想象力和创造力 变成现实

translation.en: And that is an escape from his tormented state.
translation.zh: 而正是这个帮助他从煎熬 中解脱出来

translation.en: And I understood that this was the very essence of art.
translation.zh: 而我知道这就是艺术的真髓

translation.en: This was the very reason why we made music, that we take something that exists within all of us at our very fundamental core, our emotions, and through our artistic lens, through our creativity, we're able to shape those emotions into reality.
translation.zh: 这正是我们创造音乐的原因 我们用我们每个人都拥有的一种内在 我们的最根本的核心 我们的感情 通过我们的艺术的镜头 通过我们的创造力，将我们的情感塑造成现实

translation.en: And the reality of that expression reaches all of us and moves us, inspires and unites us.
translation.zh: 而这种现实的表达 传递给我们所有的人 感动我们， 启迪我们，团结我们

translation.en: And for Nathaniel, music brought him back into a fold of friends.
translation.zh: 而对Nathaniel 音乐把他带回到一群朋友中

translation.en: The redemptive power of music brought him back into a family of musicians that understood him, that recognized his talents and respected him.
translation.zh: 音乐的挽救力将他 带回到音乐的大家庭 这里人们理解他 承认他的天赋 尊重他

translation.en: And I will always make music with Nathaniel, whether we're at Walt Disney Concert Hall or on Skid Row, because he reminds me why I became a musician.
translation.zh: 而我会永远为他创造音乐 无论是在迪斯尼的音乐厅 或者Skid Row的大街上， 因为他提示着我 为什么我要做音乐家

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: (Applause) Bruno Giussani: Thank you. Thanks.
translation.zh: (鼓掌) Bruno Giussani:谢谢，谢谢

translation.en: Robert Gupta.
translation.zh: Robert Gupta.

translation.en: (Applause) Robert Gupta: I'm going to play something that I shamelessly stole from cellists.
translation.zh: (鼓掌 ) Robert Gupta：现在我给大家演奏一段我厚颜从大提琴手那里窃来的曲子

translation.en: So, please forgive me.
translation.zh: 所以请原谅我

translation.en: (Laughter) (Music) (Applause) I'd like to talk to you today about the human brain, which is what we do research on at the University of California.
translation.zh: (笑声) (音乐) (鼓掌) 今天，我想和大家一探大脑的奥秘， 这是我于加州大学所做的研究。

translation.en: Just think about this problem for a second.
translation.zh: 试着思考一下这个问题。

translation.en: Here is a lump of flesh, about three pounds, which you can hold in the palm of your hand.
translation.zh: 这里有一堆肉，大概重三磅左右， 可以用一掌来握住。

translation.en: But it can contemplate the vastness of interstellar space.
translation.zh: 但它却可以探究浩瀚的星际空间；

translation.en: It can contemplate the meaning of infinity, ask questions about the meaning of its own existence, about the nature of God.
translation.zh: 可以探究无限的意义； 可以探究自身存在的意义； 可以探究上帝的本质。

translation.en: And this is truly the most amazing thing in the world.
translation.zh: 这是世界上最不可思议之事。

translation.en: It's the greatest mystery confronting human beings: How does this all come about?
translation.zh: 这是人类面临的最大难题之一。 这一切是怎么来的？

translation.en: Well, the brain, as you know, is made up of neurons.
translation.zh: 正如你们所知，脑组织是由神经元所组成的。

translation.en: We're looking at neurons here.
translation.zh: 这就是神经元。

translation.en: There are 100 billion neurons in the adult human brain.
translation.zh: 成人脑组织里含有一千亿个神经元。

translation.en: And each neuron makes something like 1,000 to 10,000 contacts with other neurons in the brain.
translation.zh: 每个神经元与其它神经元的 交接点约有一千至一万处。

translation.en: And based on this, people have calculated that the number of permutations and combinations of brain activity exceeds the number of elementary particles in the universe.
translation.zh: 基于此，人们对之进行了计算， 并得出各种大脑活动的组合总量 超过了宇宙中基本粒子的数量。

translation.en: So, how do you go about studying the brain?
translation.zh: 所以，我们应该如何研究大脑？

translation.en: One approach is to look at patients who had lesions in different part of the brain, and study changes in their behavior.
translation.zh: 一种方法是观察那些有受过脑部 损伤的人，以来研究他们行为的变迁。

translation.en: This is what I spoke about in the last TED.
translation.zh: 这是我于上次TED大会上所讲的内容。

translation.en: Today I'll talk about a different approach, which is to put electrodes in different parts of the brain, and actually record the activity of individual nerve cells in the brain.
translation.zh: 今天我将讲述一种新的方法。 这种方法是将电极线置放于大脑的不同部位， 以记录单个神经细胞的活动性。

translation.en: Sort of eavesdrop on the activity of nerve cells in the brain.
translation.zh: 颇类似于窃听神经细胞在大脑内的活动。

translation.en: Now, one recent discovery that has been made by researchers in Italy, in Parma, by Giacomo Rizzolatti and his colleagues, is a group of neurons called mirror neurons, which are on the front of the brain in the frontal lobes.
translation.zh: 最近，意大利帕尔马的 研究人员们，亦就是里佐拉蒂与其同事们， 在大脑前额叶 发现了一组神经元， 这组神经元被他们称作镜像神经元。

translation.en: Now, it turns out there are neurons which are called ordinary motor command neurons in the front of the brain, which have been known for over 50 years.
translation.zh: 此外，大脑里面还有一组神经元， 称作运动神经元，也位于大脑的前半部分， 这组神经元是50年前的发现。

translation.en: These neurons will fire when a person performs a specific action.
translation.zh: 当我们要做某种运动时，这组神经元就会发射信息至相关器官。

translation.en: For example, if I do that, and reach and grab an apple, a motor command neuron in the front of my brain will fire.
translation.zh: 例如，假若我这样做，我向前屈伸，然后抓住一只苹果， 一个运动神经元则会[向我的手]发射一组信息。

translation.en: If I reach out and pull an object, another neuron will fire, commanding me to pull that object.
translation.zh: 假如我向前屈伸，并回拉一件物品，另外一个神经元则会 发射另一组信息以控制我的行动。

translation.en: These are called motor command neurons that have been known for a long time.
translation.zh: 很早以前，这些运动神经元就被发现了。

translation.en: But what Rizzolatti found was a subset of these neurons, maybe about 20 percent of them, will also fire when I'm looking at somebody else performing the same action.
translation.zh: 不过，里佐拉蒂他们发现 这组神经元中包含着另外一组神经元， 大约百分之二十左右。这些神经元是会当我观看他人 行动时，发出与此行动一样的信息。

translation.en: So, here is a neuron that fires when I reach and grab something, but it also fires when I watch Joe reaching and grabbing something.
translation.zh: 所以，当我向前抓住某物件时，有个神经元会发出相关信息， 可是若我观看乔做相同的动作时，另一个神经元也会发出相关信息。

translation.en: And this is truly astonishing.
translation.zh: 这实在是令人震惊。

translation.en: Because it's as though this neuron is adopting the other person's point of view.
translation.zh: 因为这表明，神经元也会 采纳别人的观点。

translation.en: It's almost as though it's performing a virtual reality simulation of the other person's action.
translation.zh: 几乎就是模仿了他人的动作， 有如虚拟现实仿真。

translation.en: Now, what is the significance of these mirror neurons?
translation.zh: 那么，这些镜像神经元有何存在意义呢？

translation.en: For one thing they must be involved in things like imitation and emulation.
translation.zh: 这里我必须引入模仿和仿真的概念。

translation.en: Because to imitate a complex act requires my brain to adopt the other person's point of view.
translation.zh: 假使我们要模仿一种复杂的行为， 那么我们的大脑则需要采纳他人的行为观点。

translation.en: So, this is important for imitation and emulation.
translation.zh: 因此模仿和仿真是非常重要的。

translation.en: Well, why is that important?
translation.zh: 好了，它们为什么重要呢？

translation.en: Well, let's take a look at the next slide.
translation.zh: 让我们看看下一张幻灯片。

translation.en: So, how do you do imitation? Why is imitation important?
translation.zh: 你怎样进行模仿？模仿为什么重要？

translation.en: Mirror neurons and imitation, emulation.
translation.zh: 镜像神经元，模仿和仿真。

translation.en: Now, let's look at culture, the phenomenon of human culture.
translation.zh: 现在，让我们从人类文化方面入手。

translation.en: If you go back in time about [75,000] to 100,000 years ago, let's look at human evolution, it turns out that something very important happened around 75,000 years ago.
translation.zh: 让我们回到七万五千年至十万年前时， 我们来观测下人类进化的过程，结果发现 于七万五千年前左右，一件重大事件影响了人类的发展。

translation.en: And that is, there is a sudden emergence and rapid spread of a number of skills that are unique to human beings like tool use, the use of fire, the use of shelters, and, of course, language, and the ability to read somebody else's mind and interpret that person's behavior.
translation.zh: 那就是，各种独特的“人类”技巧 突然出现以及迅速传播。这些技巧包括 工具的使用、 火的使用、房屋的出现和语言交流， 以及读取他人心思的能力和 理解他人的行为。

translation.en: All of that happened relatively quickly.
translation.zh: 这一切都相对地较快发生。

translation.en: Even though the human brain had achieved its present size almost three or four hundred thousand years ago, 100,000 years ago all of this happened very, very quickly.
translation.zh: 原始人类的大脑形状大约于四至五十万年前 就已经发育至今人的形状， 不过这些事件则是十万年前才快速地发生。

translation.en: And I claim that what happened was the sudden emergence of a sophisticated mirror neuron system, which allowed you to emulate and imitate other people's actions.
translation.zh: 我认为这些事件的产生是 源于先进的镜像神经元系统的突然浮现， 这些神经元将允许你模仿他人的行为

translation.en: So that when there was a sudden accidental discovery by one member of the group, say the use of fire, or a particular type of tool, instead of dying out, this spread rapidly, horizontally across the population, or was transmitted vertically, down the generations.
translation.zh: 所以当氏族的某一成员偶然 发现，火的使用， 或者某种工具的使用，这种方法将会迅速传播 而非凋零消亡，这种方法将会横向传播于氏族中， 或者代代纵向传播。

translation.en: So, this made evolution suddenly Lamarckian, instead of Darwinian.
translation.zh: 所以，这是一种拉马克式进化， 而非达尔文式。

translation.en: Darwinian evolution is slow; it takes hundreds of thousands of years.
translation.zh: 达尔文式进化是异乎缓慢的，它大概需要几千年的时间来产生效用。

translation.en: A polar bear, to evolve a coat, will take thousands of generations, maybe 100,000 years.
translation.zh: 若要使一只北极熊进化出一件外衣， 则需要他们经过数千代的传承，或许需要十万年方能得出外衣。

translation.en: A human being, a child, can just watch its parent kill another polar bear, and skin it and put the skin on its body, fur on the body, and learn it in one step. What the polar bear took 100,000 years to learn, it can learn in five minutes, maybe 10 minutes.
translation.zh: 一个人类小孩，则仅需观看他的父母 如何屠杀另一只北极熊， 将其剥皮拆骨，用来制造外衣。 小孩因此可以快速掌握这一技能。 北极熊需要十万年才得以进化出外衣， 人类小孩仅仅要五分钟或者十分钟就学会了。

translation.en: And then once it's learned this it spreads in geometric proportion across a population.
translation.zh: 当他们学会之后，这项技能将以 燎原之势散播于他们的氏族当中。

translation.en: This is the basis. The imitation of complex skills is what we call culture and is the basis of civilization.
translation.zh: 这就是本源。文化就是模仿 复杂的行为活动，而文明则产于此。

translation.en: Now there is another kind of mirror neuron, which is involved in something quite different.
translation.zh: 现在我将讲到另外一种镜像神经元， 担负另外的功能。

translation.en: And that is, there are mirror neurons, just as there are mirror neurons for action, there are mirror neurons for touch.
translation.zh: 有些镜像神经元只管活动， 另外一些则管触觉。

translation.en: In other words, if somebody touches me, my hand, neuron in the somatosensory cortex in the sensory region of the brain fires.
translation.zh: 换句话来说，假如某人触碰了我， 我的手，位于躯体感觉皮层的神经元 将会发出一组信息。

translation.en: But the same neuron, in some cases, will fire when I simply watch another person being touched.
translation.zh: 但同一个神经元，在某些情况下， 当我观看他人被触碰时，也会发出信息。

translation.en: So, it's empathizing the other person being touched.
translation.zh: 注意，我是说他人被触碰。

translation.en: So, most of them will fire when I'm touched in different locations. Different neurons for different locations.
translation.zh: 大多数的神经元都会于我被触碰时 发出信息。不同的神经元负责不同的身体区域。

translation.en: But a subset of them will fire even when I watch somebody else being touched in the same location.
translation.zh: 偏偏有小部分的神经元在我观看他人被触碰时 也会发出相同的信息。

translation.en: So, here again you have neurons which are enrolled in empathy.
translation.zh: 因此，这里又有一群神经元 参与进了你与他人之间的共鸣。

translation.en: Now, the question then arises: If I simply watch another person being touched, why do I not get confused and literally feel that touch sensation merely by watching somebody being touched?
translation.zh: 不过问题是：假如我只观看他人被触碰， 那么为什么我不会 有那种被触碰的感觉呢？

translation.en: I mean, I empathize with that person but I don't literally feel the touch.
translation.zh: 我与那人产生共鸣，但我并未产生触碰感。

translation.en: Well, that's because you've got receptors in your skin, touch and pain receptors, going back into your brain and saying "Don't worry, you're not being touched.
translation.zh: 那是因为我们皮肤上有感受器， 一种痛感受器，它会向大脑 反馈道：“切莫担心，你还未被触碰呢。

translation.en: So, empathize, by all means, with the other person, but do not actually experience the touch, otherwise you'll get confused and muddled."
translation.zh: 注意，是另外一个人被触碰呢， 而不是我们自己呀。 要不我们自己则会搞混呢。”

translation.en: Okay, so there is a feedback signal that vetoes the signal of the mirror neuron preventing you from consciously experiencing that touch.
translation.zh: 所以，这里会有一种反馈信号 以阻止镜像神经元所发出的信号， 从而使你避免感觉到那股错误的触碰感。

translation.en: But if you remove the arm, you simply anesthetize my arm, so you put an injection into my arm, anesthetize the brachial plexus, so the arm is numb, and there is no sensations coming in, if I now watch you being touched, I literally feel it in my hand.
translation.zh: 然而，当你移除你的手臂时， 或者向你的手臂注射麻醉剂， 从而麻醉臂丛神经 使你无法感觉到你的手臂的时候， 假如你现在观看他人手掌被触碰， 你的手掌也会有被触碰的感觉。

translation.en: In other words, you have dissolved the barrier between you and other human beings.
translation.zh: 换句话说，你将你与他人之间的 隔膜溶解了。

translation.en: So, I call them Gandhi neurons, or empathy neurons.
translation.zh: 因此，我称他们为甘地神经元，或者是共鸣神经元。

translation.en: (Laughter) And this is not in some abstract metaphorical sense.
translation.zh: (笑声) 这并不是种抽象的道理，

translation.en: All that's separating you from him, from the other person, is your skin.
translation.zh: 将你与他人隔开的 就是你的皮肤。

translation.en: Remove the skin, you experience that person's touch in your mind.
translation.zh: 移除你的皮肤，你将会与他人感同身受。

translation.en: You've dissolved the barrier between you and other human beings.
translation.zh: 你将你与他人之间的隔膜溶解了。

translation.en: And this, of course, is the basis of much of Eastern philosophy, and that is there is no real independent self, aloof from other human beings, inspecting the world, inspecting other people.
translation.zh: 这些当然就是大部分东方哲学的基础。 那就是没有真实独立的自我 将你与他人隔开，从而以审视这个世界， 审视他人。

translation.en: You are, in fact, connected not just via Facebook and Internet, you're actually quite literally connected by your neurons.
translation.zh: 事实上，我们与他人交结并不只是通过Facebook或是网络， 而是各式各样的神经元。

translation.en: And there is whole chains of neurons around this room, talking to each other.
translation.zh: 在这间大厅里，有一群的神经元正互相交谈着呢。

translation.en: And there is no real distinctiveness of your consciousness from somebody else's consciousness.
translation.zh: 你与他人的意识 并没有任何真正的差异。

translation.en: And this is not mumbo-jumbo philosophy.
translation.zh: 这并不是晦涩难懂的哲学。

translation.en: It emerges from our understanding of basic neuroscience.
translation.zh: 这是由基础神经学所引申出来的。

translation.en: So, you have a patient with a phantom limb. If the arm has been removed and you have a phantom, and you watch somebody else being touched, you feel it in your phantom.
translation.zh: 当你接诊一位有幻肢的病人时，幻肢即是 截肢或残废的患者仍感到自己有该肢体的存在，当他观察他人 被触碰时，他也会有此感。

translation.en: Now the astonishing thing is, if you have pain in your phantom limb, you squeeze the other person's hand, massage the other person's hand, that relieves the pain in your phantom hand, almost as though the neuron were obtaining relief from merely watching somebody else being massaged.
translation.zh: 令人震惊的是， 当你患有幻肢痛时，你对他人的手掌 进行按摩时， 你的疼痛感便会减轻。 这是因为你的神经元 正获取他人被按摩时 所获得的舒适感。

translation.en: So, here you have my last slide.
translation.zh: 这是我最后一张幻灯片。

translation.en: For the longest time people have regarded science and humanities as being distinct.
translation.zh: 长期以来，人们都将科学与 人文学科分开，

translation.en: C.P. Snow spoke of the two cultures: science on the one hand, humanities on the other; never the twain shall meet.
translation.zh: C.P.斯诺指出两种文化： 一种是科学，一种是人文； 将永不相见。

translation.en: So, I'm saying the mirror neuron system underlies the interface allowing you to rethink about issues like consciousness, representation of self, what separates you from other human beings, what allows you to empathize with other human beings, and also even things like the emergence of culture and civilization, which is unique to human beings. Thank you.
translation.zh: 而我则认为镜像神经元系统将再次引起 一场思潮，将使你重新思考什么是意识， 什么代表自我， 什么将你于他人区分开， 什么使你与他人产生共鸣， 什么使文化与文明产生， 什么才是人类所独有的事物。谢谢。

translation.en: (Applause) For some time I have been interested in the placebo effect, which might seem like an odd thing for a magician to be interested in, unless you think of it in the terms that I do, which is, "Something fake is believed in enough by somebody that it becomes something real."
translation.zh: (鼓掌) 在相当一段时间我感兴趣于 安慰剂的效力, 通常一个魔术师是不会 对安慰剂感兴趣的。 但是如果你从我职业的角度考虑, 那就是使一些假的事物 真实得使人们相信 这样它们就变成了事实。

translation.en: In other words, sugar pills have a measurable effect in certain kinds of studies, the placebo effect, just because the person thinks that what's happening to them is a pharmaceutical or some sort of a -- for pain management, for example, if they believe it enough there is a measurable effect in the body called the placebo effect.
translation.zh: 换句话说， 糖片 在一些研究中有可以测量到的效应， 所谓的安慰剂的效果 正是因为人们认为 他们身上发生的是一种药物作用 或者再给一个例子 为了镇痛 如果病人相信（他们服的是镇痛药物），药在他们身上就会有明显的效果。 这叫做安慰剂效应。

translation.en: Something fake becomes something real because of someone's perception of it.
translation.zh: 假的东西变成了 真的东西 因为人们对它的认知。

translation.en: In order for us to understand each other, I want to start by showing you a rudimentary, very simple magic trick.
translation.zh: 为了我们能够理解对方， 我想开始向你们展示一个初级的， 很简单的魔术。

translation.en: And I'm going to show you how it works. This is a trick that's been in every children's magic book since at least the 1950s.
translation.zh: 我也会告诉你我是怎么变得。 这是一个 从50年代开始就在每个孩子的 魔术书里出现的简单魔术。

translation.en: I learned it myself from Cub Scout Magic in the 1970s.
translation.zh: 我在70年代的时候从童子军魔法中学会它

translation.en: I'll do it for you, and then I'll explain it.
translation.zh: 我先做给你们看， 然后再解释。

translation.en: And then I'll explain why I explained it.
translation.zh: 最后我会解释我为什么要解释。

translation.en: So, here's what happens.
translation.zh: 看，这是怎么变这么魔术

translation.en: The knife, which you can examine; my hand, which you could examine.
translation.zh: 这把刀， 你们可以检查； 我的手， 你们也可以检查

translation.en: I'm just going to hold the knife in my fist like this.
translation.zh: 我就这样把刀握在我的拳头里。

translation.en: I'll get my sleeve back.
translation.zh: 然后我把袖子挽起来。

translation.en: And to make sure nothing goes up or down my sleeve I'm just going to squeeze my wrist right here.
translation.zh: 同时确保没有任何东西可以在我袖子里上下活动 我就这样在这压住我的手腕。

translation.en: That way you can see that at no time can anything travel, as long as I'm squeezing there nothing can go up or down my sleeve.
translation.zh: 那样你们可以看到没有时间让 任何事物活动。只要我压住这里 没有东西可以通过我的袖子。

translation.en: And the object of this is quite simple.
translation.zh: 这样做目的很简单。

translation.en: I'm going to open my hand, and hopefully, if all is well, my pure animal magnetism will hold the knife.
translation.zh: 我将打开我的手掌 希望， 如果所有事情顺利的话， 我的生理磁性会粘得住这把刀。

translation.en: In fact it's held so tightly in place that I can shake it, and the knife does not come off.
translation.zh: 实际上，它粘得如此紧 我甚至可以甩 这把刀（它）也不会掉。

translation.en: Nothing goes up or down my sleeve, no trickery. And you can examine everything.
translation.zh: 没有任何东西在我袖子里， 没有把戏。 你们可以查看所有东西。

translation.en: Ta-da!
translation.zh: 好了！

translation.en: (Applause) So, this is a trick that I often teach to young children that are interested in magic, because you can learn a great deal about deception by studying this very -- even though it's a very simple trick methodologically.
translation.zh: 鼓掌 恩， 这是一个我经常教给 那些对魔术感兴趣的孩子的魔术， 因为你能学到 很多关于欺骗的技巧通过学习 这个魔术－－尽管它是个方法上非常简单的魔术。

translation.en: Probably many of you in the room know this trick.
translation.zh: 很可能现场很多人都知道这个魔术。

translation.en: What happens is this.
translation.zh: 它是这样发生的。

translation.en: I hold the knife in my hand.
translation.zh: 我手里握着这把刀。

translation.en: I say I'm going to grab hold of my wrist to make sure nothing goes up or down my sleeve, that is a lie.
translation.zh: 我说我要握住我的手腕 来确保没有东西通过我的袖子， 这是个谎言。

translation.en: The reason I'm holding onto my wrist is because that's actually the secret of the illusion.
translation.zh: 我握住我手腕的原因 正是这个幻术的 秘密。

translation.en: In a moment when my hand moves from facing you to being away from you, this finger right here, my index finger is just going to shift from where it is, to a position pointing out like this.
translation.zh: 在我手从面向你们移到 背向你们的时候， 这个手指， 我的食指就将移位 从这儿，到这个位置 指向外侧。

translation.en: Nice one.
translation.zh: 好的。

translation.en: Someone who didn't have a childhood is out there.
translation.zh: （看来）那边坐的人很多没有过童年。

translation.en: (Laughter) So, it goes like this, from here, right.
translation.zh: 笑声 我的手指就是这样移的，从这里，对。

translation.en: And as I move around my finger shifts.
translation.zh: 在我转动我的手时，我的手指也在移动。

translation.en: And we could talk about why this is deceptive, why you don't notice there are only three fingers down here, because the mind, and the way it processes information, it doesn't count, one, two, three. It groups them.
translation.zh: 我们可以谈谈为什么这个具有欺骗性， 为什么你们没有注意到只有三个手指在这下面， 因为你的意识，和我们处理意识的方式， 它不计算一，二，三。 它组合它们。

translation.en: But that's not really what this is about. Right? And then I open my hand up.
translation.zh: 但这不是我们今天要讨论的。对吗？那我再打开我的手掌。

translation.en: Obviously it's clinging there, not by animal magnetism, but by chicanery, my index finger being there.
translation.zh: 很显然它被按在那，不是通过什么生理磁性， 而是通过骗局， 我的食指在那里。

translation.en: And then when I close my finger, same thing, as I move back, this motion kind of covers the moving back of my finger.
translation.zh: 我再合上我的手指，一样的， 在我后转时，这个动作 一定程度上掩饰了我手指的后转。

translation.en: I take this hand away. You give the knife out.
translation.zh: 我拿开这只手。你拿出这把刀。

translation.en: There is a trick you can do for your friends and neighbors. Thanks.
translation.zh: 这个戏法你可以向你的朋友和邻居做。谢谢。

translation.en: Now, (Laughter) what does that have to do with the placebo effect?
translation.zh: 现在，（笑声） 这和安慰剂效力有什么关系？

translation.en: I read a study a year or so ago that really blew my mind wide open.
translation.zh: 我一年前左右读过一个研究， 这很开阔了我的认知。

translation.en: I'm not a doctor or a researcher, so this, to me, was an astonishing thing.
translation.zh: 我不是医生或研究人员，所以，这对我而言， 是一件很让人吃惊的事。

translation.en: It turns out that if you administer a placebo in the form of a white pill, that's like aspirin shaped -- it's just a round white pill -- it has some certain measurable effect.
translation.zh: 它显示如果你给病人 一个安慰剂以白色药片的形式， 像阿司匹林的样子， 如果就是一个圆的白色药片，它有一定的可测量的安慰剂效应。

translation.en: But if you change the form that you give the placebo in, like you make a smaller pill, and color it blue, and stamp a letter into it, it is actually measurably more effective.
translation.zh: 但如果你改变你给的安慰剂的形状， 比如你把它作成小一点的药片， 并且涂成蓝色，刻一个字母上去， 它居然会有更明显的可测量的效果。

translation.en: Even though neither one of these things has any pharmaceutical -- they're sugar pills.
translation.zh: 即使两个里面没有一个 有任何真正的药效 －－它们都是糖片。

translation.en: But a white pill is not as good as a blue pill.
translation.zh: 但是白色药片就是没有蓝色的效果好

translation.en: What? (Laughter) That really flipped me out.
translation.zh: 什么？（笑声） 这真的让我很迷惑。

translation.en: Turns out though, that that's not even where it stops.
translation.zh: 但事实上，那还不是终结。

translation.en: If you have capsules, they're more effective than tablets in any form.
translation.zh: 如果你用胶囊， 它们比任何形式的药片更有效果。

translation.en: A colored capsule, that's yellow on one end and red on the other is better than a white capsule.
translation.zh: 有颜色的胶囊，一端黄色，另一端红色的 比白色的胶囊更有效。

translation.en: Dosage has something to do with this.
translation.zh: 剂量起到一定的作用。

translation.en: One pill twice a day is not as good at three pills -- I don't remember the statistic now. Sorry.
translation.zh: 一天两次，一次一片 没有三片效果好。 我现在记不清统计数据。对不起。

translation.en: But the point is ...
translation.zh: 但重点是。。。

translation.en: (Laughter) ... these dosages have something to do with it.
translation.zh: （笑声）剂量和药效有关。

translation.en: And the form has something to do with it.
translation.zh: 药剂形态和药效有关。

translation.en: And if you want the ultimate in placebo, you've go to the needle.
translation.zh: 如果你想要极限程度的安慰剂 你需要注射针剂。

translation.en: Right? A syringe with some inert -- a couple CCs of some inert something, and you inject this into a patient ...
translation.zh: 对吗？一个注射器含有 一两毫升的没有作用的东西， 你把这个注射到一个病人身上。。

translation.en: Well this is such a powerful image in their mind, it's so much stronger than the white pill.
translation.zh: 在他们脑海里，这是一个如此强大的想像， 它应该比白色药片要强很多很多。

translation.en: It's a really, this graph, well I'll show it to you some other time when we have slides.
translation.zh: 这真是一个很强的想象，等我有幻灯片的时候 我可以展示给你们统计数据图。

translation.en: The point is the white pill is not as good as the blue pill is not as good as the capsule is not as good as the needle.
translation.zh: 重点是， 白色药片没有蓝色药片好 没有胶囊好，没有针好。

translation.en: And none of it has any real pharmaceutical quality, it's only your belief that makes it real in your body and makes a stronger effect.
translation.zh: 它们都没有真的药效。 这仅仅是你的信念使它成真 在你身体上，也造成更强的效果。

translation.en: I wanted to see if I could take that idea and apply it to a magic trick.
translation.zh: 我想看看我是否可以拿这个想法 把它应用到魔法技巧上。

translation.en: And take something that is obviously a fake trick and make it seem real.
translation.zh: 采用一些明显是假的戏法 使它看起来是真的。

translation.en: And we know from that study that when you want reality, you go to the needle.
translation.zh: 我们从研究中知道 如果你想要实际效果，你采用注射针。

translation.en: This is a seven-inch hatpin. It's very, very sharp, and I'm going to just sterilize it a tiny bit.
translation.zh: 这是一个七寸的帽别针。它非常尖。 我将把它消一下毒。

translation.en: This is really my flesh. This is not Damian's special-grown flesh.
translation.zh: 这真是我的肌肉。这不是 戴米安的特买肉。

translation.en: That's my skin right there. This is not a Hollywood special effect.
translation.zh: 这就是我的皮肤。这不是好莱坞特效。

translation.en: I'm going to pierce my skin and run this needle through to the other side.
translation.zh: 我将会刺入我的皮肤 把这个针头穿过到另一边。

translation.en: If you're queasy -- (Laughs) if you faint easily -- I was doing this for some friends in the hotel room last night, and some people that I didn't know, and one woman almost passed out.
translation.zh: 如果你容易紧张反胃－－（笑声） 如果你容易晕－－我向一些朋友表演过 昨天在宾馆里，有些人我不认识， 有个女人差点晕倒。

translation.en: So, I suggest if you get queasy easy that you look away for about the next 30 -- in fact, you know what, I'll do the first bad part behind it.
translation.zh: 所以，我建议如果你容易紧张不安， 你最好在下面30秒里看别处， 实际上，你知道吗，我会在它后面做一开始的坏的部分。

translation.en: You'll get to see, you can look away too if you'd like to.
translation.zh: 你将会看到，你可以看别处如果你想的话。

translation.en: So, here is what happens, right here, the beginning of my flesh at the lower part of my arm I just make a little pierce.
translation.zh: 恩，这就是发生的，就在这里 我皮肉的起点处 我手臂的下部， 我就造成 一个小穿孔。

translation.en: I'm sorry, man. Am I freaking you out?
translation.zh: 对不起。我吓倒你们了吗？

translation.en: OK, and then just through my skin a tiny bit, and then out the other side like this.
translation.zh: 就穿过我的皮肤一点点 在另一端这样出来。

translation.en: Now, essentially we're in the same position we were in with the knife trick.
translation.zh: 现在， 我们基本上和刀的戏法 在同一个位置上。

translation.en: (Laughter) Sort of.
translation.zh: （笑声） （差不多）

translation.en: But you can't count my fingers right now can you?
translation.zh: 但你现在不能数我的手指了，对不？

translation.en: So, let me show them to you. That's one, two three, four, five.
translation.zh: 所以，让我来把它们展示给你们。一，二 三，四，五。

translation.en: Yes, well...
translation.zh: 是的，哦，

translation.en: I know what people think when they see this.
translation.zh: 我知道人们想什么当他们看到这个的时候。

translation.en: They go, "Well, he's certainly not dumb enough to stab himself through the skin to entertain us for a few minutes.
translation.zh: 他们说，“哦，他一定不会蠢到 刺穿他自己的皮肤来娱乐我们几分钟。”

translation.en: So, let me give you a little peek.
translation.zh: 所以，让我给你们偷看一下。

translation.en: How's that look out there? Pretty good.
translation.zh: 那看起来怎么样？很好。

translation.en: (Laughs) Yeah, I know. (Laughs) And the people in the back go, "OK, I didn't really see that."
translation.zh: （笑声） 对，我知道（笑声） 在后面的这些人说，“好。我并没有真的看到那个。“

translation.en: People in the satellite room are starting to move in now.
translation.zh: 在远程屋里的人现在 可以移近。

translation.en: Let me give you good close look at this.
translation.zh: 让我给你们仔细看看这个。

translation.en: That really is my skin. That is not a Hollywood special effect.
translation.zh: 这真的是我的皮肤。这个不是好莱坞特效。

translation.en: That's my flesh, and I can twist that around.
translation.zh: 那是我的肉，我还可以转动它。

translation.en: I'm sorry. If you're getting queasy, look away, don't look at the thing.
translation.zh: 对不起。如果你感到恶心的话，看别处， 别看这个。

translation.en: People in the back or people on video years from now watching this will go, "Well yeah, that looks kind of neat in some sort of effect there, but if it were real he would be -- see there's a hole there and a hole there, if it were real he would be bleeding.
translation.zh: 在后面的人或是几年后从录像上看到这个的 会说，“喔，那个看起来有点缺少 一些效果，但是如果这是真的他会 看到这有个洞，这也有个洞，如果这是真的他会流血。

translation.en: Well let me work up some blood for you.
translation.zh: 让我流点血给你们。

translation.en: (Laughter) Yes, there it is.
translation.zh: （笑声） 对，这就是。

translation.en: (Applause) (Laughter) Normally now, I would take the needle out.
translation.zh: （掌声） （笑声） 平常这时我会将针头取出。

translation.en: I would clean off my arm, and I would show you that there are no wounds.
translation.zh: 我会洗干净我的手臂，向你们展示我没有伤，

translation.en: But I think in this context and with the idea of taking something fake and making it into something real, I'm just going to leave it there, and walk off the stage.
translation.zh: 但我认为在这种情况下 以这种理念，使假的事物 变成真的事物， 我就将停在这里， 走下讲台。

translation.en: (Laughter) I will be seeing you several times over the next few days.
translation.zh: （笑声） 我将在以后几天内再见到你们。

translation.en: I hope you're looking forward to that. Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 我希望你们对此期待。非常感谢。

translation.en: (Laughter) (Applause) Hello, everyone. Because this is my first time at TED, I've decided to bring along an old friend to help break the ice a bit.
translation.zh: 笑声 （掌声） 大家好。　由于这是我第一次参加TED大会， 我决定带来一个老朋友 来开个好头。

translation.en: Yes. That's right. This is Barbie.
translation.zh: 正是，这是芭比娃娃。

translation.en: She's 50 years old. And she's looking as young as ever.
translation.zh: 她已经50岁了，但看起来却永远那么年轻。

translation.en: (Laughter) But I'd also like to introduce you to what may be an unfamiliar face.
translation.zh: （笑声） 我还要向你们介绍一位 有些陌生的面孔。

translation.en: This is Fulla. Fulla is the Arab world's answer to Barbie.
translation.zh: 这是福啦，福啦是阿拉伯世界的芭比。

translation.en: Now, according to proponents of the clash of civilizations, Barbie and Fulla occupy these completely separate spheres.
translation.zh: 现在，根据文明冲突的拥护者所说， 芭比和福啦是在两个完全不同的领域里。

translation.en: They have different interests. They have divergent values.
translation.zh: 她们有不同的兴趣。她们有非常不同的价值。

translation.en: And should they ever come in contact ...
translation.zh: 如果她们走到一起的话...

translation.en: well, I've got to tell you, it's just not going to be pretty.
translation.zh: 我可以告诉你，结果将是不堪设想。

translation.en: My experience, however, in the Islamic world is very different.
translation.zh: 不过，我在伊斯兰世界的经历却是非常不同的。

translation.en: Where I work, in the Arab region, people are busy taking up Western innovations and changing them into things which are neither conventionally Western, nor are they traditionally Islamic.
translation.zh: 我在阿拉伯区域工作， 人们忙于学习西方创新 并将他们变成自己的东西。 即不因循守旧的照抄西方， 也不是传统的伊斯兰。

translation.en: I want to show you two examples.
translation.zh: 我举两个例子给你。

translation.en: The first is 4Shbab.
translation.zh: 第一个是4Shbab

translation.en: It means "for youth" and it's a new Arab TV channel.
translation.zh: 意思是“青年”，是一个新的阿拉伯电视频道。

translation.en: (Video): Video clips from across the globe.
translation.zh: (视频): 席卷全球的视频片断

translation.en: The USA.
translation.zh: 美国

translation.en: ♫ I am not afraid to stand alone ♫ ♫ I am not afraid to stand alone, if Allah is by my side ♫ ♫ I am not afraid to stand alone ♫ ♫ Everything will be all right ♫ ♫ I am not afraid to stand alone ♫ The Arab world.
translation.zh: ♫我不怕独自挣扎♫ ♫如果真主在我身边，我不怕独自挣扎♫ ♫我不怕独自挣扎♫ ♫一切都会好起来的♫ ♫我不怕独自挣扎♫ 阿拉伯世界

translation.en: (Music) ♫ She was preserved by modesty of the religion ♫ ♫ She was adorned by the light of the Quran ♫ Shereen El Feki: 4Shbab has been dubbed Islamic MTV.
translation.zh: （音乐） ♫她为宗教的端庄所护♫ ♫她被圣书的光芒照耀♫ Shereen El Feki: 4Shbab被称为“伊斯兰的MTV”。
