translation.en: Its creator, who is an Egyptian TV producer called Ahmed Abu Haïba, wants young people to be inspired by Islam to lead better lives.
translation.zh: 创造者是一位叫Ahmed Abou Haïba的 埃及电视制片人， 他希望用伊斯兰去激励 年轻人过更好的生活。

translation.en: He reckons the best way to get that message across is to use the enormously popular medium of music videos.
translation.zh: 他认为传达这些信息的最好的方式就是 使用这些流行音乐电视。

translation.en: 4Shbab was set up as an alternative to existing Arab music channels.
translation.zh: 4Shbab 的初衷是成为一个不同的 阿拉伯音乐频道。

translation.en: And they look something like this.
translation.zh: 而传统的阿拉伯音乐频道往往是这个样子。

translation.en: (Music) That, by the way is Haifa Wehbe. She's a Lebanese pop star and pan-Arab pin-up girl.
translation.zh: （音乐） 那位，就是Haifa Wehbe. 她是黎巴嫩流行明星。 还是一位泛阿拉伯的封面女孩。

translation.en: In the world of 4Shbab, it's not about bump and grind.
translation.zh: 在 4Shbab 的世界里，扭屁股不是重点。

translation.en: But it's not about fire and brimstone either.
translation.zh: 但军火和硫磺也不是重点。

translation.en: Its videos are intended to show a kinder, gentler face of Islam, for young people to deal with life's challenges.
translation.zh: 这些视频向我们呈现了一个 有爱心,善良的伊斯兰教, 帮助年轻人去迎接生命中的挑战.

translation.en: Now, my second example is for a slightly younger crowd.
translation.zh: 第二个例子是关于一个相对年轻的团体，

translation.en: And it's called "The 99."
translation.zh: 他们被叫做“The 99.”

translation.en: Now, these are the world's first Islamic superheroes.
translation.zh: 现在，这些都是伊斯兰史上的超级英雄。

translation.en: They were created by a Kuwaiti psychologist called Naif Al Mutawa.
translation.zh: 是科威特的心理学家给予了他们生命 这位心理学家就是纳耶夫穆塔瓦(Nayef Al Mutawa)

translation.en: And his desire is to rescue Islam from images of intolerance, all in a child-friendly format.
translation.zh: 他的愿望就是以适合儿童的方式 将伊斯兰 从思想的狭隘中拯救出来。

translation.en: "The 99." The characters are meant to embody the 99 attributes of Allah: justice, wisdom, mercy, among others.
translation.zh: 在“The 99“ 中，这些人物是为了体现 真主的99个特征， 正义，智慧，仁慈等等。

translation.en: So, for example, there is the character of Noora.
translation.zh: 就拿娜拉(Noora)这个人物来说吧

translation.en: She is meant to have the power to look inside people and see the good and bad in everyone.
translation.zh: 她代表着力量 去窥探人们的内心 饱览善与恶

translation.en: Another character called Jami has the ability to create fantastic inventions.
translation.zh: 另一个人物是 贾米(Jami) 他拥有不可思议的创造力。

translation.en: Now, "The 99" is not just a comic book.
translation.zh: 现在，"the 99 “ 不仅仅只是一本漫画书。

translation.en: It's now a theme park.
translation.zh: 而是一个主题公园。

translation.en: There is an animated series in the works.
translation.zh: 有一个动画系列的作品

translation.en: And by this time next year, the likes of Superman and Wonder Woman will have joined forces with "The 99" to beat injustice wherever they find it.
translation.zh: 到明年这个时候 像超人与神奇女侠 将加入“The99” 共同与邪恶作战。

translation.en: "The 99" and 4Shbab are just two of many examples of this sort of Islamic cross-cultural hybridization.
translation.zh: “The99”和4Shbab只是其中的两个例子 来体现伊斯兰跨文化的融合。

translation.en: We're not talking here about a clash of civilizations.
translation.zh: 我们不是在讨论文化的分歧。

translation.en: Nor is it some sort of indistinguishable mash.
translation.zh: 也不是在讨论难以区分的混淆物。

translation.en: I like to think of it as a mesh of civilizations, in which the strands of different cultures are intertwined.
translation.zh: 我想把它当作文明的大杂烩， 不同的文化相互交织。

translation.en: Now, while 4Shbab and "The 99" may look new and shiny, there is actually a very long tradition of this.
translation.zh: 虽然4Shbab和“99”看上去是新鲜的事物， 其背后却蕴藏着悠久的历史。

translation.en: Throughout its history, Islam has borrowed and adapted from other civilizations both ancient and modern.
translation.zh: 在整个历史中，伊斯兰不断借鉴和适应着其它文明. 博古通今

translation.en: After all, it's the Quran which encourages us to do this: "We made you into nations and tribes so that you could learn from one another."
translation.zh: 毕竟，这正是《古兰经》鼓励我们去做的事。 “我们在你们之中创建了众多民族和宗教 这样你们就可以互相学习.”

translation.en: And to my mind, those are pretty wise words, no matter what your creed. Thank you.
translation.zh: 对于我来说，这句话中充满了智慧， 无论你的信仰是什么。谢谢

translation.en: (Applause) Can geographic information make you healthy?
translation.zh: （掌声） 地理环境是否 能使你身体更健康？

translation.en: In 2001 I got hit by a train.
translation.zh: 2001年我被一列车撞到。

translation.en: My train was a heart attack.
translation.zh: 我的心脏受到了损害。

translation.en: I found myself in a hospital in an intensive-care ward, recuperating from emergency surgery.
translation.zh: 醒来时我发现自己在医院 的一个加护病房里， 正从急救手术中恢复过来。

translation.en: And I suddenly realized something: that I was completely in the dark.
translation.zh: 我突然意识到： 自己完全被蒙在鼓里。

translation.en: I started asking my questions, "Well, why me?"
translation.zh: 我开始问自己：“为什么是我？”

translation.en: "Why now?" "Why here?"
translation.zh: 为什么是现在？为什么在这儿？

translation.en: "Could my doctor have warned me?"
translation.zh: “我的医生能否事先告诫我？”

translation.en: So, what I want to do here in the few minutes I have with you is really talk about what is the formula for life and good health.
translation.zh: 所以，在接下来的几分钟，我想与你们分享的是 一个健康的生命应由什么构成。

translation.en: Genetics, lifestyle and environment.
translation.zh: 遗传基因，生活方式和环境。

translation.en: That's going to sort of contain our risks, and if we manage those risks we're going to live a good life and a good healthy life.
translation.zh: 也就是说这些是我们将面对的风险因素， 如果我们处理好这些风险 我们的生活将会更健康更美好。

translation.en: Well, I understand the genetics and lifestyle part.
translation.zh: 当然 ，我了解基因和生活方式这两方面。

translation.en: And you know why I understand that?
translation.zh: 那你们知道我为什么了解吗？

translation.en: Because my physicians constantly ask me questions about this.
translation.zh: 因为我的内科医生不断地 询问这些方面的情况。

translation.en: Have you ever had to fill out those long, legal-size forms in your doctor's office?
translation.zh: 你是否在医生的办公处填写过， 那些标准大小规格的表格？

translation.en: I mean, if you're lucky enough you get to do it more than once, right?
translation.zh: 我是说，你们已幸运地做过多次这样的事，对吗？

translation.en: (Laughter) Do it over and over again. And they ask you questions about your lifestyle and your family history, your medication history, your surgical history, your allergy history ... did I forget any history?
translation.zh: （笑声） 一次又一次的重复。然后他们还要询问 你的生活方式，你的家庭史 你的药物治疗史，你的外科史 你的过敏史，恩...我还忘了其他的什么历史吗？

translation.en: But this part of the equation I didn't really get, and I don't think my physicians really get this part of the equation.
translation.zh: 但是对于这个部分，我并不是真正的知道。 而且我也不认为我的医生 真正的了解了这部分的信息。

translation.en: What does that mean, my environment?
translation.zh: 我的环境意味着什么？

translation.en: Well, it can mean a lot of things.
translation.zh: 实际上，它意味着很多事情。

translation.en: This is my life. These are my life places.
translation.zh: 这是我的生活。它们是我生活的地方。

translation.en: We all have these.
translation.zh: 我们每个人都拥有的。

translation.en: While I'm talking I'd like you to also be thinking about: How many places have you lived?
translation.zh: 我希望在我演讲时，你们都想想 你们在多少个地方生活过？

translation.en: Just think about that, you know, wander through your life thinking about this.
translation.zh: 在你的生活中时不时 想想这个问题。

translation.en: And you realize that you spend it in a variety of different places.
translation.zh: 你会意识到，你的生命在很多不同的地方度过。

translation.en: You spend it at rest and you spend it at work.
translation.zh: 你在不同的地方休息和工作。

translation.en: And if you're like me, you're in an airplane a good portion of your time traveling some place.
translation.zh: 如果是像我类的人，旅途过程中你将花相当一部分的时间 在机场这个地方。

translation.en: So, it's not really simple when somebody asks you, "Where do you live, where do you work, and where do you spend all your time?
translation.zh: 所以，我们总是很难回答类似的问题 你在哪儿生活？你在哪儿工作？ 你在哪儿度过你的时光？

translation.en: And where do you expose yourselves to risks that maybe perhaps you don't even see?"
translation.zh: 你在哪儿陷入那些 你甚至未意识到的危机之中？

translation.en: Well, when I have done this on myself, I always come to the conclusion that I spend about 75 percent of my time relatively in a small number of places.
translation.zh: 当我向自己发问时 我总能得出以下结论 我生命中大约75%的时间 都集中在几个地方度过。

translation.en: And I don't wander far from that place for a majority of my time, even though I'm an extensive global trekker.
translation.zh: 大部分的时间 我不会远离它们， 即使我是一位满世界跑的旅行者。

translation.en: Now, I'm going to take you on a little journey here.
translation.zh: 现在，我将带你们踏上我的几段旅途。

translation.en: I started off in Scranton, Pennsylvania.
translation.zh: 我从宾夕法尼亚的斯克兰顿出发。

translation.en: I don't know if anybody might hail from northeastern Pennsylvania, but this is where I spent my first 19 years with my little young lungs.
translation.zh: 我不知道现场是否有人来自宾西法尼亚州东北部。 但是这是我与我年轻活力的肺 一起呆了19年的地方。

translation.en: You know, breathing high concentrations here of sulfur dioxide, carbon dioxide and methane gas, in unequal quantities -- 19 years of this.
translation.zh: 在这里，我伴随着高浓度的 二氧化硫，二氧化碳 和甲烷 一起度过了我生命中的19年。

translation.en: And if you've been in that part of the country, this is what those piles of burning, smoldering coal waste look like.
translation.zh: 如果你也曾在这个地方住过， 你就会了解它们都是产生于就像这些一堆堆正在燃烧的煤渣。

translation.en: So then I decided to leave that part of the world, and I was going to go to the mid-west.
translation.zh: 所以，我决定离开那个地方。 然后打算迁到中西部。

translation.en: OK, so I ended up in Louisville, Kentucky.
translation.zh: 现在我在肯塔基州的路易斯维尔定居。

translation.en: Well, I decided to be neighbors to a place called Rubbertown.
translation.zh: 我打算成为橡胶镇的邻居。

translation.en: They manufacture plastics. They use large quantities chloroprene and benzene.
translation.zh: 这个镇生产塑料。生产过程中使用大量的氯丁二烯 和苯。

translation.en: Okay, I spent 25 years, in my middle-age lungs now, breathing various concentrations of that.
translation.zh: 就这样，我带着我那步入中年的肺 呼吸着充满氯丁二烯和奔的空气又生活了25年。

translation.en: And on a clear day it always looked like this, so you never saw it.
translation.zh: 在晴朗的天气里它显得那样的干净漂亮，你从不会发现这些毒气存在。

translation.en: It was insidious and it was really happening.
translation.zh: 但它却是真真实实的潜在地发生了。

translation.en: Then I decided I had to get really smart, I would take this job in the West Coast.
translation.zh: 然后我决定了我必须变得聪明， 我要在西海岸从事这个工作。

translation.en: And I moved to Redlands California.
translation.zh: 然后我又搬到了加利福尼亚州的瑞德兰兹。

translation.en: Very nice, and there my older, senior lungs, as I like to call them, I filled with particulate matter, carbon dioxide and very high doses of ozone.
translation.zh: 我带着年长的 肺（我喜欢这样称呼它们）生活在那里 之后我又发现了一些小问题，二氧化碳，臭氧的浓度非常高。

translation.en: Okay? Almost like the highest in the nation.
translation.zh: 甚至是整个国家最高点的。

translation.en: Alright, this is what it looks like on a good day.
translation.zh: 这个地方天气好的时候就像这样。

translation.en: If you've been there, you know what I'm talking about.
translation.zh: 如果你住过那里，你就会了解我正在说的。

translation.en: So, what's wrong with this picture?
translation.zh: 现在看看，这副图片存在什么问题？

translation.en: Well, the picture is, there is a huge gap here.
translation.zh: 是的，在图片的这里，有个巨大的空隙。

translation.en: The one thing that never happens in my doctor's office: They never ask me about my place history.
translation.zh: 在我医生的办公室从未发生过的一件事就是： 他们从未问过我的居住地情况。

translation.en: No doctor, can I remember, ever asking me, "Where have you lived?"
translation.zh: 我记得从未有过任何一个医生问过我： 你曾经在什么地方居住过？

translation.en: They haven't asked me what kind of the quality of the drinking water that I put in my mouth or the food that I ingest into my stomach.
translation.zh: 他们没有问过我 我饮用的水质量如何？ 或者我食用的食物的质量又如何？

translation.en: They really don't do that. It's missing.
translation.zh: 他们从未那样做过。

translation.en: Look at the kind of data that's available.
translation.zh: 看看这组数据。

translation.en: This data's from all over the world -- countries spend billions of dollars investing in this kind of research.
translation.zh: 这组数据是世界各国投入数亿美元 做此类研究所得出的。

translation.en: Now, I've circled the places where I've been.
translation.zh: 现在，我圈出了我们研究过的地方。

translation.en: Well, by design, if I wanted to have a heart attack I'd been in the right places. Right?
translation.zh: 现在，我必须在一些地方呆过 我才能得心脏病，对吗？

translation.en: So, how many people are in the white?
translation.zh: 所以，有多少人住在白色的这些地方？

translation.en: How many people in the room have spent the majority of their life in the white space?
translation.zh: 在坐的有多少人在这些白色地方 度过了你生命中的大部分时间？

translation.en: Anybody? Boy you're lucky.
translation.zh: 有吗？这个先生你很幸运。

translation.en: How many have spent it in the red places?
translation.zh: 又有多少人居住在这些红色区域？

translation.en: Oh, not so lucky.
translation.zh: 看来不是很幸运。

translation.en: There are thousands of these kinds of maps that are displayed in atlases all over the world.
translation.zh: 有成千上万副类似的图片， 在世界各地的 地图册中展示出来。

translation.en: They give us some sense of what's going to be our train wreck.
translation.zh: 他们提醒我们 发生火车碰撞后将会发生什么。

translation.en: But none of that's in my medical record.
translation.zh: 但是在我的医疗记录中没有任何相关的记录。

translation.en: And it's not in yours either.
translation.zh: 相信你们的也没有。

translation.en: So, here's my friend Paul.
translation.zh: 这是我的一位朋友Paul，

translation.en: He's a colleague. He allowed his cell phone to be tracked every two hours, 24/7, 365 days out of the year for the last two years, everywhere he went.
translation.zh: 是我同事，在过去的两年里，他将其移动电话设置为可以被追踪的 365天，每天 两个小时， 不管他到哪个地方。

translation.en: And you can see he's been to a few places around the United States.
translation.zh: 你可以看到他到过了美国的几个地方，

translation.en: And this is where he has spent most of his time.
translation.zh: 在这里他度过了大部分的时间。

translation.en: If you really studied that you might have some clues as to what Paul likes to do.
translation.zh: 如果你认真的观察这些地方，你可能从中猜出 Paul的爱好是什么。

translation.en: Anybody got any clues? Ski. Right.
translation.zh: 有人知道吗？是的，就是滑雪。

translation.en: We can zoom in here, and we suddenly see that now we see where Paul has really spent a majority of his time.
translation.zh: 我们聚焦这儿，我们马上会发现 在这些地方Paul度过了相当一部分的时光。

translation.en: And all of those black dots are all of the toxic release inventories that are monitored by the EPA.
translation.zh: 所有这些黑点 都是由EPA监测出的有毒气排放 记录的地方。

translation.en: Did you know that data existed?
translation.zh: 你们知道有这类数据存在吗？

translation.en: For every community in the United States, you could have your own personalized map of that.
translation.zh: 在美国的各个社区， 你们都可以领取属于你们自己的地图册。

translation.en: So, our cell phones can now build a place history.
translation.zh: 所以，我们的手机现在帮助建立我们的居住史。

translation.en: This is how Paul did it. He did it with his iPhone.
translation.zh: 这就是Paul用他的iPhone 所做的.

translation.en: This might be what we end up with.
translation.zh: 这可能即使我们最终想要达到的效果。

translation.en: This is what the physician would have in front of him and her when we enter that exam room instead of just the pink slip that said I paid at the counter. Right?
translation.zh: 当我们进入到治疗室时， 这个将呈现给我们的医生 而不是在柜台领取的那张表，对吗？

translation.en: This could be my little assessment.
translation.zh: 这个是我自己一个小猜测

translation.en: And he looks at that and he says, "Whoa Bill, I suggest that maybe you not decide, just because you're out here in beautiful California, and it's warm every day, that you get out and run at six o'clock at night.
translation.zh: 他可能看着那个然后说 “喔~Bill， 你居住， 你居住在美丽的加利福尼亚 每天都那么的温暖， 可能你决定每天晚上6点出去跑步，

translation.en: I'd suggest that that's a bad idea Bill, because of this report."
translation.zh: 但是从这组数据中看出 这将不会是个好主意。”

translation.en: What I'd like to leave you for are two prescriptions.
translation.zh: 今天我将留给你们是这样的两个处方：

translation.en: Okay, number one is, we must teach physicians about the value of geographical information.
translation.zh: 第一个：我们必须让我们的医生 了解到地理信息的价值所在。

translation.en: It's called geomedicine. There are about a half a dozen programs in the world right now that are focused on this.
translation.zh: 全世界正在做的研究 其中一半项目都在关注。

translation.en: And they're in the early stages of development.
translation.zh: 这些研究都处于起步阶段，

translation.en: These programs need to be supported, and we need to teach our future doctors of the world the importance of some of the information I've shared here with you today.
translation.zh: 都需要得到支持。 然后我们需要告诉我们未来全世界范围内的 医生们， 今天我与你们 一起分享的这些信息的重要性。

translation.en: The second thing we need to do is while we're spending billions and billions of dollars all over the world building an electronic health record, we make sure we put a place history inside that medical record.
translation.zh: 第二件事我们需要做的是： 当世界各地投入 亿万美元 去建立一个电子化的健康记录时， 我们必须确定将居住史 记录在内。

translation.en: It not only will be important for the physician; it will be important for the researchers that now will have huge samples to draw upon.
translation.zh: 它不仅对医生显得很重要， 为研究者也同样重要。 对此，我们可以举出大量的例子。

translation.en: But it will also be useful for us.
translation.zh: 同样对于我们自己也非常有用。

translation.en: I could have made the decision, if I had this information, not to move to the ozone capital of the United States, couldn't I? I could make that decision.
translation.zh: 如果我们拥有了这些信息， 无需到美国的臭氧中心就可以得出结论。 我可以吗？是的，我可以。

translation.en: Or I could negotiate with my employer to make that decision in the best interest of myself and my company.
translation.zh: 基于我自己和我公司的最大利益， 或者我可以与我的雇主谈判 做出决定。

translation.en: With that, I would like to just say that Jack Lord said this almost 10 years ago.
translation.zh: 有了那些，我可以说出Jack Lord 差不多十年前说过的话。

translation.en: Just look at that for a minute.
translation.zh: 花一分钟的时间看这，

translation.en: That was what the conclusion of the Dartmouth Atlas of Healthcare was about, was saying that we can explain the geographic variations that occur in disease, in illness, in wellness, and how our healthcare system actually operates.
translation.zh: 这是Dartmouth保健地图册 所得到的结论。 从中我们可以解释 在身体处于生病抑或是健康时地理区域的变化。 还有我们的保健系统又是怎么实际运行的。

translation.en: That was what he was talking about on that quote.
translation.zh: 这就是他在引用此数据时 所要阐述的。

translation.en: And I would say he got it right almost a decade ago.
translation.zh: 我要说在10年前他就正确的认识到了。

translation.en: So, I'd very much like to see us begin to really seize this as an opportunity to get this into our medical records.
translation.zh: 所以，我将非常欣喜的看到 我们能真正的抓住这个机会将居住史也涵盖在医疗记录中。

translation.en: So with that, I'll leave you that in my particular view of view of health: Geography always matters.
translation.zh: 所以我将带给你们 我个人对健康的看法： 就是地理总是问题所在。

translation.en: And I believe that geographic information can make both you and me very healthy. Thank you.
translation.zh: 而且我坚信了解地理信息 将会使你和我更加健康。谢谢！

translation.en: (Applause) We are drowning in news.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 我们被新闻包围了

translation.en: Reuters alone puts out three and a half million news stories a year.
translation.zh: 路透社一年 发布350万新闻故事

translation.en: That's just one source.
translation.zh: 这仅仅只是一个发布源

translation.en: My question is: How many of those stories are actually going to matter in the long run?
translation.zh: 我的问题是： 这些新闻到底有多少是长期有影响的

translation.en: That's the idea behind The Long News.
translation.zh: 这就是“长远新闻”（Long News）的意义

translation.en: It's a project by The Long Now Foundation, which was founded by TEDsters including Kevin Kelly and Stewart Brand.
translation.zh: 这是由Long Now基金会提出的一个项目 基金会由TED成员建立的 包括Kevin Kelly 和 Stewart Brand。

translation.en: And what we're looking for is news stories that might still matter 50 or 100 or 10,000 years from now.
translation.zh: 我们试图找出那些仍然会有深远影响的新闻故事 50， 100或者是一万年以后

translation.en: And when you look at the news through that filter, a lot falls by the wayside.
translation.zh: 我是说新闻进过上述条件过滤后 很多都会落在一边

translation.en: To take the top stories from the A.P. this last year, is this going to matter in a decade?
translation.zh: 假设你已经找出去年美联社的头条 这些头条在10年里内会有影响？

translation.en: Or this?
translation.zh: 或者这个？

translation.en: Or this?
translation.zh: 或者这个？

translation.en: Really?
translation.zh: 真的会吗？

translation.en: Is this going to matter in 50 or 100 years?
translation.zh: 会在50年或者100年内有影响吗

translation.en: Okay, that was kind of cool.
translation.zh: 好的，这样就很酷了

translation.en: (Laughter) But the top story of this past year was the economy, and I'm just betting that, sooner or later, this particular recession is going to be old news.
translation.zh: （笑） 但是去年的头条是经济 而且我敢打赌迟早， 这个特殊经济不景气会成为旧闻

translation.en: So, what kind of stories might make a difference for the future?
translation.zh: 那么，什么样的故事 可能对未来造成影响？

translation.en: Well, let's take science.
translation.zh: 好的，让我们先看看科学

translation.en: Someday, little robots will go through our bloodstreams fixing things.
translation.zh: 某一天，迷你机器人 能够在我们血液里面穿梭来修复受损

translation.en: That someday is already here if you're a mouse.
translation.zh: 如果你是一个老鼠的这个某一天已经到来，

translation.en: Some recent stories: nanobees zap tumors with real bee venom; they're sending genes into the brain; a robot they built that can crawl through the human body.
translation.zh: 几个最新的文章 纳米峰用真蜂毒液杀死肿瘤 他们向人脑里面植入基因 他们造的一个机器人可以在人体里爬行

translation.en: What about resources? How are we going to feed nine billion people?
translation.zh: 资源呢？我们该怎么样满足90亿人的需求

translation.en: We're having trouble feeding six billion today.
translation.zh: 我们现在连60亿人的肚子都填饱不了

translation.en: As we heard yesterday, there's over a billion people hungry.
translation.zh: 昨天我们听到，有超过10人处于饥饿中

translation.en: Britain will starve without genetically modified crops.
translation.zh: 没有转基因作物，英国人会挨饿

translation.en: Bill Gates, fortunately, has bet a billion on [agricultural] research.
translation.zh: 幸运的是比尔·盖茨投入10亿美元用于抗原研究

translation.en: What about global politics?
translation.zh: 那么国际政治方面呢？

translation.en: The world's going to be very different when and if China sets the agenda, and they may.
translation.zh: 这个世界会很不一样， 如果让中国设置议程 而他们有可能做到的

translation.en: They've overtaken the U.S. as the world's biggest car market, they've overtaken Germany as the largest exporter, and they've started doing DNA tests on kids to choose their careers.
translation.zh: 他们已经超过美国成为世界上最大的汽车市场 他们超过德国成为最大的出口国 他们已经开始在儿童身上做DNA测试 来给他们选择职业

translation.en: We're finding all kinds of ways to push back the limits of what we know.
translation.zh: 我们正在寻找各种方法推后我们知道的各种限制

translation.en: Some recent discoveries: There's an ant colony from Argentina that has now spread to every continent but Antarctica; there's a self-directed robot scientist that's made a discovery -- soon, science may no longer need us, and life may no longer need us either; a microbe wakes up after 120,000 years.
translation.zh: 一些最近的发现 有一个阿根廷的蚁群现在传播到了每一个大陆 除了南极洲 有一个自我导向的机器人科学家搞出了一个发明 很快，科学可能不再需要我们 而且生活也不再需要我们 一个微生物沉睡12万年之后复活

translation.en: It seems that with or without us, life will go on.
translation.zh: 好像有没有我们 生命都会继续

translation.en: But my pick for the top Long News story of this past year was this one: water found on the moon.
translation.zh: 但是我选择的去年的“长远新闻” 是这一个，月亮上找到了水

translation.en: Makes it a lot easier to put a colony up there.
translation.zh: 这使得人类在月亮上建立殖民地简单多了

translation.en: And if NASA doesn't do it, China might, or somebody in this room might write a big check.
translation.zh: 如果NASA不做这个，也许中国 或者在做的某些人会签上一个巨额支票

translation.en: My point is this: In the long run, some news stories are more important than others.
translation.zh: 我的想表明的观点是 长远来看，某些新闻故事 比其他的一些新闻更重要

translation.en: (Applause) In 2008, Cyclone Nargis devastated Myanmar.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 2008年Nargis台风袭击了缅甸

translation.en: Millions of people were in severe need of help.
translation.zh: 数百万人急需帮助

translation.en: The U.N. wanted to rush people and supplies to the area.
translation.zh: 联合国想调度人员、物资进入灾区

translation.en: But there were no maps, no maps of roads, no maps showing hospitals, no way for help to reach the cyclone victims.
translation.zh: 但是标明灾区道路的地图并不存在 地图上也没有标示医院，因此无法帮助台风受害的民众。

translation.en: When we look at a map of Los Angeles or London, it is hard to believe that as of 2005, only 15 percent of the world was mapped to a geo-codable level of detail.
translation.zh: 当我们看洛杉矶，伦敦的地图时 让人难以置信的是 截止到2005年全世界只有15%的地方 有精确地图可供地理软件使用

translation.en: The U.N. ran headfirst into a problem that the majority of the world's populous faces: not having detailed maps.
translation.zh: 联合国跟世界大部分的人们 遭遇到一样的问题： 没有详细的地图。

translation.en: But help was coming.
translation.zh: 幸好援助来了

translation.en: At Google, 40 volunteers used a new software to map 120,000 kilometers of roads, 3,000 hospitals, logistics and relief points.
translation.zh: 在谷歌有40个志愿者 用一个软件 标示了120,000公里的路 3000个医院，运输和救援中心

translation.en: And it took them four days.
translation.zh: 他们一共花了四天

translation.en: The new software they used? Google Mapmaker.
translation.zh: 他们用的软件？叫Google Mapmaker （地图创作家）

translation.en: Google Mapmaker is a technology that empowers each of us to map what we know locally.
translation.zh: Google Mapmaker 是一个允许我们 标注我们地方讯息的科技

translation.en: People have used this software to map everything from roads to rivers, from schools to local businesses, and video stores to the corner store.
translation.zh: 人们使用这套软件 在地图上标注了道路，河流 学校，地方企业 电影出租店到街角的商店。

translation.en: Maps matter.
translation.zh: 地图很重要

translation.en: Nobel Prize nominee Hernando De Soto recognized that the key to economic liftoff for most developing countries is to tap the vast amounts of uncapitalized land.
translation.zh: 诺贝尔奖被提名人Hernamdo De Soto认为 发展那些大量未被开发的土地 对发展中国家的经济跃进 起着关键性的作用。

translation.en: For example, a trillion dollars of real estate remains uncapitalized in India alone.
translation.zh: 举例来说，光在印度 还有三兆美元价值的不动产没被发展。

translation.en: In the last year alone, thousands of users in 170 countries have mapped millions of pieces of information, and created a map of a level of detail never thought viable.
translation.zh: 光在去年 在170个国家数千个使用者 在地图上加上了数百万笔的讯息 创造了前所未有的精确度

translation.en: And this was made possible by the power of passionate users everywhere.
translation.zh: 这都要感谢世界各地热情的使用者 使这一切变为可能。

translation.en: Let's look at some of the maps being created by users right now.
translation.zh: 现在让我们看一看 这些使用者标注地图的情况：

translation.en: So, as we speak, people are mapping the world in these 170 countries.
translation.zh: 就在我们在这里演说的同时 有170个国家的人在标示地图

translation.en: You can see Bridget in Africa who just mapped a road in Senegal.
translation.zh: 你可以看到在非洲的Bridget在标示赛内加尔的道路

translation.en: And, closer to home, Chalua, an N.G. road in Bangalore.
translation.zh: 离这近一点的Chulua在标示班加罗尔的NG路

translation.en: This is the result of computational geometry, gesture recognition, and machine learning.
translation.zh: 这是综合了计算机地理 动作识别，机器学习的结果

translation.en: This is a victory of thousands of users, in hundreds of cities, one user, one edit at a time.
translation.zh: 这是分布在数百个城市 数千个使用者的胜利 一个使用者，一次编辑一个讯息

translation.en: This is an invitation to the 70 percent of our unmapped planet.
translation.zh: 这也是对全球那70%还没标注地图 的地区的邀请

translation.en: Welcome to the new world.
translation.zh: 欢迎来到新世界

translation.en: (Applause) I only have three minutes so I'm going to have to talk fast, and it will use up your spare mental cycles, so multitasking may be hard.
translation.zh: （掌声） 我只有三分钟 所以我得说快点 这有点劳神，因为一心多用挺累人的

translation.en: So, 27 years ago I got a traffic ticket that got me thinking.
translation.zh: 我于27年前收到一张罚款单 这使我陷入沉思

translation.en: I've had some time to think it over.
translation.zh: 我想了又想

translation.en: And energy efficiency is more than just about the vehicle -- it's also about the road.
translation.zh: 节约能源不单是 改造交通工具的问题 也是改造道路问题

translation.en: Road design makes a difference, particularly intersections, of which there are two types: signalized and unsignalized, which means stop signs.
translation.zh: 道路设计，尤其是交叉路口设计尤为重要 交叉路口无非就两种：有交通信号灯的路口 和没交通信号灯但有路标的路口

translation.en: Fifty percent of crashes happen at intersections.
translation.zh: 近一半的事故发生在没交通信号灯的路口

translation.en: Roundabouts are much better.
translation.zh: 环状交叉路的情况好一些

translation.en: A study of 24 intersections has found crashes drop 40 percent from when you convert a traffic light into a roundabout.
translation.zh: 研究表明 当被测的24个交叉路口在改造成环状交叉路后 车祸事故发生率下降了40%

translation.en: Injury crashes have dropped 76 percent, fatal crashes down 90 percent.
translation.zh: 伤亡事故率下降了76% 恶性致命事故率下降了90%

translation.en: But that's just safety.
translation.zh: 不过这只是从安全角度考虑

translation.en: What about time and gas?
translation.zh: 时间和燃油呢？

translation.en: So, traffic keeps flowing, so that means less braking, which means less accelerating, less gas and less pollution, less time wasted, and that partly accounts for Europe's better efficiency than we have in the United States.
translation.zh: 只要交通流畅，司机就不会踩急刹车 也就不会加速，也就不会浪费燃油污染环境 也不会浪费时间 欧洲就是这样提高能源效率的 他们比美国做的好

translation.en: So, unsignalized intersections, meaning stop signs, they save many lives, but there's an excessive proliferation of them.
translation.zh: 没信号灯的交叉路口 只有信号牌，这可事关人命 但于欧洲，信号牌可是成倍的增长

translation.en: Small roundabouts are starting to appear.
translation.zh: 小型环状交叉路也开始出现

translation.en: This is one in my neighborhood. And they are much better -- better than traffic lights, better than four-way stop signs.
translation.zh: 这是我住的小区 这些环状交叉路可比信号灯和指示牌好使多了

translation.en: They're expensive to install, but they are more expensive not to. So, we should look at that.
translation.zh: 但价格却不菲 要是没有它们，我们会损失惨重，所以还是考虑一下吧

translation.en: But they are not applicable in all situations.
translation.zh: 但不是所有路口都可以改造成环状交叉路

translation.en: So, take, for example, the three-way intersection.
translation.zh: 譬如说，三岔路

translation.en: So, it's logical that you'd have one there, on the minor road entering the major.
translation.zh: 在次干道和主干道交会处安装 三岔路是明智之举

translation.en: But the other two are somewhat questionable.
translation.zh: 但对于另外两个次干道来说这方法不怎么可行

translation.en: So, here's one. There's another one which I studied.
translation.zh: 我研究过这个

translation.en: Cars rarely appear on that third road.
translation.zh: 车辆很少会从第三个路口开过来

translation.en: And so, the question is, what does that cost us?
translation.zh: 这意味着什么呢？

translation.en: That intersection I looked at had about 3,000 cars per day in each direction, and so that's two ounces of gas to accelerate out of.
translation.zh: 我研究的交叉路口每天各个方向大约有 3000辆车驶过 每踩一次油门会多消耗2盎司燃油

translation.en: That's five cents each, and times 3,000 cars per day, that's $51,000 per year.
translation.zh: 每盎司耗费5美分，那么每天3000辆车 那每年就多花费51000美元

translation.en: That's just the gasoline cost. There is also pollution, wear on the car, and time.
translation.zh: 这只不过是油钱，我还没算 车排放的尾气和浪费的时间

translation.en: What's that time worth?
translation.zh: 那到底浪费了多少时间呢

translation.en: Well, at 10 seconds per 3,000 cars, that's 8.3 hours per day. The average wage in the U.S.
translation.zh: 每一辆车要耗费10秒钟，3000辆车就是-- 每天八个半小时

translation.en: is $20 an hour. That is 60,000 per year.
translation.zh: 美国平均每小时工资为20美元，年工资是6万美元

translation.en: Add that together with the gas, and it's $112,000 per year, just for that sign in each direction.
translation.zh: 再加上油钱就是11万2千美元 这就是交通路标的耗资

translation.en: Discount that back to the present, at five percent: over two million dollars for a stop sign, in each direction.
translation.zh: 再加上近年来的5%的通货膨胀 总额超过200万 这就是在每个方向安装一个路标的成本

translation.en: Now, if you look at what that adjacent property is worth, you could actually buy the property, cut down the shrubbery to improve the sight line, and then sell it off again.
translation.zh: 再看看路口周围的地价 你基本上可以拿这200万买下周围的地皮 砍掉灌木丛开阔一下视野 然后转手卖出

translation.en: And you'd still come out ahead.
translation.zh: 还小有盈利

translation.en: So, it makes one wonder, "Why is it there?"
translation.zh: 我们不禁想：为什么？

translation.en: I mean, why is there that stop sign in each direction?
translation.zh: 为什么要在每个方向装路标呢？

translation.en: Because it is saving lives. So, is there a better way to accomplish that goal?
translation.zh: 因为救人要紧。那有没有更好的方法呢？

translation.en: The answer is to enable cars to come in from that side road safely.
translation.zh: 答案就是确保车辆 安全地从另一边驶出

translation.en: Because there are a lot of people who might live up there and if they're waiting forever a long queue could form because the cars aren't slowing down on the main road.
translation.zh: 因为那边有很多住户 车多了难免会排成一条长龙 因为主干道上的车速较快

translation.en: Can that be accomplished with existing signs?
translation.zh: 现有的条件下能做到这一点吗？

translation.en: So, there is a long history of stop signs and yield signs.
translation.zh: 交通路标的历史悠久

translation.en: Stop signs were invented in 1915, yield signs in 1950. But that's all we got.
translation.zh: 标志“停”于1915年问世 标志“让”出现在1950年。我们就只有这两种路标

translation.en: So, why not use a yield sign?
translation.zh: 为什么不用“让”呢？

translation.en: Well the meaning of yield is: You must yield the right-of-way.
translation.zh: 因为“让”意味着离开主线

translation.en: That means that if there are five cars waiting, you have to wait till they all go, then you go. It lacks the notion of alternating, or taking turns, and it's always on the minor road, allowing the major one to have primacy.
translation.zh: 就是说，要有5辆车等，你也得等 直到那5辆车开了，你才能走， 没什么换道啊，转弯啊 通常主干道有 优先权

translation.en: So, it's hard to create a new meaning for the existing sign.
translation.zh: 所以，现行的交通指示牌很难衍生出新意思

translation.en: You couldn't suddenly tell everyone, "OK, remember what you used to do at yield signs? Now do something different."
translation.zh: 没人能突然宣布： 看到“让”是不要“让”

translation.en: That would not work.
translation.zh: 这可不行

translation.en: So, what the world needs now is a new type of sign.
translation.zh: 所以我们需要的是 新型信号

translation.en: (Applause) So, you'd have a little instruction below it, you know, for those who didn't see the public service announcements.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 对于那些不看公共服务告示的人 新型路标下面还带有指示

translation.en: And it merges the stop sign and yield signs.
translation.zh: 是“停”和“让”的综合体

translation.en: It's kind of shaped like a T, as in taking turns.
translation.zh: 是"T"字形的

translation.en: And uncertainty results in caution.
translation.zh: 司机一旦不确定，就会提高警惕

translation.en: When people come to an unfamiliar situation they don't know how to deal with they slow down.
translation.zh: 人们在不熟悉的环境下不确定时 会减速慢行

translation.en: So, now that you are all "Road Scholars" ...
translation.zh: 那大家现在都是道路专家了

translation.en: (Laughter) don't wait for that sign to be adopted, these things don't change quickly.
translation.zh: （笑） 但别指望这会很快实现，这个过程总是漫长的

translation.en: But you all are members of communities, and you can exercise your community influence to create more sensible traffic flows.
translation.zh: 作为社区的一员 每人都有义务 确保交通的合理顺畅

translation.en: And you can have more impact on the environment just getting your neighborhood to change these things than by changing your vehicle. Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 你我皆能为环境保护作出贡献 只需以身作则，影响身边的人 大家一起行动来改善交通工具吧。谢谢

translation.en: (Applause) Hi. For those of you who haven't seen dancing bears, these are the dancing bears.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 你好，给你们当中没有见过舞蹈熊的人看看 这就是舞蹈熊

translation.en: In 1995, we started working on a two-year investigative research project to try and find out what was going on.
translation.zh: 在1995年我们发起了一个为期两年的调查研究课题 我们试着去调查事情的来龙去脉

translation.en: Because the sloth bears in the wild were obviously getting depleted because of this.
translation.zh: 因为野生的sloth熊数量显著下降，近乎绝迹 正因为如此

translation.en: This is the Qalandar community. They are a marginalized Islamic community who live across India, and have been in India since the 13th century.
translation.zh: 这就是卡拉海尔人，他们是一个不起眼的伊斯兰族分支 他们生活在印度的各地 从十三世纪开始，他们就已经生活在印度了

translation.en: We went about getting evidence of what was going on.
translation.zh: 我们开始寻找证据来弄清楚到底发生了什么

translation.en: And this is footage from a hidden camera in a button.
translation.zh: 这是一段通过隐藏在纽扣里的摄像机拍摄到的画面

translation.en: And we went in, pretending to be buyers.
translation.zh: 我们进门，装作是买家

translation.en: And we found this right in this very state, in Karnataka.
translation.zh: 我们正是在这个地方，卡纳塔克邦发现了这样的交易

translation.en: And the bear cubs were being harvested from across the country and being sold and traded.
translation.zh: 熊仔从全国各地搜罗而来 被买卖

translation.en: These were being sold for about 2,000 dollars each, and they are used for bear paw soup, and also being trained, later on, to become dancing bears like the one you just saw.
translation.zh: 这些熊仔卖价大约每只2000美元 他们将被用来做熊掌汤的 可能将来还会被训练 成为你刚刚看到的舞蹈熊

translation.en: Sadly, the family of Qalandars depended on this bear.
translation.zh: 令人心痛的是，卡拉海尔人的生计却还要指望这些熊

translation.en: The couple are barely 18 years old.
translation.zh: 这夫妇俩还不到18岁

translation.en: They already have four children beside them. You can see them.
translation.zh: 你可以看见，他们身边却已经有了四个孩子，

translation.en: And the economy of the family and their livelihood depended on those animals.
translation.zh: 整个家庭的经济支柱，生活来源就是这些动物

translation.en: So, we had to deal with it in a very practical and sustainable manner.
translation.zh: 所以，我们必须要以切合实际并且有可持续性的方法来对待这个问题

translation.en: Now, when we started working deeper and digging deeper, we found that it's an illegal act.
translation.zh: 眼下，我们展开了更加深入的工作，更深度的调查 我们发现（以熊为生）是违法行为

translation.en: These guys could go to jail for up to seven years if they were caught by authorities.
translation.zh: 他们可能会为此付出最高七年的牢狱之灾 如果被相关部门抓住的话

translation.en: And what they were doing to the bears was really appalling.
translation.zh: 他们对熊所做的种种行为实在是骇人听闻

translation.en: It was unacceptable.
translation.zh: 令人无法接受

translation.en: The mother bears are usually killed.
translation.zh: 通常熊妈妈会被杀死

translation.en: The cubs, which are taken, are separated.
translation.zh: 熊仔们被盗走，各自分离

translation.en: Their teeth are basically bashed out with a metal rod.
translation.zh: 他们的牙齿会被用铁棍敲掉

translation.en: And they use a red hot iron needle to make a hole through the muzzle.
translation.zh: 然后，他们的鼻孔会被烧红的铁杵穿洞

translation.en: Now we had to start changing these people and converting them from using that for a livelihood, to getting something else.
translation.zh: 现在，我们要开始改变那些人，让他们停止以做那些事 来谋生，去做其他的事情

translation.en: So, this is Bitu Qalandar, who was our first experiment.
translation.zh: 这是Bitu Kalander,他是我们的第一个“实验品”

translation.en: And we were so unsure that this would work.
translation.zh: 到底这能不能行?我们实在没有把握

translation.en: We weren't sure at all. And we managed to convince him.
translation.zh: 当时我们的确没有把握，但我们还是说服了他

translation.en: And we said, "Okay, here is some seed fund.
translation.zh: 我们说：“好，这是一些启动资金

translation.en: Let's see if you can get something else." And we got the bear surrendered to -- we set up a sanctuary. We have four sanctuaries in India.
translation.zh: 看看你能不能做些什么”接着他把熊交给了我们 我们建立了保护基地，在全印度我们有四所保护基地

translation.en: And now he sells cool drinks, he's by the highway.
translation.zh: 他现在高速公路边卖冷饮

translation.en: He has a telephone booth.
translation.zh: 他经营一个电话亭

translation.en: And then it started, there was no turning back after that.
translation.zh: 当这一切发生时，再也没有回头路了

translation.en: This is Sadua who came and surrendered his bear.
translation.zh: 这是Sadua，他来找我们，把他的熊交给了我们

translation.en: And now he runs a cattle fodder store and a grain store near Agra.
translation.zh: 而现在他经营着一个牛饲料店和谷物店 在印度北部阿格拉城附近

translation.en: Then there was no looking back at all for us.
translation.zh: 对我们所有人来说，这正是义无反顾的了

translation.en: We gave cycle rickshaws.
translation.zh: 我们提供人力三轮车

translation.en: We set up carpet-weaving units, vocational training for the women.
translation.zh: 我们建起了地毯编制单位 为妇女提供职业训练

translation.en: The women were just not allowed to come out of the community and work with mainstream society. So, we were able to address that.
translation.zh: 这些妇女们以前是不允许离开住宅区工作的 我们也在设法解决这个情况

translation.en: Education. The kids never went to school.
translation.zh: 教育。这些孩子从没有机会上学

translation.en: They only had Islamic education, very little of it.
translation.zh: 只有少的可怜的伊斯兰教育

translation.en: And they were never allowed to go to school because they were an extra earning hand at home. So we managed to get education.
translation.zh: 他们的上学的权利被剥夺了 因为他们也要赚钱养家。正因如此，我们想办法提供教育

translation.en: So, we sponsor 600 children education programs today.
translation.zh: 如今，我们为600个孩子提供教育资助

translation.en: We were able to ensure brighter futures for these people.
translation.zh: 我们为他们光明的未来创造了条件

translation.en: Of course we also had to get the bears in.
translation.zh: 当然，我们还是要拯救这些熊

translation.en: This is what happens to the bears when they come in.
translation.zh: 这是当时熊刚来时的状况

translation.en: And this is what we turn them into.
translation.zh: 只是经过转变后的现在

translation.en: We have a veterinary facility in our rescue centers.
translation.zh: 在拯救中心我们有专门的兽医机构

translation.en: So, basically in 2002 there were 1,200 dancing bears.
translation.zh: 大概的情况是：2002年 有一万两千只“舞蹈熊”

translation.en: We rescued over 550 dancing bears.
translation.zh: 其中我们拯救了超过五百五十只

translation.en: We've been able to ensure better futures for the people and the bears.
translation.zh: 我们为这些熊和以它们为生的人们提供了更好的将来

translation.en: The big news that I want to announce today is that next month we will be bringing in the very last bear of India, into our rescue center.
translation.zh: 今天，我们有一个重大的消息要宣布 那就是，下个月 印度最后一只舞蹈熊 也将要被我们的拯救中心收容

translation.en: (Applause) And India will no longer have to witness this cruel barbaric practice which has been here for centuries.
translation.zh: （掌声） 整个印度再也不用目睹这种持续了上百年的残忍而野蛮的行为了 整个印度再也不用目睹这种持续了上百年的残忍而野蛮的行为了

translation.en: And the people can hold their heads up high.
translation.zh: 为此人们可以感到骄傲

translation.en: And the Qalandar people will rise above all this cruel barbaric past that they've lived all their lives.
translation.zh: 卡拉海尔人可以从他们一代代经历的残忍而野蛮的历史中走出来 卡拉海尔人可以从他们一代代经历的残忍而野蛮的历史中走出来

translation.en: And the beautiful bears can of course live in the wild again.
translation.zh: 理所当然的，而那些美丽的熊可以重新在野外生活了

translation.en: And there will be no more removing of these bears.
translation.zh: 这些熊再也不会被捕捉被带走

translation.en: And the children, both humans and bear cubs can live peacefully. Thank you.
translation.zh: 这样我们的孩子们和小熊仔们 都可以过上安静平和的生活了。

translation.en: (Applause) First of all, I'm a geek.
translation.zh: （掌声） 首先，我是一位书呆子。

translation.en: I'm an organic food-eating, carbon footprint-minimizing, robotic surgery geek.
translation.zh: 我吃有机食品， 我是一位低碳生活者，我沉迷于机器人手术，

translation.en: And I really want to build green, but I'm very suspicious of all of these well-meaning articles, people long on moral authority and short on data, telling me how to do these kinds of things.
translation.zh: 而且我特别想建造绿色， 但我是个多疑的人 特别是对于这些好意的文章们， 人们常常注重道德规范 而缺少数据的支持 以来告诉我如何去做这些事。

translation.en: And so I have to figure this out for myself.
translation.zh: 所以我只能自己找寻答案。

translation.en: For example: Is this evil?
translation.zh: 例如：这是邪恶的吗？

translation.en: I have dropped a blob of organic yogurt from happy self-actualized local cows on my counter top, and I grab a paper towel and I want to wipe it up.
translation.zh: 我掉了一滴有机酸奶 在我的桌面上， 它来自当地的奶牛， 然后我拿来一张纸巾，我想把它擦干净。

translation.en: But can I use a paper towel? (Laughter) The answer to this can be found in embodied energy.
translation.zh: 但是我能用这个纸巾吗？（笑声） 这个答案能从内蕴能量中找到。

translation.en: This is the amount of energy that goes into any paper towel or embodied water, and every time I use a paper towel, I am using this much virtual energy and water.
translation.zh: 这就是任何一张手纸或者水的 内涵能源。 而每次我使用纸巾， 我会使用这么多 能量和水。

translation.en: Wipe it up, throw it away.
translation.zh: 擦干净它，再把它扔掉。

translation.en: Now, if I compare that to a cotton towel that I can use a thousand times, I don't have a whole lot of embodied energy until I wash that yogurty towel.
translation.zh: 现在，如果我用棉布和他进行对比 我能重复用上千次， 我不需要花费那么多内蕴能量 直到我需洗净这个酸奶抹布为止。

translation.en: This is now operating energy.
translation.zh: 现在我要说的是操作能量。

translation.en: So if I throw my towel in the washing machine, I've now put energy and water back into that towel ...
translation.zh: 如果我把抹布放入洗衣机， 我需要能量和水 去洗这个抹布，

translation.en: unless I use a front-loading, high-efficiency washing machine, (Laughter) and then it looks a little bit better.
translation.zh: 除非我用的是前置型高效洗衣机， 而它只是看上去好一点儿。

translation.en: But what about a recycled paper towel that comes in those little half sheets?
translation.zh: 但是一个可回收的纸巾会怎么样 特别是那些半张大小的？

translation.en: Well, now a paper towel looks better.
translation.zh: 恩，现在一张纸巾看起来好多了。

translation.en: Screw the paper towels. Let's go to a sponge.
translation.zh: 别想纸巾了。让我们看看海绵，

translation.en: I wipe it up with a sponge, and I put it under the running water, and I have a lot less energy and a lot more water.
translation.zh: 我用一个海绵擦，然后用水冲洗， 然后我用很少的能量和更多的水，

translation.en: Unless you're like me and you leave the handle in the position of hot even when you turn it on, and then you start to use more energy.
translation.zh: 除非你像我这样且你把手柄放在热水的一边 但即使当你打开它的时候， 你还是得使用更多的能量，

translation.en: Or worse, you let it run until it's warm to rinse out your towel.
translation.zh: 更糟糕的是，你或许会让水流着直到变热为止 以洗净你的抹布。

translation.en: And now all bets are off.
translation.zh: 现在我们不打赌了。

translation.en: (Laughter) So what this says is that sometimes the things that you least expect -- the position in which you put the handle -- have a bigger effect than any of those other things that you were trying to optimize.
translation.zh: （笑) 所以在这里要指出的是 有时候你最不在意的事， 比如你放手柄的位置， 比起其他的事情会造成更大的影响 特别是那些你试图去优化的事。

translation.en: Now imagine someone as twisted as me trying to build a house.
translation.zh: 现在想象一下一个人像我一样疯狂 的去试图建造一个房子。

translation.en: (Laughter) That's what my husband and I are doing right now.
translation.zh: （笑声） 那正是我和我丈夫正在做的事。

translation.en: And so, we wanted to know, how green could we be?
translation.zh: 而我们想知道我们到底可以有多环保。

translation.en: And there's a thousand and one articles out there telling us how to make all these green trade-offs.
translation.zh: 而且那里有数以千计的文章 来告诉我们怎么去做绿色的交换。

translation.en: And they are just as suspect in telling us to optimize these little things around the edges and missing the elephant in the living room.
translation.zh: 而且他们就是 告诉我们去优化一些边角小物 从而忽略了眼前庞然大物。

translation.en: Now, the average house has about 300 megawatt hours of embodied energy in it; this is the energy it takes to make it -- millions and millions of paper towels.
translation.zh: 现在，平均每家 需要消耗300千瓦时 的内蕴能量。 这些能量可以制造出， 成千上万的纸巾。

translation.en: We wanted to know how much better we could do.
translation.zh: 我们想知道我怎么能做的更好。

translation.en: And so, like many people, we start with a house on a lot, and I'm going to show you a typical construction on the top and what we're doing on the bottom.
translation.zh: 所以，就如同很多人一样， 我们从普通的房子开始， 同时我会向你们展示一个普通房顶的建设过程 而且我们在底下做什么。

translation.en: So first, we demolish it.
translation.zh: 第一，我们先消减一部分。

translation.en: It takes some energy, but if you deconstruct it -- you take it all apart, you use the bits -- you can get some of that energy back.
translation.zh: 它会消耗一些能量，但是如果你拆除它， 你把它都拆了，你用一些， 你可以回收一些能量。

translation.en: We then dug a big hole to put in a rainwater catchment tank to take our yard water independent.
translation.zh: 我们之后挖了一个大洞 把雨水收集到水箱里 以用来独立灌溉我们的花园。

translation.en: And then we poured a big foundation for passive solar.
translation.zh: 然后我们建造一个大型 的太阳能收集板。

translation.en: Now, you can reduce the embodied energy by about 25 percent by using high fly ash concrete.
translation.zh: 现在，通过使用尘土飞扬的水泥 你可以减免 25%的能耗。

translation.en: We then put in framing.
translation.zh: 我们之后做了一个框架。

translation.en: And so this is framing -- lumber, composite materials -- and it's kind of hard to get the embodied energy out of that, but it can be a sustainable resource if you use FSC-certified lumber.
translation.zh: 这个框架是用木头 和合成材料作成的， 所以很难收回这些能量， 如果你用F.S.C. 验证的木材 它们是可成为可持续性的能源。

translation.en: We then go on to the first thing that was very surprising.
translation.zh: 我们之后发现 一件惊奇的事。

translation.en: If we put aluminum windows in this house, we would double the energy use right there.
translation.zh: 如果用铝制窗装饰我们的房屋， 我们能双倍利用这能量。

translation.en: Now, PVC is a little bit better, but still not as good as the wood that we chose.
translation.zh: PVC比这好一点， 但是还是没办法媲美我们选的木头。

translation.en: We then put in plumbing, electrical and HVAC, and insulate.
translation.zh: 我们之后安装了电器、采暖通风与空调系统 抽水马桶 以及隔热设备。

translation.en: Now, spray foam is an excellent insulator -- it fills in all the cracks -- but it is pretty high embodied energy, and, sprayed-in cellulose or blue jeans is a much lower energy alternative to that.
translation.zh: 当下，喷射式泡沫是非常好的隔热材料，它可以填入所有的地方， 但是它非常耗费能量。 喷洒式纤维素或者牛仔裤布料 是可选用的低耗能替代品。

translation.en: We also used straw bale infill for our library, which has zero embodied energy.
translation.zh: 我们同时也用秸秆包 填充在我们的书房， 而这些是零耗能的东西。

translation.en: When it comes time to sheetrock, if you use EcoRock it's about a quarter of the embodied energy of standard sheetrock.
translation.zh: 当我们使用石膏灰胶纸夹板， 如果你用EcoRock，它只耗费的 普通石膏灰胶纸夹板¼的能量。

translation.en: And then you get to the finishes, the subject of all of those "go green" articles, and on the scale of a house they almost make no difference at all.
translation.zh: 然后你完成的时候， 回顾下那些所有关于“绿色”的文章。 它们对于整间房子的调控， 我们和他们几乎是一样。

translation.en: And yet, all the press is focused on that.
translation.zh: 但所有的媒体都在关注它们。

translation.en: Except for flooring.
translation.zh: 除了地面。

translation.en: If you put carpeting in your house, it's about a tenth of the embodied energy of the entire house, unless you use concrete or wood for a much lower embodied energy.
translation.zh: 如果你在家里放入地毯， 它大概占用整间屋子消耗能量的1/10， 除非你选择水泥或者木头 这可使内蕴能量总量更低。

translation.en: So now we add in the final construction energy, we add it all up, and we've built a house for less than half of the typical embodied energy for building a house like this.
translation.zh: 现在我们把能量总量加起来， 我们已经建造了一座同样类型 但是只消耗了一般房子的一半内蕴能量。

translation.en: But before we pat ourselves too much on the back, we have poured 151 megawatt hours of energy into constructing this house when there was a house there before.
translation.zh: 但是在我们过多拍我们自己的 后背以表彰我们自己之前， 我们已经消耗了151千瓦时 去建造这个房子， 当那儿之前有一座房子。

translation.en: And so the question is: How could we make that back?
translation.zh: 所以问题是： 我们如何把那些找回来？

translation.en: And so if I run my new energy-efficient house forward, compared with the old, non-energy-efficient house, we make it back in about six years.
translation.zh: 而且如果继续使用我的新节能房， 对比老式的，非节能房， 我们回到了大概6年前。

translation.en: Now, I probably would have upgraded the old house to be more energy-efficient, and in that case, it would take me more about 20 years to break even.
translation.zh: 现在，我大概会去升级改造那座旧房子 使它变的更加节能。 如果是那个情况， 它会耗费我大概20年去平衡。

translation.en: Now, if I hadn't paid attention to embodied energy, it would have taken us over 50 years to break even compared to the upgraded house.
translation.zh: 现在，如果我不去关注能量总量， 它会耗费我们 超过50年的时间去平衡 对比已经升级过的房子。

translation.en: So what does this mean?
translation.zh: 这意味着什么？

translation.en: On the scale of my portion of the house, this is equivalent to about as much as I drive in a year, it's about five times as much as if I went entirely vegetarian.
translation.zh: 按我建造房子的比例， 这相当于 我开车一年， 大概是五倍于 我成为完全素食主义者。

translation.en: But my elephant in the living room flies.
translation.zh: 但是在我眼前最终显而易见的事中。

translation.en: Clearly, I need to walk home from TED.
translation.zh: 显然，我需要从TED走路回家。

translation.en: But all the calculations for embodied energy are on the blog.
translation.zh: 但是在Blog中有对于所有 能量总量的计算。

translation.en: And, remember, it's sometimes the things that you are not expecting to be the biggest changes that are.
translation.zh: 同时，记住，有时候你从没有期待的事情 正是最大的变化所在。

translation.en: Thank you. (Applause) I'd like to share with you a discovery that I made a few months ago while writing an article for Italian Wired.
translation.zh: 谢谢。（掌声） 我想把我几个月之前的一个大发现与大家分享一下 我当时正在为一家意大利杂志"Wired"写一篇文章

translation.en: I always keep my thesaurus handy whenever I'm writing anything, but I'd already finished editing the piece, and I realized that I had never once in my life looked up the word "disabled" to see what I'd find.
translation.zh: 我在写作的时候总是把同义词词典放在手边 我当时已经把文章编辑完了 才意识到我一生中还从来没有 在字典中查找“残疾的”的具体意思

translation.en: Let me read you the entry.
translation.zh: 让我把这个词条念给大家听

translation.en: "Disabled, adjective: crippled, helpless, useless, wrecked, stalled, maimed, wounded, mangled, lame, mutilated, run-down, worn-out, weakened, impotent, castrated, paralyzed, handicapped, senile, decrepit, laid-up, done-up, done-for, done-in cracked-up, counted-out; see also hurt, useless and weak.
translation.zh: “残疾的”，形容词，意为：“残废的，无助的，无用的，残破的 停滞的，被破坏的，受伤的，被损毁的，跛脚的，被肢解的 破损的，累坏了的，虚弱的，无力的，丧失力量的，瘫痪的，身体功能存在障碍的 衰老的，破旧的，被闲置的，精疲力尽的，没用的，疲劳的 破烂的，不被考虑的” 另见：“受伤的，无用的，虚弱的”

translation.en: Antonyms, healthy, strong, capable."
translation.zh: 反义词：“健康的，强壮的，有能力的”

translation.en: I was reading this list out loud to a friend and at first was laughing, it was so ludicrous, but I'd just gotten past "mangled," and my voice broke, and I had to stop and collect myself from the emotional shock and impact that the assault from these words unleashed.
translation.zh: 我当时把以上内容出声地读给我一个朋友听，一开始我笑了 这太荒唐了 当我念到“被损毁了”的时候，我哽咽了 我不得不停下来 让自己被这些词汇打击与侮辱后恢复情绪

translation.en: You know, of course, this is my raggedy old thesaurus so I'm thinking this must be an ancient print date, right?
translation.zh: 是的，我的这本老同义词词典也很破旧了 我想，这本词典也一定是很老的版本了

translation.en: But, in fact, the print date was the early 1980s, when I would have been starting primary school and forming an understanding of myself outside the family unit and as related to the other kids and the world around me.
translation.zh: 但实际上，它的出版日期却是上世纪80年代 当时我应该刚上小学 在家庭之外的大环境下形成对自己的认知 并且与我身边的孩子们和世界建立联系

translation.en: And, needless to say, thank God I wasn't using a thesaurus back then.
translation.zh: 谢天谢地，我当年没用过同义词词典

translation.en: I mean, from this entry, it would seem that I was born into a world that perceived someone like me to have nothing positive whatsoever going for them, when in fact, today I'm celebrated for the opportunities and adventures my life has procured.
translation.zh: 我的意思是，通过同义词词典上对“残疾的”这一词的解释 就能看出，我所生活的世界并不认可像我这样的残疾人 这个世界认为我们残疾人身上毫无积极向上的因素 然而今天，我却在为我人生为我带来的一切历险与机会 庆幸不已

translation.en: So, I immediately went to look up the 2009 online edition, expecting to find a revision worth noting.
translation.zh: 所以，我立刻上网查“残疾的”这一词在2009年版本同义词词典中的解释 我当时期待着看到一些重要的修订

translation.en: Here's the updated version of this entry.
translation.zh: 下面我给大家读“残疾的”这一词新版本的解释

translation.en: Unfortunately, it's not much better.
translation.zh: 很不幸，词条的解释没比当年强多少

translation.en: I find the last two words under "Near Antonyms," particularly unsettling: "whole" and "wholesome."
translation.zh: 这个词条中"接近反义词"中的两个词尤其让我很不好受 它们是：“完整的，健全的”

translation.en: So, it's not just about the words.
translation.zh: 实际上，这不仅仅是几个单词的事

translation.en: It's what we believe about people when we name them with these words.
translation.zh: 当人们用那种消极的词汇形容残疾人的时候，实际上反映出来的是人们对残疾人的看法

translation.en: It's about the values behind the words, and how we construct those values.
translation.zh: 值得注意的是描述残疾人的那些词汇的背后所体现的人们内心的价值观，以及这种价值观形成的过程

translation.en: Our language affects our thinking and how we view the world and how we view other people.
translation.zh: 我们的语言影响着我们的思维 以及我们看待这个世界的方式、看待他人的方式

translation.en: In fact, many ancient societies, including the Greeks and the Romans, believed that to utter a curse verbally was so powerful, because to say the thing out loud brought it into existence.
translation.zh: 实际上，包括古希腊、古罗马等许多古代社会 都相信言语诅咒的巨大威力 因为话一旦被说了出来，便是真实地存在了

translation.en: So, what reality do we want to call into existence: a person who is limited, or a person who's empowered?
translation.zh: 那么，我们究竟想让什么样的事物存在呢 是一个没有能力的人，还是一个有能力的人呢

translation.en: By casually doing something as simple as naming a person, a child, we might be putting lids and casting shadows on their power.
translation.zh: 有时候，我们只是随便地给一个成人或孩子命名 却有可能限制住了他们的发展，给他们蒙上阴影，让他们对自己的能力质疑

translation.en: Wouldn't we want to open doors for them instead?
translation.zh: 难道我们不想为他们开启心灵之门么

translation.en: One such person who opened doors for me was my childhood doctor at the A.I. duPont Institute in Wilmington, Delaware.
translation.zh: 我的生命中就有这样一个人，为我开启了心灵之门，他是在我小时候照顾我的一位医生 他在德拉华州威尔明顿的A.I. Dupont研究院工作

translation.en: His name was Dr. Pizzutillo, an Italian American, whose name, apparently, was too difficult for most Americans to pronounce, so he went by Dr. P.
translation.zh: 他的名字叫Pizzutillo 是一位意大利裔美国人 很显然，他的名字很多美国人念出来都很困难 下面不妨就叫他P医生好了

translation.en: And Dr. P always wore really colorful bow ties and had the very perfect disposition to work with children.
translation.zh: P医生总是打着色彩鲜艳的领结 他为人的修养、气质使得他和孩子们相处得很好

translation.en: I loved almost everything about my time spent at this hospital, with the exception of my physical therapy sessions.
translation.zh: 除了身体训练课程之外 我在他的医院里面度过的时光都是很快乐的

translation.en: I had to do what seemed like innumerable repetitions of exercises with these thick, elastic bands -- different colors, you know -- to help build up my leg muscles, and I hated these bands more than anything -- I hated them, had names for them. I hated them.
translation.zh: 我要用那种很粗的、五颜六色的、富有弹性的带子 一遍又一遍地做着体能训练 锻炼腿部肌肉 我简直恨透那些带子了 恨透了，我甚至还给它们都起了名字

translation.en: And, you know, I was already bargaining, as a five year-old child, with Dr. P to try to get out of doing these exercises, unsuccessfully, of course.
translation.zh: 当时我还是个五岁的孩子，便和P医生讨价还价 求他别再让我那些体能训练了 当然，我没有得逞

translation.en: And, one day, he came in to my session -- exhaustive and unforgiving, these sessions -- and he said to me, "Wow. Aimee, you are such a strong and powerful little girl, I think you're going to break one of those bands.
translation.zh: 然而有一天，P医生在我做体能训练的时候来看我了 嗯，那些无情的、令人精疲力尽的体能训练 然后他对我说：“艾米，你真是个强壮的小姑娘啊 我感觉有一天你能把这些带子弄断

translation.en: When you do break it, I'm going to give you a hundred bucks."
translation.zh: 你弄断的时候，我就奖励你100美元“

translation.en: Now, of course, this was a simple ploy on Dr. P's part to get me to do the exercises I didn't want to do before the prospect of being the richest five-year-old in the second floor ward, but what he effectively did for me was reshape an awful daily occurrence into a new and promising experience for me.
translation.zh: 很显然，这是P医生的一个小把戏罢了 他只不过是想让我做这些我根本不爱做的体能训练 用“有一天变成所有二楼病房五岁病人中最富有的”来诱惑我 但是P医生确实成功做到了一件事情 那便是将一个我所痛恨的日程转化为一个全新的、充满了前景的经历

translation.en: And I have to wonder today to what extent his vision and his declaration of me as a strong and powerful little girl shaped my own view of myself as an inherently strong, powerful and athletic person well into the future.
translation.zh: 今天，我常常在思考，P医生当年的视野 以及他给我的“强壮的小姑娘”这一称谓 对我自我认知的影响有多么大 现如今，我已经能认识到我的内在是强壮有力的，我的未来一片光明

translation.en: This is an example of how adults in positions of power can ignite the power of a child.
translation.zh: P医生的这个例子就很好的说明了 一位拥有力量的成年人能够点燃一个孩子的潜能

translation.en: But, in the previous instances of those thesaurus entries, our language isn't allowing us to evolve into the reality that we would all want, the possibility of an individual to see themselves as capable.
translation.zh: 但是，在更前面提到的那个同义词词典的例子中 我们的语言并没能让我们把我们所希望看到的事物变成现实 并没能让残疾人意识到他们自己实际上是有能力的

translation.en: Our language hasn't caught up with the changes in our society, many of which have been brought about by technology.
translation.zh: 科技的发展带动社会的发展 而我们的语言并没有随着社会与时俱进

translation.en: Certainly, from a medical standpoint, my legs, laser surgery for vision impairment, titanium knees and hip replacements for aging bodies that are allowing people to more fully engage with their abilities, and move beyond the limits that nature has imposed on them -- not to mention social networking platforms allow people to self-identify, to claim their own descriptions of themselves, so they can go align with global groups of their own choosing.
translation.zh: 当然，从医学的角度来讲 我的假腿，修复我视力的激光手术 人工钛金膝盖，为老年人提供的股骨头替换手术 种种这些技术都能使得人们更充分地运用他们的能力 并且超越自然环境施加给他们的种种限制 并且为我们这些残疾人搭建社交平台 让我们这些人能自我认同 从而允许我们在全球范围内选择结交的对象

translation.en: So, perhaps technology is revealing more clearly to us now what has always been a truth: that everyone has something rare and powerful to offer our society, and that the human ability to adapt is our greatest asset.
translation.zh: 所以说，科技正更清楚地向我们展示着 一个永恒的真理 那就是，我们每一个人都是非常强大的，都是能为社会做贡献的 以及适应环境的能力是人类最伟大的资本

translation.en: The human ability to adapt, it's an interesting thing, because people have continually wanted to talk to me about overcoming adversity, and I'm going to make an admission: This phrase never sat right with me, and I always felt uneasy trying to answer people's questions about it, and I think I'm starting to figure out why.
translation.zh: 谈起人类适应环境这一本领，我感觉很有意思 因为人们经常想让我就“克服逆境”这一话题讲一讲 今天我想做一点声明 “克服逆境”这一说对我来说根本不成立 别人让我就这一话题说几句的时候，我很不自在 我开始思考为什么会这样

translation.en: Implicit in this phrase of "overcoming adversity" is the idea that success, or happiness, is about emerging on the other side of a challenging experience unscathed or unmarked by the experience, as if my successes in life have come about from an ability to sidestep or circumnavigate the presumed pitfalls of a life with prosthetics, or what other people perceive as my disability.
translation.zh: “克服逆境”这个词有一个隐含的意思 那就是成功，或者快乐 都在一段艰难的经历的另一端 而这段经历本身却与成功和快乐无关 就好像是说，我这一生之所以能成功 是因为我绕过了作为一个截肢人所要面临的一系列挑战 绕过在别人看来制约我的一些因素

translation.en: But, in fact, we are changed. We are marked, of course, by a challenge, whether physically, emotionally or both.
translation.zh: 但实际上，这些挑战实实在在地改变了我们，在我们的人生旅程中烙下了印记 这种改变可能是身体上的，可能是精神上的，也可能两者兼具

translation.en: And I'm going to suggest that this is a good thing.
translation.zh: 我想说的是，面临挑战不失为一件好事

translation.en: Adversity isn't an obstacle that we need to get around in order to resume living our life.
translation.zh: 面对逆境，我们不应把它当成障碍绕过它 从而继续我们的生活

translation.en: It's part of our life.
translation.zh: 其实，逆境是我们生活的一部分

translation.en: And I tend to think of it like my shadow.
translation.zh: 我把逆境想象成我自己的影子

translation.en: Sometimes I see a lot of it, sometimes there's very little, but it's always with me.
translation.zh: 有的时候它看起来很大，有的时候很小 但是它始终在我身边

translation.en: And, certainly, I'm not trying to diminish the impact, the weight, of a person's struggle.
translation.zh: 当然，我不是试图贬低人们与逆境作斗争的价值和意义

translation.en: There is adversity and challenge in life, and it's all very real and relative to every single person, but the question isn't whether or not you're going to meet adversity, but how you're going to meet it.
translation.zh: 我们在一生中注定要经历逆境与挑战 我们每个人都是 但是我们所关注的问题并不是你是否要去面对逆境 而是如何去面对它

translation.en: So, our responsibility is not simply shielding those we care for from adversity, but preparing them to meet it well.
translation.zh: 所以，我们的责任不是简简单单地让我们关心的人生活在温床里 而是让他们能够形成从容应对逆境的能力

translation.en: And we do a disservice to our kids when we make them feel that they're not equipped to adapt.
translation.zh: 当我们让孩子们觉得自己没有适应环境的能力时 我们实际上伤害了他们

translation.en: There's an important difference and distinction between the objective medical fact of my being an amputee and the subjective societal opinion of whether or not I'm disabled.
translation.zh: 从医学的角度客观地判断我是否是一个残疾人 从社会的角度主观地去考虑我是否是一个“残疾人” 此两者间有很大的差别

translation.en: And, truthfully, the only real and consistent disability I've had to confront is the world ever thinking that I could be described by those definitions.
translation.zh: 实际上，我自始至终所要面对的唯一的一个问题 是这个世界对我的种种不公的看法和描述

translation.en: In our desire to protect those we care about by giving them the cold, hard truth about their medical prognosis, or, indeed, a prognosis on the expected quality of their life, we have to make sure that we don't put the first brick in a wall that will actually disable someone.
translation.zh: 我们希望能够保护那些我们在意的人们 我们把冷冰冰的医师诊断报告告诉他们 或者有时候，为他们未来的生活状态做预测 但是我们一定要注意我们的所做所为 是否会摧毁这些人们

translation.en: Perhaps the existing model of only looking at what is broken in you and how do we fix it, serves to be more disabling to the individual than the pathology itself.
translation.zh: 也许，人们习惯了只专注于自己的种种缺陷 并想着如何修复这些缺陷 这种思维定式对残疾人的伤害比残疾人本身的生理缺陷更严重

translation.en: By not treating the wholeness of a person, by not acknowledging their potency, we are creating another ill on top of whatever natural struggle they might have.
translation.zh: 我们不从一个整体的角度看待残疾人 不去承认他们的能力 这对他们本身就很艰难的处境无疑是雪上加霜

translation.en: We are effectively grading someone's worth to our community.
translation.zh: 我们能有效地对一个人对其所在社会的的价值进行评估

translation.en: So we need to see through the pathology and into the range of human capability.
translation.zh: 因此，我们的目光不应该局限在残疾人生理上的缺陷 而是应该注意到他们作为人的价值

translation.en: And, most importantly, there's a partnership between those perceived deficiencies and our greatest creative ability.
translation.zh: 另外，最重要的一点 残疾人的一些缺陷和人类的创造力之间 是存在着联系的

translation.en: So it's not about devaluing, or negating, these more trying times as something we want to avoid or sweep under the rug, but instead to find those opportunities wrapped in the adversity.
translation.zh: 所以，艰辛的奋斗岁月是不该被贬低、否定的 这不是什么我们要避免或者掩盖的事 恰恰相反，我们应该在逆境中寻找机遇

translation.en: So maybe the idea I want to put out there is not so much overcoming adversity as it is opening ourselves up to it, embracing it, grappling with it, to use a wrestling term, maybe even dancing with it.
translation.zh: 其实，我想说明的道理就是 逆境，不是用来"克服"的 我们应该坦然面对它 拥抱它 与它摔打 我刚才用了一个摔角的术语（摔打） 甚至，与它舞蹈

translation.en: And, perhaps, if we see adversity as natural, consistent and useful, we're less burdened by the presence of it.
translation.zh: 也许，如果我们能把逆境看成是自然的、不间断的、对人有用的东西 它的存在对我们来说也不再是负担了

translation.en: This year we celebrate the 200th birthday of Charles Darwin, and it was 150 years ago, when writing about evolution, that Darwin illustrated, I think, a truth about the human character.
translation.zh: 今年我们庆祝了达尔文的200周年诞辰 当达尔文在150年前写物种进化论的时候 他阐明了一个关于人类特征的真理

translation.en: To paraphrase: It's not the strongest of the species that survives, nor is it the most intelligent that survives; it is the one that is most adaptable to change.
translation.zh: 他说的那句话大概意思就是，能生存下来的物种 往往不是最强壮的，也不是最聪明的 而是最能适应外部环境变化的

translation.en: Conflict is the genesis of creation.
translation.zh: 矛盾冲突是创造之母

translation.en: From Darwin's work, amongst others, we can recognize that the human ability to survive and flourish is driven by the struggle of the human spirit through conflict into transformation.
translation.zh: 达尔文等诸位大师的著作都揭示了这一点 人类生存繁衍的能力 源自人类灵魂经历激烈斗争后的转变 就是这样

translation.en: So, again, transformation, adaptation, is our greatest human skill.
translation.zh: 我再重申一遍，人类最伟大的能力，是转变和适应

translation.en: And, perhaps, until we're tested, we don't know what we're made of.
translation.zh: 也许，在我们接受考验之前，我们不知道自己会是什么样子

translation.en: Maybe that's what adversity gives us: a sense of self, a sense of our own power.
translation.zh: 可能这就是逆境所能起到的作用 一种对自我以及个人能力的认识

translation.en: So, we can give ourselves a gift.
translation.zh: 所以，我们可以给自己一份礼物

translation.en: We can re-imagine adversity as something more than just tough times.
translation.zh: 我们可以把逆境想成一次改变的机遇

translation.en: Maybe we can see it as change.
translation.zh: 而不是艰辛的岁月

translation.en: Adversity is just change that we haven't adapted ourselves to yet.
translation.zh: 逆境是一种改变，而我们只不过还没来得及对其适应

translation.en: I think the greatest adversity that we've created for ourselves is this idea of normalcy.
translation.zh: 我认为，我们给自己创造的最大的困境 是"正统"这一概念

translation.en: Now, who's normal?
translation.zh: 好吧，究竟什么又是“正统”呢

translation.en: There's no normal.
translation.zh: “正统”并不存在

translation.en: There's common, there's typical. There's no normal, and would you want to meet that poor, beige person if they existed?
translation.zh: 我知道什么是“普通的”，什么是“典型的”，但我不知道什么是“正统的” 如果真的有那种贫困的、面黄肌瘦的所谓的“正统人”，你会对他们感兴趣么

translation.en: (Laughter) I don't think so.
translation.zh: （笑） 我想不会吧

translation.en: If we can change this paradigm from one of achieving normalcy to one of possibility -- or potency, to be even a little bit more dangerous -- we can release the power of so many more children, and invite them to engage their rare and valuable abilities with the community.
translation.zh: 如果我们不把精力投入到追求“正统”当中 而是投入到发现各种各样的可能性，发掘各种各样的能力，冒险一下 很多孩子的潜能都会被更好的激发 他们将会充分运用他们独一无二的宝贵的能力，为他们的社区做贡献

translation.en: Anthropologists tell us that the one thing we as humans have always required of our community members is to be of use, to be able to contribute.
translation.zh: 人类学家告诉我们 我们作为人类总是希望我们所在群体中的人们是有用的 是有能力做贡献的

translation.en: There's evidence that Neanderthals, 60,000 years ago, carried their elderly and those with serious physical injury, and perhaps it's because the life experience of survival of these people proved of value to the community.
translation.zh: 六万年前的尼安德特社会就是一个很好的证据 尼安德特人抚养他们社会中的老弱病残 因为他们坚信 老人们丰富的人生阅历是对他们整个社会是很有价值的

translation.en: They didn't view these people as broken and useless; they were seen as rare and valuable.
translation.zh: 老人们从来不会被视作无用的 相反，他们被视为非常珍贵的

translation.en: A few years ago, I was in a food market in the town where I grew up in that red zone in northeastern Pennsylvania, and I was standing over a bushel of tomatoes.
translation.zh: 几年前的一天，我正在故乡的菜市场 就是宾州东北部的那片红区 我当时正站在一筐西红柿旁边

translation.en: It was summertime: I had shorts on.
translation.zh: 因为正值夏天，我穿的是短裤

translation.en: I hear this guy, his voice behind me say, "Well, if it isn't Aimee Mullins."
translation.zh: 在我的身后传来了一个男子的声音“唉？这不是艾米•慕林斯么”

translation.en: And I turn around, and it's this older man. I have no idea who he is.
translation.zh: 我转过身来，发现是一位我不认识的老者

translation.en: And I said, "I'm sorry, sir, have we met? I don't remember meeting you."
translation.zh: 然后我说，“先生不好意思，我们见过面么？我记不得你了”

translation.en: He said, "Well, you wouldn't remember meeting me.
translation.zh: 他说，“嗯，你是不会记得咱们之间的那次见面的

translation.en: I mean, when we met I was delivering you from your mother's womb."
translation.zh: 因为当时，我正把你从你母亲的子宫里接生出来“

translation.en: (Laughter) Oh, that guy.
translation.zh: （笑） 呵呵，我遇到的就是这么一个人

translation.en: And, but of course, actually, it did click.
translation.zh: 当然，最后我想起来了

translation.en: This man was Dr. Kean, a man that I had only known about through my mother's stories of that day, because, of course, typical fashion, I arrived late for my birthday by two weeks.
translation.zh: 这个人就是基恩大夫 我只是通过母亲当年给我讲的故事才知道这么一个人 我是一个晚产儿，晚产了两周

translation.en: And so my mother's prenatal physician had gone on vacation, so the man who delivered me was a complete stranger to my parents.
translation.zh: 当时负责在我母亲临产期照顾她的医生度假去了 所以最后就由基恩大夫这个我父母之前都不认识的人给我接生了

translation.en: And, because I was born without the fibula bones, and had feet turned in, and a few toes in this foot and a few toes in that, he had to be the bearer -- this stranger had to be the bearer of bad news.
translation.zh: 我出生的时候就没有腓骨 我的脚、脚趾都错位了 基恩大夫不得不传达两个坏消息

translation.en: He said to me, "I had to give this prognosis to your parents that you would never walk, and you would never have the kind of mobility that other kids have or any kind of life of independence, and you've been making liar out of me ever since."
translation.zh: 他对我说,"我当年把诊断报告告诉了你父母 我说，你将永远不会行走 你也永远不会像其他孩子那样跑跑跳跳 你将永远无法独立的生活 可从那以后，你却通过你的努力把我变成了一个大骗子”

translation.en: (Laughter) (Applause) The extraordinary thing is that he said he had saved newspaper clippings throughout my whole childhood, whether winning a second grade spelling bee, marching with the Girl Scouts, you know, the Halloween parade, winning my college scholarship, or any of my sports victories, and he was using it, and integrating it into teaching resident students, med students from Hahnemann Medical School and Hershey Medical School.
translation.zh: （笑） （鼓掌） 基恩先生做了一件伟大的事情 他从我童年开始就把报纸上所有关于我的报道都剪下来收集了 其中包括我二年级的时候在一次拼字比赛中获胜 和女童子军在万圣节的时候参加游行 大学的时候获得奖学金，以及我种种在体育比赛中的成绩 基恩大夫在用我的故事教育当地的学生们 他用我的故事教育哈奈曼医学院和赫尔希医学院的学生

translation.en: And he called this part of the course the X Factor, the potential of the human will.
translation.zh: 他把我的这些故事叫做他课程中的X因素 叫做人类意志所激发的无穷潜力

translation.en: No prognosis can account for how powerful this could be as a determinant in the quality of someone's life.
translation.zh: 没有任何医疗诊断能够解释这种意志的威力有多么巨大 意志能影响一个人的生活质量

translation.en: And Dr. Kean went on to tell me, he said, "In my experience, unless repeatedly told otherwise, and even if given a modicum of support, if left to their own devices, a child will achieve."
translation.zh: 基恩大夫继续对我说 “尽管有很多次别人都反驳我的观点，根据我的经历 对于孩子们，即使给予他们的支持很少 他们自己也能有所成就”

translation.en: See, Dr. Kean made that shift in thinking.
translation.zh: 看吧，基恩大夫的想法改变了

translation.en: He understood that there's a difference between the medical condition and what someone might do with it.
translation.zh: 他认识到了医疗诊断的结果以及一个人处理这种结果的方式之间 是存在差异的

translation.en: And there's been a shift in my thinking over time, in that, if you had asked me at 15 years old, if I would have traded prosthetics for flesh-and-bone legs, I wouldn't have hesitated for a second.
translation.zh: 几年来，我的想法也有了一定的转变 比如，如果你在我15岁的时候问我 愿不愿意用我现在的假肢换一双真腿 我会毫不犹豫地答应

translation.en: I aspired to that kind of normalcy back then.
translation.zh: 因为我渴望得到那种“正统”

translation.en: But if you ask me today, I'm not so sure.
translation.zh: 但是如果你今天问我同样的问题，我就要三思了

translation.en: And it's because of the experiences I've had with them, not in spite of the experiences I've had with them.
translation.zh: 这是因为我使用假肢的这段经历 对我的影响很大

translation.en: And perhaps this shift in me has happened because I've been exposed to more people who have opened doors for me than those who have put lids and cast shadows on me.
translation.zh: 也许，我已经由内而外地脱胎换骨了 因为，在我所遇到的人里面 为我开启通向新世界的门的人远远多于给我心灵蒙上阴影的人

translation.en: See, all you really need is one person to show you the epiphany of your own power, and you're off.
translation.zh: 看吧，你们所需要的就是这样一个人 他能向你展示你自己的力量

translation.en: If you can hand somebody the key to their own power -- the human spirit is so receptive -- if you can do that and open a door for someone at a crucial moment, you are educating them in the best sense.
translation.zh: 人类的灵魂是包容的 如果你能够给他人一把钥匙，让他自己用这把钥匙开启自己的力量 并且在关键时刻，你能用这把钥匙为别人开启一扇门 你就是在用最好的方式对他们进行教育

translation.en: You're teaching them to open doors for themselves.
translation.zh: 因为你在教他们自己为自己开启通向新世界之门

translation.en: In fact, the exact meaning of the word "educate" comes from the root word "educe."
translation.zh: 实际上，“教育”这个词的意义 来源于“唤出”这个词

translation.en: It means "to bring forth what is within, to bring out potential."
translation.zh: “唤出”，即把深藏在里面的东西引出来 发掘潜能

translation.en: So again, which potential do we want to bring out?
translation.zh: 那么，我们究竟希望发掘出什么样的潜能呢

translation.en: There was a case study done in 1960s Britain, when they were moving from grammar schools to comprehensive schools.
translation.zh: 这里有个上世纪60年代英国的案例 英国的孩子从小学升到初中这一过程

translation.en: It's called the streaming trials. We call it "tracking" here in the States.
translation.zh: 在英国叫做“统考”，在美国我们管它叫“追踪考试”

translation.en: It's separating students from A, B, C, D and so on.
translation.zh: 考试把学生们按照成绩从高到低分成A、B、C、D四等

translation.en: And the "A students" get the tougher curriculum, the best teachers, etc.
translation.zh: A等的学生学更难的课程，有更好的老师，等等

translation.en: Well, they took, over a three-month period, D-level students, gave them A's, told them they were "A's," told them they were bright, and at the end of this three-month period, they were performing at A-level.
translation.zh: 这个实验为期三个月 按照成绩应该被归为D等学生被告知他们是A等的学生 他们被告知自己是非常聪明的 三个月的实验结束的时候 这群学生的表现已经相当于A等生了

translation.en: And, of course, the heartbreaking, flip side of this study, is that they took the "A students" and told them they were "D's."
translation.zh: 当然，这个案例研究也有其令人心寒的另一面 那就是，那些本应该被归为A等的学生被告知他们是D等学生

translation.en: And that's what happened at the end of that three-month period.
translation.zh: 三个月的实验结束的时候

translation.en: Those who were still around in school, besides the people who had dropped out.
translation.zh: 他们中的很多人已经辍学了

translation.en: A crucial part of this case study was that the teachers were duped too.
translation.zh: 这个实验的一个要点就是，参与实验的老师们也是不知情的

translation.en: The teachers didn't know a switch had been made.
translation.zh: 老师们不知道学生被调包了

translation.en: They were simply told, "These are the 'A-students,' these are the 'D-students.'" And that's how they went about teaching them and treating them.
translation.zh: 老师们只是被告知哪些是A等生，哪些是D等生 老师也随即"因材施教"了

translation.en: So, I think that the only true disability is a crushed spirit, a spirit that's been crushed doesn't have hope, it doesn't see beauty, it no longer has our natural, childlike curiosity and our innate ability to imagine.
translation.zh: 所以，我认为真正的“残疾”是一个被击败的灵魂 一个对未来没有希望的灵魂 一个无法感知美好的灵魂 一个丧失了孩子般天真的好奇心的灵魂 一个丧失了人类与生俱来的想象力的灵魂

translation.en: If instead, we can bolster a human spirit to keep hope, to see beauty in themselves and others, to be curious and imaginative, then we are truly using our power well.
translation.zh: 假如，我们能够让人类的灵魂始终保持希望 让这灵魂能看到自己以及他人的美 赋予这灵魂好奇心以及想象力 那么我们就算是在很好地运用自己的力量了

translation.en: When a spirit has those qualities, we are able to create new realities and new ways of being.
translation.zh: 只要一个灵魂仍然具备上述的那些品质，那么它就能创造无限可能 以及新的生活方式

translation.en: I'd like to leave you with a poem by a fourteenth-century Persian poet named Hafiz that my friend, Jacques Dembois told me about, and the poem is called "The God Who Only Knows Four Words": "Every child has known God, not the God of names, not the God of don'ts, but the God who only knows four words and keeps repeating them, saying, 'Come dance with me.
translation.zh: 我想在最后送给大家一首诗 诗的作者是十四世纪的波斯诗人哈菲斯 这首诗是我的一个朋友，雅克•邓波讲给我的 诗的名字叫《一个只知道四个字的神》 "每个孩子都知道神的存在 不是有名字的神 不是给你施加种种金规玉律的神 而是一个只会说四个字，并且一遍又一遍重复着它们的神 祂在说，与我共舞

translation.en: Come, dance with me. Come, dance with me.'" Thank you.
translation.zh: 与我共舞！” 谢谢大家

translation.en: (Applause) I'm a writer and a journalist, and I'm also an insanely curious person, so in 22 years as a journalist, I've learned how to do a lot of new things.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 我是一个作家，一个新闻记者， 我也是一位具有强烈求知欲的人。 所以在做新闻记者的22年里， 我知道了很多新奇的事物。

translation.en: And three years ago, one of the things I learned how to do was to become invisible.
translation.zh: 而三年前，我学会做的一件事就是 变成隐形人。

translation.en: I became one of the working homeless.
translation.zh: 我成了一个无家可归的工作者。

translation.en: I quit my job as a newspaper editor after my father died in February of that same year, and decided to travel.
translation.zh: 我辞掉了报纸编辑的工作 在我父亲那年二月去世之后 我决定去旅行

translation.en: His death hit me pretty hard.
translation.zh: 他的去世对我打击非常大。

translation.en: And there were a lot of things that I wanted to feel and deal with while I was doing that.
translation.zh: 当时这么做，是因为有很多我想去感知和处理的事。

translation.en: I've camped my whole life. And I decided that living in a van for a year to do this would be like one long camping trip.
translation.zh: 旅游时我天天都在露营。并且决定 在休旅车里住一年 就当作是一段长期野营旅行。

translation.en: So I packed my cat, my Rottweiler and my camping gear into a 1975 Chevy van, and drove off into the sunset, having fully failed to realize three critical things.
translation.zh: 所以，我就带上我的猫，我的罗特威尔犬 和露营的装备装载到1975产的雪佛莱旅游车上， 开车去看日落 但当时完全没想过三件严重的事

translation.en: One: that society equates living in a permanent structure, even a shack, with having value as a person.
translation.zh: 一：社会将住房 即使是很小的房间， 和人的价值等同起来。

translation.en: Two: I failed to realize how quickly the negative perceptions of other people can impact our reality, if we let it.
translation.zh: 二：我没有意识到 其他人的负面言语 对我们本身的影响是多么严重，假如我们放任不管。

translation.en: Three: I failed to realize that homelessness is an attitude, not a lifestyle.
translation.zh: 三：我没有意识到 无家可归是一种生活态度 而不是一种生活方式。

translation.en: At first, living in the van was great.
translation.zh: 一开始，住在车里是很不错的。

translation.en: I showered in campgrounds. I ate out regularly.
translation.zh: 我在露天洗澡，正常的去外面吃东西。

translation.en: And I had time to relax and to grieve.
translation.zh: 而且有时间去抒发情感。

translation.en: But then the anger and the depression about my father's death set in.
translation.zh: 但是后来，因我父亲去世而带来的悲愤和痛沮开始加剧。

translation.en: My freelance job ended. And I had to get a full-time job to pay the bills.
translation.zh: 我自由作家的工作结束了。我就需要去找一件全职工作 来支付我的账单。

translation.en: What had been a really mild spring turned into a miserably hot summer.
translation.zh: 从一个非常温和的春天 变到一个极其炎热的夏天会怎样呢。

translation.en: And it became impossible to park anywhere -- (Laughs) -- without being very obvious that I had a cat and a dog with me, and it was really hot.
translation.zh: 不管车停在哪都是难以忍受的 （笑声） 不用说也很明显 我带着一只猫和一只狗，而且非常的热。

translation.en: The cat came and went through an open window in the van.
translation.zh: 猫从车窗来回的跑。

translation.en: The doggy went into doggy day care.
translation.zh: 狗跑到了狗狗护理中心。

translation.en: And I sweated.
translation.zh: 我则大汗淋漓。

translation.en: Whenever I could, I used employee showers in office buildings and truck stops.
translation.zh: 不管什么时候，只要可以，我就会去用 在办公大楼和卡车车站里员工用的淋浴。

translation.en: Or I washed up in public rest rooms.
