translation.zh: 或者在公共卫生间里洗洗。

translation.en: Nighttime temperatures in the van rarely dropped below 80 degrees Fahrenheit, making it difficult or impossible to sleep.
translation.zh: 在夜里车里的温度很少会降到华氏80度以下， 这使我几乎无法入睡。

translation.en: Food rotted in the heat.
translation.zh: 食物在高温下腐坏。

translation.en: Ice in my ice chest melted within hours, and it was pretty miserable.
translation.zh: 冷藏柜里的冰几个小时就化完了， 非常苦闷的时期。

translation.en: I couldn't afford to find an apartment, or couldn't afford an apartment that would allow me to have the Rottweiler and the cat.
translation.zh: 我没钱找公寓， 或者找不到让我 可以养狗和猫的地方。

translation.en: And I refused to give them up, so I stayed in the van.
translation.zh: 我不想把它们抛弃。 所以我继续待在旅行车里。

translation.en: And when the heat made me too sick to walk the 50 feet to the public restroom outside my van at night, I used a bucket and a trash bag as a toilet.
translation.zh: 但炎热的天气使我饱受折磨 以至于在夜里走50英尺 到车外面的公共卫生间都懒的动。 我用桶和垃圾袋当厕所。

translation.en: When winter weather set in, the temperatures dropped below freezing. And they stayed there.
translation.zh: 当冬天来临的时候，温度骤降 到零度以下。然后就一直这么冷。

translation.en: And I faced a whole new set of challenges.
translation.zh: 我又遇到了一堆新问题，

translation.en: I parked a different place every night so I would avoid being noticed and hassled by the police.
translation.zh: 每晚我的车都停在不同的地方。 这样才可以不让警察发现以至于和警察争吵。

translation.en: I didn't always succeed.
translation.zh: 当然，并不是每次都成功。

translation.en: But I felt out of control of my life.
translation.zh: 但是，我觉得我已无力掌控自己的生活了。

translation.en: And I don't know when or how it happened, but the speed at which I went from being a talented writer and journalist to being a homeless woman, living in a van, took my breath away.
translation.zh: 我也不知道什么时候或者是如何发生的， 我这么快就从一个 有才的写手，新闻从业者 变成一个无家可归，住在车里的女人 这简直是快的难以置信。

translation.en: I hadn't changed. My I.Q. hadn't dropped.
translation.zh: 我并没有变。我的智商没有降低。

translation.en: My talent, my integrity, my values, everything about me remained the same.
translation.zh: 我的才能，我的正直，我的价值， 所有关于我的这些东西都还是一样。

translation.en: But I had changed somehow.
translation.zh: 但是从某种程度上，我还是改变了，

translation.en: I spiraled deeper and deeper into a depression.
translation.zh: 我越来越沮丧，像一个漩涡一样不断地往下沉。

translation.en: And eventually someone referred me to a homeless health clinic.
translation.zh: 后来有人介绍我去一个专为无家可归之人开的健康诊所。

translation.en: And I went. I hadn't bathed in three days.
translation.zh: 我去了。我有三天都没有洗澡了，

translation.en: I was as smelly and as depressed as anyone in line.
translation.zh: 我和其他那些排队的人一样沮丧，身上的味道也很难闻。

translation.en: I just wasn't drunk or high.
translation.zh: 我只是没有喝醉或者兴奋。

translation.en: And when several of the homeless men realized that, including a former university professor, they said, "You aren't homeless. Why are you really here?"
translation.zh: 当一些无家可归的人意识到， 包括一个以前在大学任教的教授， 他们说：“你不是无家可归，你真正在这里的原因是什么？”

translation.en: Other homeless people didn't see me as homeless, but I did.
translation.zh: 其他的无家可归的人不把我当作是无家可归的人看待。 但是我自己是这么认为的。

translation.en: Then the professor listened to my story and he said, "You have a job. You have hope.
translation.zh: 后来，教授听了我的故事后他说， “你有工作，有希望。

translation.en: The real homeless don't have hope."
translation.zh: 真正无家可归的人并没有希望可言。”

translation.en: A reaction to the medication the clinic gave me for my depression left me suicidal. And I remember thinking, "If I killed myself, no one would notice."
translation.zh: 诊所针对我沮丧开的药物的副作用 让我有点自杀的倾向。我还记得当时想， “如果我自杀了，可能没人会发现的”

translation.en: A friend told me, shortly after that, that she had heard that Tim Russert, a nationally renowned journalist, had been talking about me on national T.V.
translation.zh: 在那不久后，我的一个朋友就告诉我， 她听说提姆 路塞特， 一个全国知名的记者 在全国播放的电视节目上谈论到了我。

translation.en: An essay I'd written about my father, the year before he died, was in Tim's new book.
translation.zh: 一篇我写的关于我父亲的短文， 在他去世前一年写的，被收录到了提姆的新书里。

translation.en: And he was doing the talk show circuit. And he was talking about my writing.
translation.zh: 他那时在做巡回演讲，提到我的写作。

translation.en: And when I realized that Tim Russert, former moderator of "Meet the Press," was talking about my writing, while I was living in a van in a Wal-Mart parking lot, I started laughing.
translation.zh: 当我发现提姆 路塞特，前Meet the Press节目的调解员， 在谈论我的写作。 而我却生活在停在沃尔玛停车场里的旅行车里面， 我开始笑了，

translation.en: You should too.
translation.zh: 呵，你们也该笑笑。

translation.en: (Laughter) I started laughing because it got to the point where, was I a writer, or was I a homeless woman?
translation.zh: （笑声） 我开始笑， 因为这正是问题根结， 我是一位作家呢，还是一位无家可归的女人？

translation.en: So I went in the bookstore. And I found Tim's book.
translation.zh: 于是我走进一家书店。找到提姆的书。

translation.en: And I stood there. And I reread my essay.
translation.zh: 我站在那，又重新读了一遍我写的短文。

translation.en: And I cried.
translation.zh: 我哭了。

translation.en: Because I was a writer.
translation.zh: 因为我是一位作家，

translation.en: I was a writer.
translation.zh: 是一位作家。

translation.en: Shortly after that I moved back to Tennessee.
translation.zh: 在那之后，我很快就搬回了田纳西。

translation.en: I alternated between living in a van and couch surfing with friends.
translation.zh: 有时住在车里，有时会去朋友家睡沙发。

translation.en: And I started writing again.
translation.zh: 我又重新开始写作了。

translation.en: By the summer of the following year I was a working journalist.
translation.zh: 在接踵而来的夏天里，我又成为了一名新闻记者。

translation.en: I was winning awards. I was living in my own apartment.
translation.zh: 我得了奖，住在我自己的公寓里。

translation.en: I was no longer homeless.
translation.zh: 我不再无家可归。

translation.en: And I was no longer invisible.
translation.zh: 我也不再被无视。

translation.en: Thousands of people work full and part-time jobs, and live in their cars.
translation.zh: 无数的人在从事着全职和兼职的工作， 而且住在他们的车里。

translation.en: But society continues to stigmatize and criminalize living in your vehicle or on the streets.
translation.zh: 但是社会还继续污蔑他们 并视住在交通工具里或者睡在街上为犯罪。

translation.en: So the homeless, the working homeless, primarily remain invisible.
translation.zh: 所以那些无家可归，有工作但是无家可归的人，大部分还是隐藏着的。

translation.en: But if you ever meet one, engage them, encourage them, and offer them hope.
translation.zh: 但是如果你见到了， 雇用他们，鼓励他们，并给予他们希望。

translation.en: The human spirit can overcome anything if it has hope.
translation.zh: 只要有希望，人类的精神可以克服一切困难。

translation.en: And I'm not here to be the poster girl for the homeless.
translation.zh: 我并不是来这里为无家可归的人做宣传的。

translation.en: I'm not here to encourage you to give money to the next panhandler you meet.
translation.zh: 我不是来这里鼓励你们去施舍下一个你见到的乞丐。

translation.en: But I am here to tell you that, based on my experience, people are not where they live, where they sleep, or what their life situation is at any given time.
translation.zh: 而我在这里是来告诉你们，根据我过去的经历， 人不是由他们所住的地方， 睡得地方， 或者他们在任何一个时间的生活状态所决定的。

translation.en: Three years ago I was living in a van in a Wal-Mart parking lot, and today I'm speaking at TED.
translation.zh: 三年前，我住在一个停在 沃尔玛的停车场的汽车里。 而今天我却在TED演讲。

translation.en: Hope always, always finds a way. Thank you.
translation.zh: 希望永远，永远，会指引前路。谢谢。

translation.en: (Applause) A few years ago, my eyes were opened to the dark side of the construction industry.
translation.zh: （掌声） 几年前，我初次目睹了 房产建筑工业的阴暗面

translation.en: In 2006, young Qatari students took me to go and see the migrant worker camps.
translation.zh: 2006年，几个年轻的卡塔尔学生 带我去探访了移民工人的住所

translation.en: And since then I've followed the unfolding issue of worker rights.
translation.zh: 自从那时起，我就开始密切关注建筑工人的权益的相关问题

translation.en: In the last six months, more than 300 skyscrapers in the UAE have been put on hold or canceled.
translation.zh: 在过去的6个月中，阿联酋多达300座在建的摩天大厦 被迫暂停建造或取消

translation.en: Behind the headlines that lay behind these buildings is the fate of the often-indentured construction worker.
translation.zh: 在关于这些楼宇的头条新闻的背后， 是一个个往往被遗忘的建筑工人的命运

translation.en: 1.1 million of them.
translation.zh: 足足有110万之多

translation.en: Mainly Indian, Pakistani, Sri Lankan and Nepalese, these laborers risk everything to make money for their families back home.
translation.zh: 主要来自于印度，巴基斯坦，斯里兰卡， 的这些工人们，常常承担着失去一切的风险 在挣钱养活他们远在故乡的家人们

translation.en: They pay a middle-man thousands of dollars to be there.
translation.zh: 他们得付给约合几千美元的中介费才能到那里工作

translation.en: And when they arrive, they find themselves in labor camps with no water, no air conditioning, and their passports taken away.
translation.zh: 然而当他们到达目的地的，却发现自己身处劳工营，没有饮水， 没有空调，然后自己的护照又被扣走

translation.en: While it's easy to point the finger at local officials and higher authorities, 99 percent of these people are hired by the private sector, and so therefore we're equally, if not more, accountable.
translation.zh: 我们不难就这些情况指责那些当地官员和权力机关 可百分之九十九的劳工都是被私有产业所雇佣的 因此我们自己也同样负有责任。

translation.en: Groups like Buildsafe UAE have emerged, but the numbers are simply overwhelming.
translation.zh: 一些例如阿联酋安建(Buildsafe)的团体开始纷纷出现 但是问题的数量确实惊人

translation.en: In August 2008, UAE public officials noted that 40 percent of the country's 1,098 labor camps had violated minimum health and fire safety regulations.
translation.zh: 2008年8月的时候 阿联酋的官方表明 全国1098个劳工营中，百分之四十 都违反了最低健康及火灾安全标准

translation.en: And last summer, more than 10,000 workers protested for the non-payment of wages, for the poor quality of food, and inadequate housing.
translation.zh: 去年夏天，超过一万名劳工 一同抗议工资的拖欠 糟糕的食物和短缺的住房。

translation.en: And then the financial collapse happened.
translation.zh: 继而随着金融世界的崩盘，

translation.en: When the contractors have gone bust, as they've been overleveraged like everyone else, the difference is everything goes missing, documentation, passports, and tickets home for these workers.
translation.zh: 包工头也纷纷的破产了 这些工人像所有人一样，被过度的压榨 但区别在于他们失去了一切 文件，护照 归程的车票

translation.en: Currently, right now, thousands of workers are abandoned.
translation.zh: 现在呢，这一刻，数以千计的劳工们被无情的抛弃

translation.en: There is no way back home.
translation.zh: 没有办法回家

translation.en: And there is no way, and no proof of arrival.
translation.zh: 此外还没有办法证明他们当初合法入境

translation.en: These are the boom-and-bust refugees.
translation.zh: 这些就是那兴衰背后的难民

translation.en: The question is, as a building professional, as an architect, an engineer, as a developer, if you know this is going on, as we go to the sights every single week, are you complacent or complicit in the human rights violations?
translation.zh: 我们所要提出的问题是：作为房建的专业人士， 无论你是建筑师，工程师，或是开发商 如果你知道这些状况的发生 就像我们每周去工地查看时一样， 你会自满自足，并间接地 去违背人权吗？

translation.en: So let's forget your environmental footprint.
translation.zh: 那么让我们暂时忘却你的环境足迹

translation.en: Let's think about your ethical footprint.
translation.zh: 转而关注你的道义足迹

translation.en: What good is it to build a zero-carbon, energy efficient complex, when the labor producing this architectural gem is unethical at best?
translation.zh: 建造一个零炭平衡，能耗率高的建筑结构的同时 创造这个奇迹的的劳动力， 却受到极为不符道义的对待， 又有什么实在意义呢

translation.en: Now, recently I've been told I've been taking the high road.
translation.zh: 最近有人说我选择了崇高的方式

translation.en: But, quite frankly, on this issue, there is no other road.
translation.zh: 但是坦白的讲，在这个问题上 实在是没有其他的方式了

translation.en: So let's not forget who is really paying the price of this financial collapse.
translation.zh: 所以让我们不要忘记是那一群体在为这次金融世界的坍塌来埋单

translation.en: And that as we worry about our next job in the office, the next design that we can get, to keep our workers.
translation.zh: 当我们还在担心自己的下一份工作何去何从的时候 我们如何选择挽留自己劳工的最佳途径

translation.en: Let's not forget these men, who are truly dying to work.
translation.zh: 也让我们不要忘记这些拼了性命在工作的人们

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢大家

translation.en: (Applause) I'd like to ask you, what do these three people have in common?
translation.zh: 掌声 我想问一下大家 以下这三个人有什么共同之处?

translation.en: Well, you probably recognize the first person.
translation.zh: 你们可能都认得第一位

translation.en: I'm sure you're all avid "American Idol" watchers.
translation.zh: 我相信你们都是"美国偶像"的忠实观众

translation.en: But you might not recognize Aydah Al Jahani, who is a contestant, indeed a finalist, in the Poet of the Millions competition, which is broadcast out of Abu Dhabi, and seen throughout the Arab world.
translation.zh: 你们也许不认识Aydah Al Jahani 她是一位参赛选手，实际上 她是“百万诗人”比赛的决赛选手 这档节目不仅在阿卜杜比播出 在整个阿拉伯世界都有观众

translation.en: In this contest people have to write and recite original poetry, in the Nabati form of poetry, which is the traditional Bedouin form.
translation.zh: 这个比赛 要求选手创作并朗诵 原创诗歌，且为纳巴蒂体 这是一种传统的贝都因部落的诗歌形式

translation.en: And Lima Sahar was a finalist in the Afghan Star singing competition.
translation.zh: Lima Sahar也是一位决赛选手 她参加的是"阿富汗之星"歌唱比赛

translation.en: Now, before I go any further, yes, I know it all began with "Britain's Got Talent."
translation.zh: 在我继续之前 是的，我知道"英国达人"是此类节目的鼻祖

translation.en: But my point in discussing this is to show you -- I hope I'll be able to show you how these merit-based competitions, with equal access to everyone, with the winner selected via voting by SMS, are changing tribal societies.
translation.zh: 但我所说的重点 是想向大家说明-- 希望我可以讲清楚 这些比拼才艺的竞赛 人人均可参与 通过短信投票选出胜者 它们如何改变部落社会

translation.en: And I'm going to focus on Afghanistan and the Arab world with the UAE, how they're changing tribal societies, not by introducing Western ideas, but by being integrated into the language in those places.
translation.zh: 我将以阿富汗 和阿拉伯世界的阿联酋为例 他们改变部落社会的方法 并不是通过引入西方思想 而是通过融合各部落的语言

translation.en: It all begins with enjoyment.
translation.zh: 一切以娱乐开始

translation.en: Video: We are late to watch "Afghan Star."
translation.zh: 我们来不及看"阿富汗之星"了

translation.en: We are going to watch "Afghan Star." We are late.
translation.zh: 我们要看"阿富汗之星" 已经晚了

translation.en: We are running late.
translation.zh: 我们要晚了

translation.en: We must go to watch "Afghan Star."
translation.zh: 我们一定要去看"阿富汗之星"

translation.en: Cynthia Schneider: These programs are reaching incredibly deeply into society.
translation.zh: 这些节目已经深入人心

translation.en: In Afghanistan, people go to extraordinary lengths to be able to watch this program.
translation.zh: 在阿富汗，人们不远数里 为了能够看到这个节目

translation.en: And you don't necessarily have to have your own TV set.
translation.zh: 自家没有电视也没有关系

translation.en: People watch it all over the country also in public places.
translation.zh: 全国上下都在收看这一节目 甚至在公共场所都有得看

translation.en: But it goes beyond watching, because also, part of this is campaigning.
translation.zh: 但不仅仅是观看这么简单 因为，其中的一部分 是拉选票

translation.en: People become so engaged that they have volunteers, just like political volunteers anyway, who fan out over the countryside, campaigning for their candidate.
translation.zh: 人人参与 甚至还有志愿者，类似政治选举的志愿者 他们跑遍全国上下 为他们支持的选手拉票

translation.en: Contestants also put themselves forward.
translation.zh: 选手们也主动推销自己

translation.en: Now, of course there is a certain degree of ethnic allegiance, but not entirely.
translation.zh: 当然，一些人只把选票投给来自本地区的选手，但并非完全如此

translation.en: Because each year the winner has come from a different tribal group.
translation.zh: 因为每年的冠军都来自不同的部落

translation.en: This has opened up the door, particularly for women.
translation.zh: 谁都可以报名参赛 尤其是对于女性来说

translation.en: And in the last season there were two women in the finalists.
translation.zh: 上一个赛季，有两位女选手闯入了决赛

translation.en: One of them, Lima Sahar, is a Pashtun from Kandahar, a very conservative part of the country.
translation.zh: 其中一位的Lima Sahar是普什图族人，来自坎大哈 一个非常保守的地区

translation.en: And here she relates, in the documentary film "Afghan Star," how her friends urged her not to do this and told her that she was leaving them for democracy.
translation.zh: 在"阿富汗之星"的记录片中，她告诉我们 她的朋友们劝她不要参赛 说她为了民主背离了他们

translation.en: But she also confides that she knows that members of the Taliban are actually SMS-ing votes in for her.
translation.zh: 但同时她透露 她知道有塔利班基地组织成员 发短信为她投票

translation.en: Aydah Al Jahnani also took risks and put herself out, to compete in the Poet of the Millions competition.
translation.zh: Aydah Al Jahnani也是冒风险 去参加 “百万诗人”的比赛

translation.en: I have to say, her husband backed her from the start.
translation.zh: 我必须说，她的丈夫从一开始就支持她

translation.en: But her tribe and family urged her not to compete and were very much against it.
translation.zh: 但是她的部落和家庭都不支持 甚至极力反对她参加

translation.en: But, once she started to win, then they got behind her again.
translation.zh: 但当她开始赢得比赛时 他们就开始支持她了

translation.en: It turns out that competition and winning is a universal human value.
translation.zh: 看来竞争和好胜是全人类的价值取向

translation.en: And she's out there.
translation.zh: 她参加比赛

translation.en: Her poetry is about women, and the life of women in society.
translation.zh: 写的诗歌是关于女性 以及社会中妇女生活情况的

translation.en: So just by presenting herself and being in competition with men -- this shows the voting on the program -- it sets a very important example for young women -- these are young women in the audience of the program -- in Abu Dhabi, but also people in the viewing audience.
translation.zh: 仅仅通过展现自己 和男性同台竞技 从节目的投票结果可以看出 她为年轻女性做出了很好的榜样 节目观众中有年轻女性 在阿卜杜比，还有电视机前的观众

translation.en: Now you'd think that "American Idol" would introduce a measure of Americanization.
translation.zh: 你们可能认为"美国偶像" 会带来美国化的潮流

translation.en: But actually, just the opposite is happening.
translation.zh: 但事实却恰恰相反

translation.en: By using this engaging popular format for traditional, local culture, it actually, in the Gulf, is precipitating a revival of interest in Nabati poetry, also in traditional dress and dance and music.
translation.zh: 通过全民动员的形式 弘扬传统本土文化 实际上促使海湾地区人民 重拾对纳巴蒂体诗歌的关注 传统服饰、舞蹈、音乐也开始得到复兴

translation.en: And for Afghanistan, where the Taliban banned music for many years, it is reintroducing their traditional music.
translation.zh: 在阿富汗 塔利班管制音乐已多年 这个活动重新向人们介绍了他们的传统音乐

translation.en: They don't sing pop songs, they sing Afghan music.
translation.zh: 他们不唱流行歌曲 他们唱阿富汗民歌

translation.en: And they also have learned how to lose gracefully, without avenging the winner.
translation.zh: 他们也开始学会体面地接受失败 而不是对胜出者进行报复

translation.en: (Laughter) No small thing.
translation.zh: (笑声) 样样都很重要

translation.en: And the final, sort of, formulation of this "American Idol" format, which has just appeared in Afghanistan, is a new program called "The Candidate."
translation.zh: 最后，一种 终极版的“美国偶像”形式的节目 在阿富汗新鲜出炉 这档节目叫做“候选人”

translation.en: And in this program, people present policy platforms that are then voted on.
translation.zh: 在节目中，人们提出 政策主张，然后进行投票

translation.en: Many of them are too young to run for president, but by putting the issues out there, they are influencing the presidential race.
translation.zh: 虽然许多参赛选手太年轻，不能竞选总统 但通过提出提议 他们影响着总统竞选

translation.en: So for me, the substance of things unseen is how reality TV is driving reality.
translation.zh: 对我来说，潜在的意义是 看真人秀节目如何影响现实

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢

translation.en: (Applause) I started my journey 30 years ago.
translation.zh: （掌声） 我是30年前开始旅程的。

translation.en: And I worked in mines. And I realized that this was a world unseen.
translation.zh: 那时我在矿上工作。我意识到 这是一个鲜为人知的角落。

translation.en: And I wanted, through color and large format cameras and very large prints, to make a body of work that somehow became symbols of our use of the landscape, how we use the land.
translation.zh: 我想要通过彩色大幅面照相机 冲印出非常大的照片， 使作品从某种程度上，成为表现人类如何利用土地的象征。 成为表现人类如何利用土地的象征。 成为表现人类如何利用土地的象征。 成为表现人类如何利用土地的象征。

translation.en: And to me this was a key component that somehow, through this medium of photography, which allows us to contemplate these landscapes, that I thought photography was perfectly suited to doing this type of work.
translation.zh: 对我来说 关键的一点，就是通过摄影的方法 使我们思考这些风景的深层含义， 我认为摄影非常适合这项工作。 我认为摄影非常适合这项工作。

translation.en: And after 17 years of photographing large industrial landscapes, it occurred to me that oil is underpinning the scale and speed.
translation.zh: 拍摄了17年大型工业风景后， 我发现 石油是工业的规模和速度的基础，

translation.en: Because that is what has changed, is the speed at which we're taking all our resources.
translation.zh: 因为改变的是我们攫取资源的速度。 因为改变的是我们攫取资源的速度。

translation.en: And so then I went out to develop a whole series on the landscape of oil.
translation.zh: 所以我拍摄了整整一系列的石油风景照片。 所以我拍摄了整整一系列的石油风景照片。

translation.en: And what I want to do is to kind of map an arc that there is extraction, where we're taking it from the ground, refinement. And that's one chapter.
translation.zh: 我要绘制出这样一系列主题。 第一个主题，石油开采和提炼。 第一个主题，石油开采和提炼。

translation.en: The other chapter that I wanted to look at was how we use it -- our cities, our cars, our motorcultures, where people gather around the vehicle as a celebration.
translation.zh: 第二个主题是我们如何使用： 在城市里 汽车里，我们的“汽车文化“ 人们开车聚到一起欢庆的活动。 人们开车聚到一起欢庆的活动。

translation.en: And then the third one is this idea of the end of oil, this entropic end, where all of our parts of cars, our tires, oil filters, helicopters, planes -- where are the landscapes where all of that stuff ends up?
translation.zh: 第三个主题就是石油的终点。 混乱的终点。 所有的汽车零件，轮胎 滤油气 直升机，飞机 所有这一切的坟场的风景？

translation.en: And to me, again, photography was a way in which I could explore and research the world, and find those places.
translation.zh: 对于我来说，摄影就是我探索这个世界找到这些地方的途径。 对于我来说，摄影就是我探索这个世界找到这些地方的途径。 对于我来说，摄影就是我探索这个世界找到这些地方的途径。

translation.en: And another idea that I had as well, that was brought forward by an ecologist -- he basically did a calculation where he took one liter of gas and said, well, how much carbon it would take, and how much organic material?
translation.zh: 我还有一个想法， 是由一位生态学者提出的。 他计算了一升汽油需要耗费多少碳、多少有机物质。 他计算了一升汽油需要耗费多少碳、多少有机物质。 他计算了一升汽油需要耗费多少碳、多少有机物质。

translation.en: It was 23 metric tons for one liter.
translation.zh: 需要每升23吨。

translation.en: So whenever I fill up my gas, I think of that liter, and how much carbon.
translation.zh: 所以每当我加满油后， 我就想到要耗费多少碳。

translation.en: And I know that oil comes from the ocean and phytoplankton, but he did the calculations for our Earth and what it had to do to produce that amount of energy.
translation.zh: 我知道石油来源于海洋浮游植物。 他还计算了地球需要多长时间产生这些能量。 他还计算了地球需要多长时间产生这些能量。

translation.en: From the photosynthetic growth, it would take 500 years of that growth to produce what we use, the 30 billion barrels we use per year.
translation.zh: 依靠光合作用，得需要500年才能生成每年300亿桶石油所含的能量。 依靠光合作用，得需要500年才能生成每年300亿桶石油所含的能量。 依靠光合作用，得需要500年才能长出每年300亿桶石油所含的能量。

translation.en: And that also brought me to the fact that this poses such a risk to our society.
translation.zh: 这也昭示了我们社会面临的危机。 这也昭示了我们社会面临的危机。

translation.en: Looking at 30 billion per year, we look at our two largest suppliers, Saudi Arabia and now Canada, with its dirty oil.
translation.zh: 300亿桶每年， 看看两大石油出口国， 沙特和加拿大。

translation.en: And together they only form about 15 years of supply.
translation.zh: 他们加在一起只能供应15年。

translation.en: The whole world, at 1.2 trillion estimated reserves, only gives us about 45 years.
translation.zh: 全世界估计有1.2万亿桶的储量， 只够我们用45年的。

translation.en: So, it's not a question of if, but a question of when peak oil will come upon us.
translation.zh: 问题已经不是石油峰值是否会来，而是何时来临。 问题已经不是石油峰值是否会来，而是何时来临。

translation.en: So, to me, using photography -- and I feel that all of us need to now begin to really take the task of using our talents, our ways of thinking, to begin to deal with what I think is probably one of the most challenging issues of our time, how to deal with our energy crisis.
translation.zh: 所以对于我来说，利用摄影 我认为应该开始利用我们的才干处理我们这个时代面临的最大挑战。 我认为应该开始利用我们的才干处理我们这个时代面临的最大挑战。 我认为应该开始利用我们的才干处理我们这个时代面临的最大挑战。 我认为应该开始利用我们的才干处理我们这个时代面临的最大挑战。 我认为应该开始利用我们的才干处理我们这个时代面临的最大挑战。 处理我们的能源危机。

translation.en: And I would like to say that, on the other side of it, 30, 40 years from now, the children that I have, I can look at them and say, "We did everything we possibly, humanly could do, to begin to mitigate this, what I feel is one of the most important and critical moments in our time. Thank you.
translation.zh: 从另一方面来说， 30，40年后我可以对我的孩子说：“ 30，40年后我可以对我的孩子说：“ 我们尽我们所能缓解危机。“ 我们尽我们所能缓解危机。“ 现在就是我们这个时代最重要最关键的时刻。 现在就是我们这个时代最重要最关键的时刻。谢谢。

translation.en: (Applause) Once upon a time, at the age of 24, I was a student at St. John's Medical College in Bangalore.
translation.zh: （掌声） 很久以前， 当我还是24岁之时， 我尚是一名位于班加罗尔的圣约翰医学院的学生。

translation.en: I was a guest student during one month of a public health course.
translation.zh: 当时，我是一名为期一个月的 公共卫生课程的旁听生。

translation.en: And that changed my mindset forever.
translation.zh: 我的思维模式从那时起开始改变。

translation.en: The course was good, but it was not the course content in itself that changed the mindset.
translation.zh: 这是一门好课程，但改变我思维模式的 不是这门课程本身。

translation.en: It was the brutal realization, the first morning, that the Indian students were better than me.
translation.zh: 而是因在第一天早晨， 我发现印度学生的表现 居然比我还要优秀，这个残酷的现实。

translation.en: (Laughter) You see, I was a study nerd.
translation.zh: （笑声） 如你所见，我是一个书呆子。

translation.en: I loved statistics from a young age.
translation.zh: 当我年轻时，我对数据有狂热的喜好。

translation.en: And I studied very much in Sweden.
translation.zh: 而且我在瑞典学习时很用功。

translation.en: I used to be in the upper quarter of all courses I attended.
translation.zh: 我曾在所有课程中都名列前茅。

translation.en: But in St. John's, I was in the lower quarter.
translation.zh: 但在圣约翰时，我却名落孙山了。

translation.en: And the fact was that Indian students studied harder than we did in Sweden.
translation.zh: 我不得不承认，印度学生 比瑞典学生要刻苦努力多了。

translation.en: They read the textbook twice, or three times or four times.
translation.zh: 他们会三番四次地 阅读他们的课本。

translation.en: In Sweden we read it once and then we went partying.
translation.zh: 而在瑞典，读完一次后，我们就去夜夜笙歌了。

translation.en: (Laugher) And that, to me, that personal experience was the first time in my life that the mindset I grew up with was changed.
translation.zh: （笑声） 这对于我的 意义是在于 我生而知之的思维方式 第一次 被改变了。

translation.en: And I realized that perhaps the Western world will not continue to dominate the world forever.
translation.zh: 我意识到 西方世界或许 不再是霸权国家了。

translation.en: And I think many of you have the same sort of personal experience.
translation.zh: 我想你们都大概有这种体验。

translation.en: It's that realization of someone you meet that really made you change your ideas about the world.
translation.zh: 那种遇到某个人使你的世界观 发生天翻地覆地改变的经历。

translation.en: It's not the statistics, although I tried to make it funny.
translation.zh: 这些都不是数据，虽然我试着让它听起来有趣。

translation.en: And I will now, here, onstage, try to predict when that will happen -- that Asia will regain its dominant position as the leading part of the world, as it used to be, over thousands of years.
translation.zh: 现在， 我，将在这个台上， 来预测亚洲 什么时候会 重夺其导向世界的 主导地位， 正如过去数千年一般。

translation.en: And I will do that by trying to predict precisely at what year the average income per person in India, in China, will reach that of the West.
translation.zh: 而且我会尽可能地 得到一个精准的预测 来说明 印度和中国的人均收入 何时会达到西方的水平。

translation.en: And I don't mean the whole economy, because to grow an economy of India to the size of U.K. -- that's a piece of cake, with one billion people.
translation.zh: 我不是指整体的经济实力， 对于印度来说 赶超英国的整体经济实力 是小菜一碟，因为他们拥有十亿人口。

translation.en: But I want to see when will the average pay, the money for each person, per month, in India and China, when will that have reached that of U.K. and the United States?
translation.zh: 但是我所想见得是 印度和中国的 人均收入 什么时候会追上英国和美国的水平？

translation.en: But I will start with a historical background.
translation.zh: 首先，我会介绍一下历史背景。

translation.en: And you can see my map if I get it up here. You know?
translation.zh: 请问你们可以看到我的数据图么？可以吗？

translation.en: I will start at 1858.
translation.zh: 我会从1858年开始。

translation.en: 1858 was a year of great technological advancement in the West.
translation.zh: 1858年是西方科技水平 大跃进的一年。

translation.en: That was the year when Queen Victoria was able, for the first time, to communicate with President Buchanan, through the Transatlantic Telegraphic Cable.
translation.zh: 在这一年，维多利亚皇后 可以和布坎南总统 通过跨大西洋电报电缆 来交流，这是有史以来的第一次。

translation.en: And they were the first to "Twitter" transatlantically.
translation.zh: 他们，是第一对跨大西洋的推客。

translation.en: (Laughter) (Applause) And I've been able, through this wonderful Google and Internet, to find the text of the telegram sent back from President Buchanan to Queen Victoria.
translation.zh: （笑声） （鼓掌） 而我，通过神奇的谷歌和网络 找到了布坎南总统 回发给维多利亚皇后的电报。

translation.en: And it ends like this: "This telegraph is a fantastic instrument to diffuse religion, civilization, liberty and law throughout the world."
translation.zh: 它的结尾时这样的：“这个电报 将是一种可向世界传播宗教、 文明、自由和法律的神奇工具。”

translation.en: Those are nice words. But I got sort of curious of what he meant with liberty, and liberty for whom.
translation.zh: 这句话很动听。可是，我很好奇 他说的是何种自由，以及是何人的自由。

translation.en: And we will think about that when we look at the wider picture of the world in 1858.
translation.zh: 这势必让我们回想起 在1858年时，世界各地都发生了什么。

translation.en: Because 1858 was also watershed year in the history of Asia.
translation.zh: 因为1858年 同时也是亚洲历史的 分水岭。

translation.en: 1858 was the year when the courageous uprising against the foreign occupation of India was defeated by the British forces.
translation.zh: 1858年， 印度所爆发的 民族大起义 被英军镇压了。

translation.en: And India was up to 89 years more of foreign domination.
translation.zh: 印度因此继续忍受了89年的外人统治。

translation.en: 1858 in China was the victory in the Opium War by the British forces.
translation.zh: 中国在1858年 再一次在鸦片战争中输给了英国。

translation.en: And that meant that foreigners, as it said in the treaty, were allowed to trade freely in China.
translation.zh: 因此在签订的（不平等）条约中 说明外国人在中国可自由通商。

translation.en: It meant paying with opium for Chinese goods.
translation.zh: 这意味着用鸦片换取中国商品。

translation.en: And 1858 in Japan was the year when Japan had to sign the Harris Treaty and accept trade on favorable condition for the U.S.
translation.zh: 日本在1858年， 被迫签订安政条约 以及承认美日贸易优先权。

translation.en: And they were threatened by those black ships there, that had been in Tokyo harbor over the last year.
translation.zh: 因为他们在这几年 被东京港里的黑船威胁。

translation.en: But, Japan, in contrast to India and China, maintained its national sovereignty.
translation.zh: 但日本仍拥有国家主权， 不像印度和中国那样。

translation.en: And let's see how much difference that can make.
translation.zh: 让我们来看看这将带来多大的差异。

translation.en: And I will do that by bringing these bubbles back to a Gapminder graph here, where you can see each bubble is a country.
translation.zh: 我将带着这些泡泡 回到Gapminder软件上， 在这里，每个泡泡都代表着一个国家。

translation.en: The size of the bubble here is the population.
translation.zh: 人口是由泡泡的大小所代表。

translation.en: On this axis, as I used to have income per person in comparable dollar.
translation.zh: 一般横轴都代表人均收入。

translation.en: And on that axis I have life expectancy, the health of people.
translation.zh: 竖轴则代表人均寿命。

translation.en: And I also bring an innovation here.
translation.zh: 今天，我又一次带来了一件发明。

translation.en: I have transformed the laser beam into an ecological, recyclable version here, in green India.
translation.zh: 为了绿色印度，我将激光束转换成 一根生态友好型木棒。

translation.en: (Applause) And we will see, you know.
translation.zh: （鼓掌） 正如你们所料一样。

translation.en: Look here, 1858, India was here, China was here, Japan was there, United States and United Kingdom was richer over there.
translation.zh: 1858年，印度和中国是在这里， 日本则在那里。 美国和英国 则更是在那边。

translation.en: And I will start the world like this.
translation.zh: 世界将从这样开始。

translation.en: India was not always like this level.
translation.zh: 印度以前不是这样的。

translation.en: Actually if we go back into the historical record, there was a time hundreds of years ago when the income per person in India and China was even above that of Europe.
translation.zh: 让我们回想百年以前的 印度和中国， 那时，两国的人均收入 是比欧洲的水平还高。

translation.en: But 1850 had already been many, many years of foreign domination, and India had been de-industrialized.
translation.zh: 然而，在1850年时，两国已饱受多年的外国侵略， 何况印度的工业能力还被削弱。

translation.en: And you can see that the countries who were growing their economy was United States and United Kingdom.
translation.zh: 而经济正在发展的国家 则是英美两国。

translation.en: And they were also, by the end of the century, getting healthy, and Japan was starting to catch up.
translation.zh: 在十九世纪末时，他们的国民身体素质也得以改善， 至于日本则开始奋起直追。

translation.en: India was trying down here.
translation.zh: 偏偏印度还深陷泥沼。

translation.en: Can you see how it starts to move there?
translation.zh: 你们可以看见他的确是在动吗？

translation.en: But really, really natural sovereignty was good for Japan.
translation.zh: 国家主权完整使日本受益匪浅。

translation.en: And Japan is trying to move up there.
translation.zh: 日本一直在尝试赶上去。

translation.en: And it's the new century now. Health is getting better, United Kingdom, United States.
translation.zh: 新世界到了。英美两国的国民 身体素质更加强化了。

translation.en: But careful now -- we are approaching the First World War.
translation.zh: 但要小心，一战的脚步已经近了。

translation.en: And the First World War, you know, we'll see a lot of deaths and economical problems here.
translation.zh: 正如你所料，在一战期间 会爆发很多经济问题和导致死亡。

translation.en: United Kingdom is going down.
translation.zh: 英国在走下坡路。

translation.en: And now comes the Spanish flu also.
translation.zh: 西班牙流感又接踵而来。

translation.en: And then after the First World War, they continue up.
translation.zh: 一战后，他们继续向上攀升。

translation.en: Still under foreign domination, and without sovereignty, India and China are down in the corner.
translation.zh: 印中两国由于仍被外来政权统治着， 因此他们还在下面的角落里。

translation.en: Not much has happened.
translation.zh: 无甚变化。

translation.en: They have grown their population but not much more.
translation.zh: 只是人口有所增加罢了。

translation.en: In the 1930's now, you can see that Japan is going to a period of war, with lower life expectancy.
translation.zh: 现在到了三十年代， 日本正处于战争时期， 国民寿命普遍低下。

translation.en: And the Second World War was really a terrible event, also economically for Japan.
translation.zh: 二战对日本来说，尤其在经济上， 是一场噩梦。

translation.en: But they did recover quite fast afterwards.
translation.zh: 但战后他们恢复的相对迅速。

translation.en: And we are moving into the new world.
translation.zh: 我们正迈向新世界。

translation.en: In 1947 India finally gained its independence.
translation.zh: 印度终于于1947年 成独立国家。

translation.en: And they could raise the Indian flag and become a sovereign nation, but in very big difficulties down there.
translation.zh: 他们可以升起他们自己的国旗并且成为一主权国家， 却仍举步维艰。

translation.en: (Applause) In 1949 we saw the emergence of the modern China in a way which surprised the world.
translation.zh: (鼓掌) 在1949年，新中国的诞生 使全世界都为之惊奇。

translation.en: And what happened?
translation.zh: 之后发生了什么？

translation.en: What happens in the after independence?
translation.zh: 在独立之后发生了什么？

translation.en: You can see that the health started to improve.
translation.zh: 正如你所见，国民的健康有所进步。

translation.en: Children started to go to school.
translation.zh: 儿童们有学上。

translation.en: Health services were provided.
translation.zh: 医疗设施也逐渐出现。

translation.en: This is the Great Leap Forward, when China fell down.
translation.zh: 现正是大跃进时期，中国摔了一大跤。

translation.en: It was central planning by Mao Tse Tung.
translation.zh: 这是由毛泽东统一计划的。

translation.en: China recovered. Then they said, "Nevermore, stupid central planning."
translation.zh: 中国恢复元气后， 他们则说：“前事不忘，后事之师。”

translation.en: But they went up here, and India was trying to follow.
translation.zh: 中国又日趋上升，印度则是吊车尾。

translation.en: And they were catching up indeed.
translation.zh: 他们都正迎头赶上。

translation.en: And both countries had the better health, but still a very low economy.
translation.zh: 两国的国民健康大大改善， 然后经济水平仍有待提高。

translation.en: And we came to 1978, and Mao Tse Tung died, and a new guy turned up from the left.
translation.zh: 现在来到1978年，毛泽东已去世， 新一代领导出现。

translation.en: And it was Deng Xiaoping coming out here.
translation.zh: 而邓小平正冉冉上升。

translation.en: And he said, "Doesn't matter if a cat is white or black, as long as it catches mice."
translation.zh: 他说：“不管 黑猫白猫，抓到老鼠 就是好猫。”

translation.en: Because catching mice is what the two cats wanted to do.
translation.zh: 因为这正是 这两只大猫想做的。

translation.en: And you can see the two cats being here, China and India, wanting to catch the mices over there, you know.
translation.zh: 正如你们所知，中印两只大猫 是想要抓住那边的老鼠。

translation.en: And they decided to go not only for health and education, but also starting to grow their economy.
translation.zh: 因此他们决定不仅要发展教育和公共卫生， 也要开始发展经济。

translation.en: And the market reformer was successful there.
translation.zh: 改革开放是成功的。

translation.en: In '92 India follows with a market reform.
translation.zh: 在1992年印度也开始了经济改革。

translation.en: And they go quite closely together, and you can see that the similarity with India and China, in many ways, are greater than the differences with them.
translation.zh: 他们走的很近， 而且两国颇多相似之处， 而且差异不多。

translation.en: And here they march on. And will they catch up?
translation.zh: 他们齐头并进。可是能迎头赶上么？

translation.en: This is the big question today.
translation.zh: 这是现今世界的一个大问题。

translation.en: There they are today.
translation.zh: 今天，他们处在哪里。

translation.en: Now what does it mean that the -- (Applause) the averages there -- this is the average of China.
translation.zh: 这说明了—— (掌声) 他们的平均水平，这是中国的平均水平。

translation.en: If I would split China, look here, Shanghai has already catched up.
translation.zh: 假如将中国分开来看， 看，上海已经赶上了。

translation.en: Shanghai is already there.
translation.zh: 上海已经在上面哪里。

translation.en: And it's healthier than the United States.
translation.zh: 而且市民的平均寿命比美国还长。

translation.en: But on the other hand, Guizhou, one of the poorest inland provinces of China, is there.
translation.zh: 然而，贵州，中国最穷的 一个内陆省，在那里。

translation.en: And if I split Guizhou into urban and rural, the rural part of Guizhou goes down there.
translation.zh: 假如我将贵州分成城市和乡下两部分， 贵州乡下仍继续下滑。

translation.en: You see this enormous inequity in China, in the midst of fast economic growth.
translation.zh: 在中国的迅速经济发展下， 隐藏着极大的问题。

translation.en: And if I would also look at India, you have another type of inequity, actually, in India.
translation.zh: 我们再来看看印度， 我们会看到另一种不平等。

translation.en: The geographical, macro-geographical difference is not so big.
translation.zh: 从地理的角度上来看，差距不大。

translation.en: Uttar Pradesh, the biggest of the states here, is poorer and has a lower health than the rest of India.
translation.zh: 北方邦，是印度的最大邦， 比起其他邦来说是较为贫穷落后的。

translation.en: Kerala is flying on top there, matching United States in health, but not in economy.
translation.zh: 克拉拉邦则处于领先地位， 而且就公共卫生一项来说已赶上了美国， 偏偏不包括经济。

translation.en: And here, Maharashtra, with Mumbai, is forging forward.
translation.zh: 这里，孟买的所在邦，马哈拉斯特拉邦， 正向前迈进。

translation.en: Now in India, the big inequities are within the state, rather than between the states.
translation.zh: 在印度，不平等是体现在邦内， 而非邦与邦之间。

translation.en: And that is not a bad thing, in itself.
translation.zh: 这并不是一件坏事。

translation.en: If you have a lot inequity, macro-geographical inequities can be more difficult in the long term to deal with, than if it is in the same area where you have a growth center relatively close to where poor people are living.
translation.zh: 假如在宏观地理上有太大差距， 这将会成为一长期隐患， 但在每个区域都有一经济发展中心， 并且离穷人居住区近的话，这将会更好。

translation.en: No, there is one more inequity. Look there, United States.
translation.zh: 看，这还有一不平等的问题。看这里，美国。

translation.en: (Laughter) Oh, they broke my frame.
translation.zh: (笑声) 他已将我的框框撑破。

translation.en: Washington, D.C. went out here.
translation.zh: 华盛顿特区已跑到那里。

translation.en: My friends at Gapminder wanted me to show this because there is a new leader in Washington who is really concerned about the health system.
translation.zh: 我在Gapminder的朋友想我将这展现给你们 因为现在白宫有了新主人 而且很关心公共卫生体系。

translation.en: And I can understand him, because Washington, D.C.
translation.zh: 况且我也明白他的心情，因为华盛顿特区

translation.en: is so rich over there but they are not as healthy as Kerala.
translation.zh: 居民收入已非常之高 但却比克拉拉邦的居民还短命。

translation.en: It's quite interesting, isn't it?
translation.zh: 很有趣是吧。

translation.en: (Applause) I can see a business opportunity for Kerala, helping fix the health system in the United States.
translation.zh: (鼓掌) 我帮克拉拉邦找到一生意， 就是去帮美国建设他们的公共卫生体系。

translation.en: (Laughter) (Applause) Now here we have the whole world. You have the legend down there.
translation.zh: (笑声) (鼓掌) 现在来看看全球。图例则在这里。

translation.en: And when you see the two giant cats here, pushing forward, you see that in between them and ahead of them, is the whole emerging economies of the world, which Thomas Friedman so correctly called the "flat world."
translation.zh: 你们看到这两只巨猫在跋涉向前， 在他们之间 或在他们前面， 正是现时的全球经济， 这就是托马斯·弗里德曼所说的“世界是平的”。

translation.en: You can see that in health and education, a large part of the world population is putting forward, but in Africa, and other parts, as in rural Guizhou in China, there is still people with low health and very low economy.
translation.zh: 你可以看见，很大一部分的 世界人口中的卫生和教育体系正在进步， 只是在非洲，或者其他地方， 如中国的贵州乡下， 仍然有许多人处在困境之中。

translation.en: We have an enormous disparity in the world.
translation.zh: 现今世界贫富差距悬殊。

translation.en: But most of the world in the middle are pushing forwards very fast.
translation.zh: 但大多中间阶层国家都进步的很快。

translation.en: Now, back to my projections.
translation.zh: 好，回到我的预测。

translation.en: When will it catch up? I have to go back to very conventional graph.
translation.zh: 但两国何时能迎头赶上？我们必须使用传统图表。

translation.en: I will show income per person on this axis instead, poor down here, rich up there.
translation.zh: 竖轴代表着人均收入， 穷富递进相增。

translation.en: And then time here, from 1858 I start the world.
translation.zh: 回溯到1858年 世界由此开始。

translation.en: And we shall see what will happen with these countries.
translation.zh: 让我们来观察下世界将会如何改变。

translation.en: You see, China under foreign domination actually lowered their income and came down to the Indian level here.
translation.zh: 中国正处于半殖民半封建时期 而他们国民收入已降低至印度的水准。

translation.en: Whereas U.K. and United States is getting richer and richer.
translation.zh: 同一时间，英美则越来越富有。

translation.en: And after Second World War, United States is richer than U.K.
translation.zh: 二战后，英国被美国赶超。

translation.en: But independence is coming here.
translation.zh: 与此同时，独立的曙光则洒在中印两国头上。

translation.en: Growth is starting, economic reform.
translation.zh: 经济经过改革后开始增长。

translation.en: Growth is faster, and with projection from IMF you can see where you expect them to be in 2014.
translation.zh: 增长速率加快，并且加上国际货币组织的预测 这正是两国于2014年会到达的水平。

translation.en: Now, the question is, "When will the catch up take place?"
translation.zh: 现时的问题则是：“他们何时会赶上？”

translation.en: Look at, look at the United States.
translation.zh: 再来回看下美国。

translation.en: Can you see the bubble?
translation.zh: 看的见那些泡泡？

translation.en: The bubbles, not my bubbles, but the financial bubbles.
translation.zh: 不是我的泡沫， 而是经济泡沫。

translation.en: That's the dot com bubble. This is the Lehman Brothers doorstep there.
translation.zh: 看，雷曼兄弟的门槛在这。

translation.en: You see it came down there.
translation.zh: 看这里的下滑趋势。

translation.en: And it seems this is another rock coming down there, you know.
translation.zh: 英国也因受影响而下滑。

translation.en: So they doesn't seem to go this way, these countries.
translation.zh: 这些国家走的并不是阳光大道。

translation.en: They seem to go in a more humble growth way, you know.
translation.zh: 反而是崎岖不平的。

translation.en: And people interested in growth are turning their eyes towards Asia.
translation.zh: 是故关注经济增长的人们 则转移视线至亚洲。

translation.en: I can compare to Japan. This is Japan coming up.
translation.zh: 我们将日本也加进来。日本是日趋上升。

translation.en: You see, Japan did it like that.
translation.zh: 日本是这样发展的。

translation.en: We add Japan to it.
translation.zh: 日本也加入美英的行列。

translation.en: And there is no doubt that fast catch up can take place.
translation.zh: 毫无疑问，他们追的很快 且赶上了。

translation.en: Can you see here what Japan did?
translation.zh: 看看日本怎么做的。

translation.en: Japan did it like this, until full catch up, and then they follow with the other high-income economies.
translation.zh: 直到完全赶上，日本是这样发展的， 接下来就紧随着高收入国家的脚步。

translation.en: But the real projections for those ones, I would like to give it like this.
translation.zh: 不过我做出的预测 则是这样的。

translation.en: Can be worse, can be better.
translation.zh: 是福祸相依的。

translation.en: It's always difficult to predict, especially about the future.
translation.zh: 未来是难以预测的。

translation.en: Now, a historian tells me it's even more difficult to predict about the past.
translation.zh: 偏偏有一位历史学家告诉我过去更难预测。

translation.en: (Laughter) I think I'm in a difficult position here.
translation.zh: (笑声) 我在左右为难中。

translation.en: Inequalities in China and India I consider really the big obstacle because to bring the entire population into growth and prosperity is what will create a domestic market, what will avoid social instability, and which will make use of the entire capacity of the population.
translation.zh: 中印两国的最大障碍 就是不平等， 要使百业具兴 则定要创建一国内市场 来避免社会的不稳定 并能使广大的群众 都投身其中。

translation.en: So, social investments in health, education and infrastructure, and electricity is really what is needed in India and China.
translation.zh: 所以中印两国绝需建设 完备的医疗，教育，电力等基础设施。

translation.en: You know the climate. We have great international experts within India telling us that the climate is changing, and actions has to be taken, otherwise China and India would be the countries most to suffer from climate change.
translation.zh: 气候是一全球问题。有一位印度的专家 指出全球气候正在变化 我们必须采取行动， 否则，中印两国 则会首当其冲。

translation.en: And I consider India and China the best partners in the world in a good global climate policy.
translation.zh: 我想中国和印度应是在 气候问题上的最佳伙伴。

translation.en: But they ain't going to pay for what others, who have more money, have largely created, and I can agree on that.
translation.zh: 但他们不应 为那些造成这些恶果的国家 背黑锅，而我认为也应这样做。

translation.en: But what I'm really worried about is war.
translation.zh: 但我最担心战争爆发。

translation.en: Will the former rich countries really accept a completely changed world economy, and a shift of power away from where it has been the last 50 to 100 to 150 years, back to Asia?
translation.zh: 那些现今的大国 能接受世界经济体系的改变 和承认已有50至100年，甚至是霸主地位的移交么 甚至是150年的 的霸主地位的移交么？

translation.en: And will Asia be able to handle that new position of being in charge of being the most mighty, and the governors of the world?
translation.zh: 抑或亚洲能够 承受住作为世界霸主的 压力和重担吗？

translation.en: So, always avoid war, because that always pushes human beings backward.
translation.zh: 因此一定要避免战争， 因为战争是人类倒退的罪魁祸首。

translation.en: Now if these inequalities, climate and war can be avoided, get ready for a world in equity, because this is what seems to be happening.
translation.zh: 若是这些问题都能被解决， 那么就准备迎来一平等的世界吧。 因为这正是历史的潮流。

translation.en: And that vision that I got as a young student, 1972, that Indians can be much better than Swedes, is just about to happen.
translation.zh: 这是我尚是一名学生时， 于1972年，得知印度人比瑞典人要好的多时， 所知道的未来。

translation.en: And it will happen precisely the year 2048 in the later part of the summer, in July, more precisely, the 27th of July.
translation.zh: 更准确些，这 将会在2048年发生， 会在季夏，7月份发生， 更精准些，是7月27日。

translation.en: (Applause) The 27th of July, 2048 is my 100th birthday.
translation.zh: (鼓掌) 2048年7月27日 是我的期颐之时。

translation.en: (Laughter) And I expect to speak in the first session of the 39th TED India.
translation.zh: (笑声) 而我则希望能在第一节 第39届TED印度大会上演讲。

translation.en: Get your bookings in time. Thank you very much.
translation.zh: 请及时预定座位！谢谢。

translation.en: (Applause) Today, I want you to look at children who become suicide bombers through a completely different lens.
translation.zh: (鼓掌) 今天，我要 通过不同的视角带各位领略 儿童人体炸弹。

translation.en: In 2009, there were 500 bomb blasts across Pakistan.
translation.zh: 2009年，在巴基斯坦 发生了500起爆炸。

translation.en: I spent the year working with children who were training to become suicide bombers and with Taliban recruiters, trying to understand how the Taliban were converting these children into live ammunition and why these children were actively signing up to their cause.
translation.zh: 我花了一年时间， 采访这些 即将踏上不归路的孩子们， 并采访了招募这些孩子的塔利班人员， 我尝试了解塔利班 如何将这些孩子 变成人体炸弹， 而这些孩子们又为何 自愿走上不归路。

translation.en: I want you to watch a short video from my latest documentary film, "Children of the Taliban."
translation.zh: 我最近拍摄的纪录片 有一段叫《塔利班的孩子们》。

translation.en: (Singing) The Taliban now run their own schools.
translation.zh: （吟唱） 塔利班现在有自己的学校，

translation.en: They target poor families and convince the parents to send their children.
translation.zh: 他们瞄准了贫苦人家， 说服家长把孩子交给他们。

translation.en: In return, they provide free food and shelter and sometimes pay the families a monthly stipend.
translation.zh: 作为回报，塔利班将免费提供食宿， 有时还每月发一些津贴给这些家庭。

translation.en: We've obtained a propaganda video made by the Taliban.
translation.zh: 我们得到一卷 塔利班制作的宣传片，

translation.en: Young boys are taught justifications for suicide attacks and the execution of spies.
translation.zh: 男孩们被灌输 自杀式袭击是正当合理的， 并要求他们处决间谍。

translation.en: I made contact with a child from Swat who studied in a madrassa like this.
translation.zh: 我和一个来自Swat（巴基斯坦边境上一县）的男孩取得联系， 他目前就读于一个类似的神学院。

translation.en: Hazrat Ali is from a poor farming family in Swat.
translation.zh: Hazrat Ali是来自 Swat的穷困农家，

translation.en: He joined the Taliban a year ago when he was 13.
translation.zh: 他一年前加入塔利班， 那年他13岁。

translation.en: How do the Taliban in your area get people to join them?
translation.zh: 塔利班在你的家乡是怎样招募新成员的？

translation.en: Hazrat Ali: They first call us to the mosque and preach to us.
translation.zh: Hazrat Ali：他们以来就叫我们去清真寺，听布道，

translation.en: Then they take us to a madrassa and teach us things from the Koran.
translation.zh: 然后我们被带到一个神学院， 学习《古兰经》。

translation.en: Sharmeen Obaid Chinoy: He tells me that children are then given months of military training.
translation.zh: Chinoy：他说孩子们 要参加好几个月的军训。

translation.en: HA: They teach us to use machine guns, Kalashnikov, rocket launchers, grenades, bombs.
translation.zh: Ali：我们学会用机关枪、AK47、 火箭筒、手榴弹和炸弹等。

translation.en: They ask us to use them only against the infidels.
translation.zh: 他们说我们只能对异教徒使用这些武器，

translation.en: Then they teach us to do a suicide attack.
translation.zh: 然后他们还教会我们自杀式袭击。

translation.en: SOC: Would you like to carry out a suicide attack?
translation.zh: Chinoy：你会执行自杀式袭击吗？

translation.en: HA: If God gives me strength.
translation.zh: Ali：愿真主赐我力量。

translation.en: SOC: I, in my research, have seen that the Taliban have perfected the way in which they recruit and train children, and I think it's a five-step process.
translation.zh: Chinoy：在我的研究中， 我曾看过塔利班 在招募和训练孩子们时， 将他们的行为美化。 这分为五步，

translation.en: Step one is that the Taliban prey on families that are large, that are poor, that live in rural areas.
translation.zh: 首先是 瞄准住在贫瘠土地上的贫穷 大家庭。

translation.en: They separate the parents from the children by promising to provide food, clothing, shelter to these children.
translation.zh: 他们把父母和孩子们分开， 向父母允诺给孩子提供衣食 以及居所。

translation.en: Then they ship them off, hundreds of miles away to hard-line schools that run along the Taliban agenda.
translation.zh: 然后把孩子们送到百里开外的地方， 送至硬汉学校， 在那接受塔利班的教育。

translation.en: Step two: They teach the children the Koran, which is Islam's holiest book, in Arabic, a language these children do not understand and cannot speak.
translation.zh: 第二步， 他们教孩子们读《古兰经》，也就是伊斯兰教的圣典， 但是是阿拉伯语的，孩子们根本不懂 也不会说，

translation.en: They rely very heavily on teachers, who I have personally seen distort the message to these children as and when it suits their purpose to.
translation.zh: 这样孩子们就只能依赖神学院的老师， 我个人觉得 这些老师扭曲了教义， 以达到他们的目的。

translation.en: These children are explicitly forbidden from reading newspapers, listening to radio, reading any books that the teachers do not prescribe them.
translation.zh: 这些孩子们被禁止 读报，听广播 或是 读课外书。

translation.en: If any child is found violating these rules, he is severely reprimanded.
translation.zh: 要是有孩子违反规定， 就会被严厉训斥。

translation.en: Effectively, the Taliban create a complete blackout of any other source of information for these children.
translation.zh: 这样，塔利班 完全禁止孩子们 接触其他资讯。

translation.en: Step three: The Taliban want these children to hate the world that they currently live in.
translation.zh: 第三步，塔利班要求孩子们 憎恨这个世界，

translation.en: So they beat these children -- I have seen it; they feed them twice a day dried bread and water; they rarely allow them to play games; they tell them that, for eight hours at a time, all they have to do is read the Koran.
translation.zh: 他们殴打孩子 我亲眼见过。 孩子一天只有两餐，就只有干面包和水。 塔利班基本不让孩子们玩耍， 孩子们 一天要诵读八小时《古兰经》。

translation.en: The children are virtual prisoners; they cannot leave, they cannot go home.
translation.zh: 这些孩子跟囚犯别一样 既不能离开学校，又不能回家，

translation.en: Their parents are so poor, they have no resources to get them back.
translation.zh: 他们的父母都太穷 没法接他们回家。

translation.en: Step four: The older members of the Taliban, the fighters, start talking to the younger boys about the glories of martyrdom.
translation.zh: 第四步，较年长的塔利班成员 又称战士， 会向孩子们灌输 殉教的光荣。

translation.en: They talk to them about how when they die, they will be received up with lakes of honey and milk, how there will be 72 virgins waiting for them in paradise, how there will be unlimited food, and how this glory is going to propel them to become heroes in their neighborhoods.
translation.zh: 并说，在他们死后， 会升天， 那里有流淌着牛奶和蜂蜜的湖水， 有72个处女 在天堂迎接他们， 那里有吃不完的食物， 这份荣誉 会使他们 成为乡间邻里的大英雄。

translation.en: Effectively, this is the brainwashing process that has begun.
translation.zh: 这就是洗脑 的全过程。

translation.en: Step five: I believe the Taliban have one of the most effective means of propaganda.
translation.zh: 最后一步， 也是最有效的 宣传武器

translation.en: Their videos that they use are intercut with photographs of men and women and children dying in Iraq and Afghanistan and in Pakistan.
translation.zh: 就是宣传片 是经过剪辑的照片， 有关伊拉克 阿富汗和巴基斯坦 死去的男人，女人和孩子。

translation.en: And the basic message is that the Western powers do not care about civilian deaths, so those people who live in areas and support governments that work with Western powers are fair game.
translation.zh: 以此说明西方强权 根本不在乎贫民死活， 所以这些人 就必须和政府 一起同西方强权合作。

translation.en: That's why Pakistani civilians, over 6,000 of whom have been killed in the last two years alone, are fair game.
translation.zh: 这也就是在过去两年里巴基斯坦 有超过六千贫民死亡 的原因。

translation.en: Now these children are primed to become suicide bombers.
translation.zh: 现在，这些孩子 被训练成人体炸弹，

translation.en: They're ready to go out and fight because they've been told that this is effectively their only way to glorify Islam.
translation.zh: 蓄势待发要投入战斗， 因为他们相信 这是唯一 荣耀真主的方法。

translation.en: I want you to watch another excerpt from the film.
translation.zh: 这是另一段视频

translation.en: This boy is called Zenola.
translation.zh: 这个男孩叫辛诺拉，

translation.en: He blew himself up, killing six.
translation.zh: 他自己送了命，同时还炸死六个人。

translation.en: This boy is called Sadik.
translation.zh: 这个男孩叫沙迪克，

translation.en: He killed 22.
translation.zh: 他炸死22人。

translation.en: This boy is called Messoud.
translation.zh: 这个男孩叫马苏德，

translation.en: He killed 28.
translation.zh: 他炸死了28人。

translation.en: The Taliban are running suicide schools, preparing a generation of boys for atrocities against civilians.
translation.zh: 塔利班开办的敢死队学校， 训练了整整一代孩子 以对贫民惨下毒手。

translation.en: Do you want to carry out a suicide attack?
translation.zh: 你会执行自杀式袭击任务吗？

translation.en: Boy: I would love to.
translation.zh: 男孩：非常乐意，

translation.en: But only if I get permission from my dad.
translation.zh: 但要得到父亲的同意才行。

translation.en: When I look at suicide bombers younger than me, or my age, I get so inspired by their terrific attacks.
translation.zh: 当我看到同龄或是更小的自杀袭击者， 他们的袭击让我斗志高昂。

translation.en: SOC: What blessing would you get from carrying out a suicide attack?
translation.zh: Chinoy：执行完任务， 你会得到什么？

translation.en: Boy: On the day of judgment, God will ask me, "Why did you do that?"
translation.zh: 男孩：审判日来临时，真主会问我： “你为何这样做？”

translation.en: I will answer, "My Lord! Only to make you happy!
translation.zh: 我会回答：“真主，只为了让您高兴！

translation.en: I have laid down my life fighting the infidels."
translation.zh: 我用生命来对抗异教徒。“

translation.en: Then God will look at my intention.
translation.zh: 真主会知道我的意图，

translation.en: If my intention was to eradicate evil for Islam, then I will be rewarded with paradise.
translation.zh: 我是为伊斯兰消灭恶行， 可以上天堂。

translation.en: Singer: ♫ On the day of judgment ♫ ♫ My God will call me ♫ ♫ My body will be put back together ♫ ♫ And God will ask me why I did this ♫ SOC: I leave you all with this thought: If you grew up in these circumstances, faced with these choices, would you choose to live in this world or in the glorious afterlife?
translation.zh: 歌声♫审判将临♫ ♫真主蒙召♫ ♫重塑吾躯♫ ♫真主问询 何以为此♫ Chinoy：请想一下 如果你成长在这样的环境里， 面对这样的选择， 你会选择活在这个世上， 抑或留得身后名？

translation.en: As one Taliban recruiter told me, "There will always be sacrificial lambs in this war."
translation.zh: 有一个塔利班招募人员告诉我 ”在这场战争里总要有人牺牲。“

translation.en: Thank you.
translation.zh: 谢谢。

translation.en: (Applause) In my industry, we believe that images can change the world.
translation.zh: （掌声） 干我们这行的人， 都相信图片是可以改变世界的。

translation.en: Okay, we're naive, we're bright-eyed and bushy-tailed.
translation.zh: 好吧，我们是很天真，我们又明亮的双眼和毛绒绒的尾巴。

translation.en: The truth is that we know that the images themselves don't change the world, but we're also aware that, since the beginning of photography, images have provoked reactions in people, and those reactions have caused change to happen.
translation.zh: 实际上，我们都知道， 图片本身不会改变世界。 但我们也清楚，摄影业刚发展起来的时候， 图片就已经在人群中激起了波澜。 而那些波澜就造成了变革。

translation.en: So let's begin with a group of images.
translation.zh: 大家先看一组图片吧。

translation.en: I'd be extremely surprised if you didn't recognize many or most of them.
translation.zh: 如果你们没认出它们中的大部分， 我会很吃惊的。

translation.en: They're best described as iconic: so iconic, perhaps, they're cliches.
translation.zh: 这些都是被称作“具有代表性”的图片。 太有代表性了，可能算陈词滥调了。

translation.en: In fact, they're so well-known that you might even recognize them in a slightly or somewhat different form.
translation.zh: 实际上，它们非常有名。 估计你都能 认出他们的另一种形式。

translation.en: (Laughter) But I think we're looking for something more.
translation.zh: （笑） 我觉得我们要的不止这些。

translation.en: We're looking for something more.
translation.zh: 我们需要更多。

translation.en: We're looking for images that shine an uncompromising light on crucial issues, images that transcend borders, that transcend religions, images that provoke us to step up and do something -- in other words, to act.
translation.zh: 我们需要那些 在关键问题上决不妥协的图片， 那些超越国界，超越宗教的图片， 那些 让我们勇敢站出来做些什么的图片。 也就是，去改变。

translation.en: Well, this image you've all seen.
translation.zh: 这幅图，你们都见过。

translation.en: It changed our view of the physical world.
translation.zh: 它改变了我们对物质世界的认知。

translation.en: We had never seen our planet from this perspective before.
translation.zh: 我们从没在这个角度看我们的星球。

translation.en: Many people credit a lot of the birth of the environmental movement to our seeing the planet like this for the first time -- its smallness, its fragility.
translation.zh: 很多人都把环保运动的开始， 归功于人们 第一次见到 这样的地球， 它那么小，那么脆弱。

translation.en: Forty years later, this group, more than most, are well aware of the destructive power that our species can wield over our environment.
translation.zh: 四十年后，这些环保团体， 逐渐意识到我们这个物种 对环境的毁灭性破坏力。

translation.en: And at last, we appear to be doing something about it.
translation.zh: 后来，我们开始对此采取行动。

translation.en: This destructive power takes many different forms.
translation.zh: 这些毁灭性破坏力表现在不同方面。

translation.en: For example, these images taken by Brent Stirton in the Congo.
translation.zh: 比方说布伦特·斯蒂尔顿(Brent Stirton) 在刚果拍摄的这些照片，

translation.en: These gorillas were murdered, some would even say crucified, and unsurprisingly, they sparked international outrage.
translation.zh: 这些大猩猩被人宰杀，可能你还会说它们被钉在十字架上。 毫无疑问， 这些照片在国际上引起了强烈反响。

translation.en: Most recently, we've been tragically reminded of the destructive power of nature itself with the recent earthquake in Haiti.
translation.zh: 最近， 海地的地震， 让我们认识到了大自然本身的破坏力。

translation.en: Well, I think what is far worse is man's destructive power over man.
translation.zh: 我觉得人类的自相残杀 比上面说的那些可怕的多。

translation.en: Samuel Pisar, an Auschwitz survivor, said, and I'll quote him, "The Holocaust teaches us that nature, even in its cruelest moments, is benign in comparison with man, when he loses his moral compass and his reason."
translation.zh: 萨缪尔·皮萨(Samuel Pisar)，一个奥斯威辛集中营的幸存者 曾经说过（我在这里引用他的话）， （纳粹对犹太人的）屠杀告诉我们， 自然，即使是它最残忍的时候， 和一个失去理智和道德准则的人比起来， 还是要仁慈的多。

translation.en: There's another kind of crucifixion.
translation.zh: 人类还有其他的暴行。

translation.en: The horrifying images from Abu Ghraib as well as the images from Guantanamo had a profound impact.
translation.zh: 美军虐囚的骇人图片， 还有这些关塔那摩的图片， 都产生了深远影响。

translation.en: The publication of those images, as opposed to the images themselves, caused a government to change its policies.
translation.zh: 相较于这些照片本身， 它们的公开， 才是让政府改变政策的原因。

translation.en: Some would argue that it is those images that did more to fuel the insurgency in Iraq than virtually any other single act.
translation.zh: 有些人认为，是这些照片 导致伊拉克的暴动进一步升级， 它们比其他任何行动更有影响力。

translation.en: Furthermore, those images forever removed the so-called moral high ground of the occupying forces.
translation.zh: 而且，这些照片永久性地摧毁了 驻伊美军的所谓道德高地。

translation.en: Let's go back a little.
translation.zh: 让我们回顾历史。

translation.en: In the 1960s and 1970s, the Vietnam War was basically shown in America's living rooms day in, day out.
translation.zh: 上世纪六七十年代， 越战的画面， 在电视上反复播放。

translation.en: News photos brought people face to face with the victims of the war: a little girl burned by napalm, a student killed by the National Guard at Kent State University in Ohio during a protest.
translation.zh: 新闻图片让人们 直面战争的受害者，被汽油弹烧伤的小女孩， 一个在俄亥俄州的肯特州立大学参与抗议活动 被镇压部队打死的学生。

translation.en: In fact, these images became the voices of protest themselves.
translation.zh: 实际上，这些照片 成为了最有力的抗议声音。

translation.en: Now, images have power to shed light of understanding on suspicion, ignorance, and in particular -- I've given a lot of talks on this but I'll just show one image -- the issue of HIV/AIDS.
translation.zh: 现在，照片有了 让怀疑与无知 重见光明的力量。 尤其是关于艾滋病的议题 ——我做过很多这方面的演讲， 这次就只给大家看一张照片——

translation.en: In the 1980s, the stigmatization of people with the disease was an enormous barrier to even discussing or addressing it.
translation.zh: 上世纪八十年代，对这种疾病的各种流言蜚语 让多数人 都不愿意讨论或提起它。

translation.en: A simple act, in 1987, of the most famous woman in the world, the Princess of Wales, touching an HIV/AIDS infected baby did a great deal, especially in Europe, to stop that.
translation.zh: 1987年，世界上最著名的一个女人，作了一件简单的事情， 戴安娜王妃， 抚摸了一个受艾滋病毒感染的婴儿。 这个举动消除了民众对艾滋病的误解，尤其在欧洲。

translation.en: She, better than most, knew the power of an image.
translation.zh: 她比多数人更清楚图片的力量。

translation.en: So when we are confronted by a powerful image, we all have a choice: We can look away, or we can address the image.
translation.zh: 当我们面对一张有影响力的照片时， 我们都可以选择。 我们可以看向别处，或者，我们可以让它为更多人所知。

translation.en: Thankfully, when these photos appeared in The Guardian in 1998, they put a lot of focus and attention and, in the end, a lot of money towards the Sudan famine relief efforts.
translation.zh: 值得庆幸地是， 当这些图片于1998年出现在英国《卫报》的时候， 人们开始关注它，最后为苏丹饥荒的灾民， 捐了很多钱。

translation.en: Did the images change the world?
translation.zh: 图片改变了世界吗？

translation.en: No, but they had a major impact.
translation.zh: 不，但他们产生了深远影响。

translation.en: Images often push us to question our core beliefs and our responsibilities to each other.
translation.zh: 图片常常让我们质疑自己的信念 还有我们对彼此的责任。

translation.en: We all saw those images after Katrina, and I think for millions of people they had a very strong impact.
translation.zh: 我们都看过卡特里纳飓风的图片， 我想这些图片对几百万人， 都产生了极大影响。

translation.en: And I think it's very unlikely that they were far from the minds of Americans when they went to vote in November 2008.
translation.zh: 在2008大选的时候， 让美国人不去想那些照片 是几乎不可能的。

translation.en: Unfortunately, some very important images are deemed too graphic or disturbing for us to see them.
translation.zh: 很遗憾的是，一些很重要的相片 因为太“真实”而不能公开。

translation.en: I'll show you one photo here, and it's a photo by Eugene Richards of an Iraq War veteran from an extraordinary piece of work, which has never been published, called War Is Personal.
translation.zh: 这里有一张。 这是尤金·理查兹(Eugene Richards) 为一位伊战退伍老兵拍的。 这个非同寻常的作品从来没有发表，它叫做“战争是每个人的”。

translation.en: But images don't need to be graphic in order to remind us of the tragedy of war.
translation.zh: 让我们想起战争残酷性的照片， 不一定都要如此“真实”。

translation.en: John Moore set up this photo at Arlington Cemetery.
translation.zh: 约翰·摩尔(John Moore)在亚灵顿公墓拍了这张照片。

translation.en: After all the tense moments of conflict in all the conflict zones of the world, there's one photograph from a much quieter place that haunts me still, much more than the others.
translation.zh: 在世界上那么多冲突地区 发生了那么多紧张的冲突，暴动之后 这张来自世界上最安静角落的图片， 才是让我感到最不安的。

translation.en: Ansel Adams said, and I'm going to disagree with him, "You don't take a photograph, you make it."
translation.zh: 安塞尔·亚当斯(Ansel Adams)说（但我不同意他的看法）， “人们从不拍照片，他们创作。”

translation.en: In my view, it's not the photographer who makes the photo, it's you.
translation.zh: 在我看来，创作的不是摄影师， 而是你们。

translation.en: We bring to each image our own values, our own belief systems, and as a result of that, the image resonates with us.
translation.zh: 我们把赋予每一张照片， 我们自己的价值观，自己的信念， 这样，我们和图片产生了共鸣。

translation.en: My company has 70 million images.
translation.zh: 我的公司拥有七千万照片，

translation.en: I have one image in my office.
translation.zh: 我的办公室有一张。

translation.en: Here it is.
translation.zh: 就是它。

translation.en: I hope that the next time you see an image that sparks something in you, you'll better understand why, and I know that speaking to this audience, you'll definitely do something about it.
translation.zh: 我希望下次你们看到一张 让你们产生灵感火花的照片时， 最好想想为什么。 我很清楚，我面前的这些听众， 你们肯定都会做些什么的。

translation.en: And thank you to all the photographers.
translation.zh: 感谢所有的摄影师。

translation.en: (Applause)
translation.zh: （掌声）
